Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SanjeevUk
Reviews.Content: Probably the best advantage of this hotel is its excellent location. Otherwise too it is well worth the money. The only slight criticism is that the quality of non-spanish cuisine can be improved............and the choice of in-house white wine can be improved upon immensely!

Reviews.Title: “good location.”
Reviews.Author: Riddlywalker
Reviews.Content: Good location, large rooms, geared up as a conference hotel rather than a family resort. Close to Monjuic for museums, and very good transport links to Centre, Airport bus, trains. Placa Espania itself is now a 'destination' with the re-opening of the Lluís Domènech i Montaner moorish bullring converted by Rogers Stirk Harbour- offering restaurants, shopping, 'leisure', and fantastic views from the rooftop. The review of the actual hotel is revealed in the tip offered below.

Reviews.Title: “Do even consider it”
Reviews.Author: EirikandNoelia
Reviews.Content: Too far from the highlights of Barcelona, very hard beds, no breakfast included in the rate, just wireless at the reception area and the interior is way to 1980s. We stayed 3 nights for easter and would never have choosen this hotel again. Pick something else if you are planning a short trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Unassuming exterior but decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: garryturner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very spacious with excellent suite sized rooms, with a super king sized bed, separate sofa, desk and a bath and shower room with double sink. Nicely stocked minibar (expensive!) and nice touch with robes and slippers if you so wish! The breakfast was excellent, with a good choice and well prepared. There are gym and pool facilities, but I did not use these. Location is good, 20 mins walk from the main drag and easy to access taxi's locally. The biggest letdown is that the internet does not allow VPN accounts to be accessed so remote access to work networks was impossible !! Very, very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,good value,very safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ssislandpetra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fira for 3 nights prior to a cruise. The rooms and bathrooms are huge for european standards. Everything was very clean. Free wifi is available,but you have to pick up access cards from the front desk.We never ate breakfast at the hotel but found a small bakery and cafe right across the street which was very good and cheap compared to the hotel prices. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance and it only takes about 7 min of easy walking to get to the closest subway station. The magic fountains are right around the corner,don't miss the show at night. It is amazing and free... The only negative thing we encountered was some noise created by inconsiderate neighbors slamming doors in the middle of the night. Would definitely stay at the Fira again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and good value 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: melthorn
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was arranged by the organisers of the conference and was also the conference venue so I was not expecting anything too glamorous so I was very surprised at the standard and the value for money. The room was extremely large as was the bathroom with separate shower and toilet and the facilities were excellent. Athough the building itself was 80s style and had obviously been renovated in the past 10 years, it was starting to age a bit: bathroom fittings, wardrobe doors etc. The wifi worked and was free, the reception staff were incredibly helpful and attentive and the hotel had the fastest lifts I have ever come across. Location-wise was not an issue as the conference was in-house and it was within walking distance of Plaza Espanya and the Montjuic Magic Fountain and Metro stations and it was a pleasant stroll to the Ramblas. The breakfast buffet was exceptionally good and the catering at the conference likewise. I can give an unqualified thumbs-up to this as a comfortable and good value 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Oren A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fira palace hotel for a week in Barcelona. Our room was enormous, comparing to other hotels I stayed in Europe. The location is really convenient - 5 min. from Espanya square the Metro, Close to poble espanyol and the Montjuïc but not too close to the chaos La Rambala. The staff was very friendly and attentive and was happy to assist us Would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fairy Fira Palace”
Reviews.Author: Bubi L
Reviews.Content: If you choose Fira Palace you will get the real fairytale in Barcelona – Magic Fontaine, Castle, Arena – all around you! In addition – luxury, worm and smiling personal, tasty meals… Oh, how we missed them now… It’s true – this hotel and staff are different! We were very happy there! You should experience this combination Barcelona – Fira Palace!!! Lazarovi family, Varna, Bulgaria

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son - Great hotel and location. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was great too!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Dalia M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In general, I enjoyed staying in this hotel, because of the high level services at the hotel, i.e. there was a lot of space in the room, perfect maintenance and sleeping quality was perfect. The breakfast was excellent as well. Free internet was also useful. The location is perfect - very close to Montjuic region, next to the Tourist bus stop, also the route of Airbus passing quite nearby. It takes to go to the airport by Airbus just 10 minutes. I can not identify any problem or complain.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to Las Ramblas, but still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel among a few choices I had. My wife and I do not mind walking around Europe, so choosing a hotel away from the main sights is fine for us. There is always a conundrum - choose something close but have noisy evenings or choose something a bit further out and have no problems sleeping and leaving the windows open at night. Because I am a VIP member for Expedia, I was given an executive suite. It was nice, large bed, pullout couch, desk, small table with 2 chairs to eat at and a coffee table next to the couch. Large bathroom with a WC, shower area, and bathtub. I would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: lili00766
Reviews.Content: We just completed a one week successful stay at the Fira Palace. Perfect location. Friendly and helpful staff. Great service. The rooms are a great size, very clean and everything was of a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bryan D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and really couldn't recommend it more. The rooms were very palatial and the facilities first class, most notably the gym, pool and internet access, either via free wi-fi or the 3 computers provided (that is when you can crowbar away the inevitable array of saddo's who can't live without playing games or accessing Facebook for more than 5 minutes). The breakfast was excellent. Unlike the standard continental fayre available at a lot of hotels, this provided a range of hot & cold foods, with an extensive choice of both. In terms of location, the hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the Metro, the system for which is immensely efficient and is a great way to see the city. I'd recommend the T10 ticket, which at a cost of 9.25 Euros (Zone 1) allows you to make 10 journeys, in favour of the cost of individual tickets that cost 2 Euros. Would happily use again if we ever return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for small meetings”
Reviews.Author: grneumann1
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and very fast service on request. Meeting room adjacent to large courtyard, providing daylight and shelter from rain due to a glass cover at coffee breaks. Spacious rooms, true double windows and bathroom with 3 doors.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: anahimart
Reviews.Content: We went with a 1yo and location was great. We are walkers anyways but this worked very nice for us. Would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth stay at the Fira Palace. Each time seems to get better & better. The rooms are simply quite superb. The most comfortable in Barcelona. The Executive Double is always my choice. All the staff very friendly and willing to assist. Although the location isn't very central, taxis are plentiful with the Metro not too far away. One slight negative. Free Wifi should not be exactly that, free! Not limited to web use only. If you want to check emails for example you have to pay for an upgrade. I think this should be looked at by the management.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a palace”
Reviews.Author: AliMichel
Reviews.Content: At a tarif of 370 euros per night this hotel can be described as a rip off - of course during MWC this is to be expected however even without that, this hotel does not merit the name Palace. Exterior of the hotel reminds you of something built in Soviet times in Moscow - cold and grey. Welcome was similarly non existent - no one to open the door, nor take the luggage. Efficient checkin but with no frills and even had to ask for the generous 30 mins free internet voucher. Room was spacious but in need of a refresh, especially the bathroom with poorly functioning toilet and smell of drains. But for a palace 4star + really lacking amenities - no bathrobe, no iron/ironing board, no tea or coffee making equipment, poor selection of televison channels. Room poorly sound proofed - neighbour came back in the middle of the night - I was subjected to a lot of very audible banging and crashing as he negotiated his way to bed. Breakfast was copious but again service was lacking - staff very busy doing everything except serving the diner - even coffee was an effort - needed to ask several times to get it. Room service had suitably "palace like" prices - plate of vegetables and glass of wine 26 euros. Positive point - location next to Fira and very close to city centre - this was good. My advice: negotiate your rate for this hotel and don't pay more than 120 euros - it's not worth more!

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Fernando B
Reviews.Content: Nice place, near for many atratcions like Montjuic Park, Plaça de Espania, Shopping Arena. Have also near from hotel nice places to dinner... I think that location is one of better in city, because to come and leave for differents intentions, business and pleasure, is very very good... have a lot of Metro access near and a lot of bus stations, and to go on Fira Gran Via by taxi cost less than $15,00. the rooms are very big, good bed, flat TV, nice bathroom. I liked a lot and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Family holiday-Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Doc1984
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms as a family of five.The rooms are spacious with 2 double beds in each room.The bathrooms are well appointed.The bathrooms were well stocked with toiletries,shaving equipment etc, little touches such as bathrobes,bed turning service in the evenings and chocolates,makes the stay more enjoyable. Staff at the reception and the cleaning ladies were helpful.Did not eat in the restaurants and so cannot comment on them.Little bakery just across the road with fresh croissants allowed a family of 5 to have breakfast for under a fiver. The location is excellent-being within 5 minutes walk of Playa Espanya-which has fantastic transport links.Metro takes one to the Ramblas etc within 2-3 stops.Excellent bus connections-Aerobus to airport,Barcelona tour buses etc from Espanya.Also the number 46 bus starts from Espanya and gets one to the airport for£2 or one journey on the T10 ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Really large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: breezeedeck
Reviews.Content: American-sized rooms with enough space to have a little cocktail party if you're meeting friends in Barcelona, as I was. The restaurant downstairs is very good and there are free computers in the lobby, although they were always in use by children staying at the hotel. I had issues with the wifi and I don't think it's free but everything else was good and clean. Easy walk to the metro and other sites. I really enjoyed my time here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay for four nights at the Fira Palace last week. It was our second stay there, having stayed there two years ago. I would highly recommend it. That is why we went back a second time and it didn't disappoint. We had an 'upgraded' room, which was very spacious, almost a suite, with sofa and writing desk and a large bed. The bathroom was also spacious with a bath and a shower. The staff and service was excellent. The breakfast was a buffet with lots of choice. Although the hotel is not central, it is in easy walking distance of the metro and the aerobus to and from the airport, which takes 20 minutes. You can walk to the centre of Barcelona in about 30 minutes and to the beach in about 40 minutes. We walked everywhere and caught the metro back to the hotel in the late afternoon for a glass of wine in the excellent hotel bar. There are plenty of good restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel for eating out in the evening. I would recommend 'Tapas Gaudi', not far away. We will be staying at Fira Place again when we next visit Barcelona and we will be recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, very clean, with large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: TnPete_traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it belongs to the Sheffield group which also has a hotel in Ft Lauderdale that is magnificent, National Museum of Art, Spanish Village and the former Olympic site. The restaurant was good. It is also very close to the local tour bus route, which is very reasonably priced. I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “When I entered the lobby I knew I made the right decision!”
Reviews.Author: MarcionC
Reviews.Content: Where do I start really! My husband and I were on honeymoon and chose this hotel after looking at many on the Internet. When I entered the lobby I knew immediately we made the right decision. For me, the lobby says alot about the rooms and service to expect. The staff are friendly, helpful, speak English, and genuine! I had a standard room and my goodness! If this is standard I can only imagine the executive suites! My room was extremely spacious, looked like a junior suite to me and the bathroom was equally spacious with an individual tub, individual shower, individual toilet nd bidet. We were going to Italy for a few days and heading back to Spain and the kind folks at front desk offered to keep our extra pieces of luggage till we return! We were going to stay at another hotel on our return closer to other attractions but this service and hotel standard was too good to let go that we changed our booking to return to this hotel. It's in walking distance of the art museum, and the arena shopping plaza and cafe as well as restaurants all around. I would say the Internet doesnt do this hotel justice so take my word for it and stay at Fira Palace hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good one”
Reviews.Author: Agotux
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice place. Tasty food. Only one complain, that when I went to reception for a help, I was advice to visit plenty supermarkets overthere, and buy that "thing", but the only thing i needed was that somebody to go and maybe help me with "it " in my room.

Reviews.Title: “A very noise room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth3_80
Reviews.Content: I was very, very disappointed with this hotel. All the reviews I read in Internet were giving the hotel high marks but we only asked for two things (a quite room and a double bed) and got none. Our room was beside a lift, were you could heard people talking at all times. Things got even worst when they started cleaning next door room at 7:30 in the morning with no respect for other guests (moving furniture and making an almighty noise!!!). Left the room early (it was impossible to sleep) and went back to the room at 11:00 for some rest. Three times different people knocked at the door and even opened the door, despite the 'please do not disturb' sign outside and us shutting not to come in!! Unbelievable. A part from this, we got a room with two single beds, rather than the double bed we asked for. The pillows were extremely uncomfortable. There was a sign beside the bed saying that there were more pillow on offer but there was only one (for one person) in the wardrobe. My brother stayed in a similar type of room and got lots of complimentary stuff, including sleepers. We stayed in the hotel much longer than him (he only stayed one night) and got nothing. Overall the hotel did not impressed us at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VishnuMZ
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference. stayed there for 4 days. The services offered are best in class for competitive price.. nice complimentary breakfast.. best amenities and location is very good. Just 3 kms from the famous barcelona beach.. I wont forget this stay in my lifetime...

Reviews.Title: “conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenfingersoxford
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at this hotel last week. Hotel ok, rooms quite dark. Room cold until i could work out how heating worked. TV's only had spanish channels or BBC news. No tea or coffee facilities in room which would have been great. Food ok. Staff very nice. Swimming pool very basic but water warm. This hotel good for conferences close to metro station, but just basic.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms - great location”
Reviews.Author: maffrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very large rooms and I chose it because my daughter is in a wheelchair. The hotel is excellent except that it not really for leasure purposes but more for business people. I say this because the opening times of the swimming pool are from 08:00 to 20:00 which is not convenient if you are on a city leasure trip and also because the television has only spanish channels and business french chanel and BBC world but no leasure channels or pay TV movie channels in english. The position is great though - right next to magick fountain, the bull ring, piazza spania, montjuice which is a hill with beutiful parks and masses of museums - miro foundation, ethnological museum the modern art museum, the botanical gardens, etc.. and you can walk from the hotel through lovely parks with a fantastic view of the city to all these places.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: D1881
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find as its close to public transport and close to so many attractions in the city. Its far from the port but a good starting point. It was only about five minute walk so many attractions and it was so nice to get back to a nice, spacious room with a big bathroom and really big beds after a long day, I went with a friend and we had a wonderful stay here. There are places to eat near by which are reasonably priced, best of all the hotel was very reasonably priced also.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadezhda_1906
Reviews.Content: We have spent in this hotel 1.5 week in Dec-Jan'12 while travelling with small kid of 1.5 years while staying in executive doble room, comments are the following: - huge room, large bathroom with separate bath and shower area - if you are lucky to get dowble bed (not in all doble executive rooms) you'll be impressed by its size. Upgrade is worth paying extra money - all small details usual for 4-5* hotel are present:cleaning twice per day, slippers, gown, sewing and shawing kit, ect. (very pleasant pack of chocolates on your bed in the evening) - very nice breakfast, wide choice (would recommend coffee from coffee machine -it is in the corner, not the one brought to you by servant) - close to Monjuic and magic fountains which is very pleasant (see in advance its working hours as hotel personnel is not always informed) - swimming pool is available in the hotel (would not recommend from small kids as is rather cold), gym is free, sauna is to be paid for Minuses: - rather far from the metro station, especially if you are with kids and expect to travel by metro (taxi is available at the hotel though, highly recommended) -room on the 4th floor we were given was very-very cold as windows were broken and could not be closed properly, air conditioning did not help a lot - no tea or coffee in the room, you have to go down to the restaurant to get hot water - no free Wi-Fi in the room, you can take pass for only 30min free internet at the reception. Areas of wree Wi-Fi in the hotel are sometimes overcrowded. - restaurant in the hotel is a bit pricy and portions are very small, although personnel is kind and polite with kids All in all would certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well located with good comfort”
Reviews.Author: Devilmalte
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and we found the hotel to be a good spot to have good stay well located for a city trip. Due to the special offer they have (had) we got a free upgrade to an Executive room in 4th floor which was really spacious and offered enough room to stay with 2 adults and kid. We had 2 Queen Size Beds and in addition there is still a couch bed. I would say the room leaves enough space for a family with 2 kids at least. The bathroom is good as well. It had separate shower and bath, toilet separated and double washing spaces. The room was clean and twice a day the service came to clean and prepare for the night. We had the room including breakfast which was really okay. It offers all you need for a good breakfast with a good variety without going too crazy. The location is right next to the congress halls and next to the whole area of "Parc de Montjiuc". By 3-5 minutes walk you could enter the Metro (Pl. Espana or Poble Sec) and within 2 stops you are at the harbour or Las Ramblas. And in only 20 minutes with Aerobus you are the airport El Prat (Barcelona City Airport) You also have some restaurants and small supermarkets in the area which makes it convenient as well. The fitness area is quite okay to do some exercising but there are definitely nicer fitness areas in hotels. In regards to "Wellness" I have only seen the pool which is Indoor and okay to have a short swim - but it is nothing special as such. The only thing I found a bit "negative" is that even in Executive Room you still need to pay for a 24h WLAN card per day. And this can only be used by one device - so not per room. As we had altogether 2 iPhones and 2 laptops this got a bit complicated... But overall the hotel has a good standard, is clean, rooms spacious, breakfast very good, people and service nice and well located for a city trip to stay couple of days. But not to be used as "Wellness Hotel" in Barcelona. Would probably go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option near Plaza de Espanya”
Reviews.Author: JoeMizoSoup
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in June 2011. I stayed in a huge, double room. Facilities were clean and quiet. The room had a closet, dressers, a desk and a couch. Bathroom was large and clean. Beds were enormous and comfortable. The hotel is about a five minute walk from the nearest metro stop. Staff were friendly and helpful. There is no free wifi here though, and for me, that is a huge drawback. Otherwise a good choice for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, big rooms, ok location, poor internet”
Reviews.Author: Oaltun
Reviews.Content: Very big and comfortable rooms. My room was recently renovated, very good value for money. Location is not bad, not in the heart of the city but less than 10 mins walk to Arena shopping center. My only complaint is the internet policy, they give you a card every day for half an our internet connection. So everyday you have to go down to the reception, get a card, go back up, enter the code & the password which takes almost 5 mins, then connect only for half an hour. What's the point?? If they have the infrastructure, they should just offer it free of charge 24/7, as it's no extra cost to them if i connect for half an hour or 2 hours..

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: fbrito29
Reviews.Content: As last year my family's visit to Fira Palace Hotel was very nice, the staff was kind, corteous and ready to help. The clenliness of the hotel is up to what you can expect from a hotel of this category. Hotel was close to various sites tourist sites and made this very convenient, public transportation is also very close by. Highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST FOR YOUR MONY”
Reviews.Author: kasian27
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel with good sound isolation, located in quite part of Barcelona near Congress center - Fira. Rooms are equip by free internet connection. Breakfast is more then good and if you ask for espresso, which is not served, you'll got excellent cup of coffee without paying it. Worth to stay in this nice hotel in beautiful Barcelona, you'll enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ideal for concert at San jordi”
Reviews.Author: Iansmigger
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff Clean Very big rooms Great location for any concerts at Palau San jordi Will return in future!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Fira Palace”
Reviews.Author: Karen-Espana
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day trip to Barcelona staying at the Fira Palace Hotel. Wonderful hotel in an excellent location with all parts of the city accessible by metro or taxi. Taxis are stationed right outside the entrance to the hotel. A 5 minute stroll takes you to the wonders of the Magic Fountains which are switched on between 7pm and 9 pm each evening where you can enjoy the amazing music and light show. Continue down this street to the Plaza de Espana where you can pick up the Tourist Bus, local buses into the city and the metro. Fira Palace is situated in a quiet leafy area with a good choice of Tapas bars and cafes within 5 minutes walk. We had a superior room on the 4th floor with beautiful views across Barcelona to the Sacre Coeur church at the highest point in the city - stunning! Well worth paying the extra for the room upgrade which gives you a very large room with a huge double bed, sofa and writing desk area plus en-suite bathroom with double sinks, a separate bath and fabulous jet shower with endless hot water. The rooms are fully carpeted and nicely decorated with good quality finishings with controlable hot and cold air conditioning to select the temperature to suit yourself. The foyer is stunning and imaculately clean as are the bedrooms. Drinks in the bar are expensive but be sure to use the voucher you are given when you check in for 10% discount off the bar and 20% off the restaurant. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely come back on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandarab
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade as the hotel was quiet over the fiesta period. Large room with an enormous bed which was one of the most comfy I have slept in. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Great views - ask for a room on the 4th floor or above! Convenient location , qo mins to Plaza Espanya woith great links to eberywhere in Barcelona. Wonderful city , a must for all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel........shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: sgswint
Reviews.Content: Great, clean hotel, Location is ok the metro is a short walk away. Took 20 mins to walk in La Rambla. Rooms excellent and cleaned thoroughy. Shame about the staff though. The check in was decididly frosty though, frankly the staff were rude and uninterested. I had a Barcelona tourist pass included in the price of the hotel, but wasn't informed of any details on check in and was handed this on check out! A small issue is the hotel doesn't provide any iron/ironing board either, only an ironing service at €5 an item!! Never stayed at a 4* + hotel that doesn't provide an iron?? A bit of a con if you're only in Barcelona for a weekend.......

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: mjmally
Reviews.Content: stayed for a long weekend, location was exactly what we wanted as we prefer being just outside the hustle & bustle of the centre. metro station is within 5 min walk. and the magic fountain was only a 2 min walk away. room was very spacious, huge comfortable bed. the hotel offer a choice of pillows to suit most tastes. bathroom was luxurious complete with bath and separate walk in shower which had extra jets on either side which was very relaxing after a long day exploring the shops. on the first night we opted to visit a tapas restaurant literally across the road. food and service was brilliant, it wasn`t the cheapest but i would pay it again without hesitation. on the second night we decided to eat in the hotels restaurant `el mall` wow. the food was spectacular, we went for the tapas menu, we were served 10 tapas each plus 3 desserts, each was a work of art. it all tasted incredible. the restaurant also offered a scarf service if the the temperature was a bit cool for you. and also reading glasses incase you left yours in your room. faultless experience. when I booked the hotel I didnt take the breakfast option, so we paid 12 euros each, the different cuisines on offer was amazing, everthing was catered for from cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts, fresh meat, cakes, breads, pastries, nuts, quails legs, to mention a few! overall I had a great, stress free experience. i will certainly use the fira palace again if i choose to visit barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very adequate, but nothing above & beyond”
Reviews.Author: shay&thecity
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, business-class hotel near government and office buildings. During the week, there were multiple meetings/conventions going on, but it was less-busy on the weekend. The neighborhood is safe & decent, but not at all charming and a bit off the beaten path from the heart of the city. On the plus-side, it is nice and quiet at night and the rooms are large and well-equipped. Very good showers. If you're looking for concierge services (there is no concierge here) and a helpful staff, this is not the place for you. While the front desk staff where nice enough & spoke very good English, they make no great effort to go above and beyond to help you out with any logistics and seemed to roll their eyes when we (very nicely) asked for basic help. The bellmen were the jolly ones - very helpful and cheerful. The buffet breakfast is big & pretty decent. I'd say we had a very good stay here, with no major complaints, but don't expect anything beyond "just fine" from Fira Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it thinks...”
Reviews.Author: SeasideJol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference in November. The hotel is situated on the outer edge of the main centre, however it was easy to find the metro and for 3 Euro your wherever you want to be. The hotel is rated as a 4*, and the layout and design is understandable why this is the case, the rooms also are very spacious. However when you did deeper into the hotel, there are reasons why you would not give it a 4* rating now. In the room, I had 2 double beds, a desk, sofa, and enough space to of held a party for 20 people! The beds are not the greatest though, a bit better than a camp bed, but wont be anywhere near the standard most people expect from a 4*, the pillows also were awful. The bathroom, though was nicely designed and the quality of fittings in there made that stand out as the rooms main plus point. The shower was good and includes side shooting jets as well as the main downward stream. I found breakfast in the hotel to be very, very poor though. The hot food section was limited and there was very little "normal" breakfast items. Garlic mushrooms...beefburgers...stuffed tomatoes... the list of random items on the menu went on. The standard beans and toast were nowhere to be seen. Yes no toast! Could I find a toaster, not in that breakfast room. The orange juice also was like cheap concentrate, not the best. There did seem a lot of cakes if thats your idea of a breakfast. Reading the other reviews saying it was 13 Euro's, I would use that money and go somewhere else! As others have stated, no free wifi. This is a massive let down especially for a hotel wanting to be in the conference trade! Being on business I expect also if you pay for Wifi you get a good connection, unfortunately not here. It was painfully slow and if you pay 7 Euro, that is just for one device, so you cant use your phone and laptop! Overall, one of the poorer 4* hotels and for the price I paid I would definitely not be retuning at that cost, at a much lower cost I would probably return on the basis of not using the breakfast facilities and knowing the pitfalls to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Spain without the chaos”
Reviews.Author: crowns5
Reviews.Content: Although regular Australian business travelers we chose to stay 2 nights in this hotel so that we got a better quality room for a good price and were out of the chaos and noise of Barcelona central, Las Ramblas and the port areas. Had an excellent room with good bed, spacious bathroom and separate living area. Plenty of natural light although window only had a view of the buildings across the road. Ate at the in-house restaurant on last night and found it very expensive and small sized meals. Not many other good eating places around the area - all cheap, not very clean and very little English spoken. Good access to bus and metro about 5 mins walk away and used both over 3 days to travel into Barcelona central (15mins). Caught bus from airport but would recommend taxi as not much more money and way faster. Metro is easy to use. Easy walk to National Palace/Museum and Olympic precinct on the hill - a must do trip for both its grandeur and views of Barcelona. Staff were excellent and spoke adequate English. Very clean and orderly except for accessing the restaurant when a business function is happening. Highly recommend city bus tour. Hotel in quiet area with minimal street noise. Good shop 100m away sells bottle water/snacks cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: philippa w
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel away from the main tourist areas, but an easy 5 min walk to metro. Also walking distance to magic fountains, Poble Espanyol, National Palace etc. Good standard of accomodation and service. We had huge triple room with sofa, desk etc, for very good price (children under 7 are free). Restaurant buffet was good and reasonably priced for Barcelona. Pool and changing rooms a bit run down, but my daughter still loved it.

Reviews.Title: “good quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: Phil P
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the room quality and in particular the bathroom (separated into main area with bath, and little sub cubicles for shower and toilet). Nice little touches like chocolates on the pillow every day. The pool was a decent size (wasn't immeadiately obvious how to get a locker key). Nit picking : I would have appreciated more helpful front desk staff, they were a little brusque on check in and were pretty unhelpful when I asked for directions. I think the room service food should have been a bit better for the price, didn't try the restaurant. I was expecting free wifi and when I did use it (7 euros for a 24 hours) the connection seemed somewhat flaky. It's in a nice quiet part of town so no street noise, but my room was opposite the elevator so I did get disturbed a couple of times by people returning late.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Terrible Service - Will NEVER recommend”
Reviews.Author: srogers01
Reviews.Content: My clients stayed at this hotel for 3-nights in October and received the WORST service they've ever encountered. The staff at the front counter were incredibly rude to them, wouldn't help them with their luggage, and never sent up any toilettries even though my clients called down several times for them. I emailed the hotel to explain how disappointed I was in the service they had provided to my clients, and I got a very arrogant letter back saying they hadn't done anything wrong. I wrote a reply email requesting to speak with the owner and I never got a reply back from them. I tried calling several times and each time I was hung up on. I strongly believe that this hotel's lack of interest in their clients really shows their true colours. I don't care how nice the rooms are, the service provided by the hotel is definitely not worth the trouble or the money. I will never again recommend this hotel to anyone, and I urge anyone who is contemplating staying there to rethink their choice. As my clients mentioned to me, there are lots of other hotels nearby that are cheaper and provide much better service. I am extremely disappointed in the people running this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ptrg”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaSpain_11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room with outstanding bathroom. Very spacious, Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast choice was good and restaurant for evening meal was superb and very good value. Great food and very attentive waiters. I would recommend this hotel and will certainly stay there again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “See you next time Fira Palace!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireVictoria
Reviews.Content: Booked a basic room ( but they gave us a free upgrade to executive room) for four nights.Large bedrooms ( 1 double bed + a sofà-bed for our child),large bathroom.Free internet downstairs, free wifi in the room for half an hour.Five miutes walk from Plaza Espanya metro,just behind the Magic Fountain.Free swimming pool and gym.Very good services.I'd go back to Fira Palace for holyday or for business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Fira Palace”
Reviews.Author: NorwichExplorer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was remarkable. The bedrooms were exceptionally large as were the beds. The bathroom was also very large. The restaurant food was very good. The Breakfast buffet was well worth it and very good value for money. The hotel staff were helpful and the service was very good. We often had the swimming pool to ourselves later in the afternoon. The hotel is not far from the underground station and there are numerous taxis which are very reasonably priced. It is easy to get around the city. It was an enjoyable stay. There are numerous restaurants with in easy walking distance of the Fira Palace.The decor of the hotel is modern but is immaculately clean. The bedroom doors tended to bang shut when being closed.They are very large solid wooden doors. This might be annoying to other guests late at night as it was impossible to shut them without making a loud noise. Generally though this hotel is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: scottishgirl87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights earlier this month (October 2011) before going on a cruise. Got a great deal online making it great value for money! I had printed off the "Free room upgrade" voucher from Tripadvisor and upon showing this at check-in we were informed that they had an upgrade available for us! Who knows what our original rooms were like (we were part of 2 couples with 2 rooms booked) but we were more than happy with the rooms we received. I would have to say the room is a little dated but rather typical for a Spanish hotel. Bathroom was excellent, lovely and modern with excellent facilities! Only little niggle we had was that our room safe was not working when we arrived, after speaking to Reception they sent maintenance up who appeared within a few minutes, disappeared and came back. They then informed me the safe was fixed and that they would send a bell boy up to reset it. After waiting about half an hour, no one appeared, so I spoke to Reception again and they immediately came up and reset it for me. We didn't eat in the restaurant at all, but did have a couple of drinks in the Piano Bar. We stuck to coffees though as it was around €12 for a cocktail! Location was excellent in that it was only a 5 minute walk to the Fountains and another 5 minutes to Las Arenas! All in all, I would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel But Antiquated WiFi Policy”
Reviews.Author: qts
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels that we stayed at during our visit to Spain (Portugal). The rooms are well appointed and spacious and clean. The AC worked well. The lobby is spacious and the staff were very professional and helpful. There was ice water with lemon for guests which was a wonderful touch. The restaurant in the hotel that served only dinner had some of the best food (Paella) that we had during our entire trip. The only reason that I am withholding a 5th star is because of the WiFi policy. You get a scratch off card that gives you 30 minutes of free WiFi (huh?) - otherwise you have to pay a daily fee. This left a bit of a bad taste because WiFi is free these days in the vast majority of hotels throughout Europe and for a hotel of this caliber/class to be charging an additional fee for WiFi just seemed antiquated. Just charge a bit extra for the room fee and provide free WiFi like everyone else if you want to generate a bit more income.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Fira Palace”
Reviews.Author: Stevebmw123d
Reviews.Content: Wow- what a great hotel. Our stay at fira palace was just perfect. We stayed from thursday night until Monday morning to experience barcelona over a long weekend. Hotel was only 20 minute taxi ride from airport and we walked down to las ramblas most days (only takes about 15 minutes from hotel). Breakfast buffet was great - even had cava available every day if you wanted it!

Reviews.Title: “Really Helpful Staff - huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my friend who through illnes found herself in a wheelchair. With little notice the hotel changed things around so that as two couples we could have linked rooms. Rooms were huge so made things a lot easier with the wheelchair. Would stay here again & recommend this hotel. Food in the restaurant was lovely,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvrOfCruzes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Within walking distance from red line hop-on hop-off tour. Several restaurants, shops also nearby. My mom and I stayed a total of 3 nights. We stayed 1 night before and 2 nights after cruise. I love the additional door that closes off the room from the bath area. Closing the door at night kept us from hearing any noise in the hallway. It was difficult to get the air conditioning just right. I prefer the before cruise room. Before cruise: 2 full size beds which had very limited space between the 2 beds. Bathroom had separate bath, shower & toilet area. Shower and toilet areas had their own glass doors. After cruise: 2 twin beds which were more like cots but were surprisingly comfortable. Bathroom had single tub/shower, no separate doors. Not much of a view. Having the 1st room on the left, part of the view is the brick from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Yael Z
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the Fira Palace hotel. We stayed in a regular room with our two children (2 and 4). The hotel supplied a baby cot and the sofas was an extra bed. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable and big, the bathroom was great and everything was simply perfect! The service was good, the food was good and the staff was friendly and helpful. Next to the hotel you can find a huge wonderful mall, with a very special food court, rock museum and spectacular view from it's roof.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful business hotel in Montjuic area”
Reviews.Author: redcat777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Fira Palace on arriving in Barcelona and were very pleased with our rooms, the location, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel. It is a business hotel so the atmosphere may seem a little sterile, but very sophisticated and upscale at the same time. We had only 2 complaints: we had to get a new wifi card each day (wifi is NOT free unless you are an iPrefer member) and breakfast is not included. For a hotel of this caliber both of these things, I would imagine, would be included for the business traveller. We were leisure travelers, and I am an iPrefer member so the wifi was included for me. Overall I did enjoy The Fira Palace and would stay again if I was afforded the great deal Venere.com got for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fira Palace Hotel Continues its Tradition of Being an Excellent Hotel Providing Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: TravellersSPB
Reviews.Content: Fira Palace Hotel Continues its Tradition of Being an Excellent Hotel Providing Excellent Value! This review is a follow-up to our first review of the Fira Palace Hotel (www.fira-palace.com) on November 8, 2009 (see our prior review below for important info not reflected in this review). We stayed at 4-star Fira Palace Hotel in Barcelona, Spain for 14 nights (October 2 – October 16, 2011). We reserved a standard double room and paid an average daily rate of 129.60 Euros (room only, taxes included). However, because of the graciousness of the hotel’s management (Ms. Regina Herrero, Ms. Alicia Soler, and Ms. Ana Lorenzo) and also the fact that we signed up for the hotel’s “I Prefer Guest Program”, we were upgraded to a Junior Suite. At 60 m2, our Junior Suite was the best and biggest room that we have ever stayed in anywhere! We also had a large balcony with round table and chairs. In our estimation, Fira Palace Hotel continues to rate 5 (rather than 4) stars. What we truly liked and appreciated about the Fira Palace Hotel and the city of Barcelona: (1) professionalism and friendliness of all hotel staff (reception, housekeeping, dining, fitness center) and cleanliness of the hotel. (2) central, convenient, yet quiet location (2 blocks from National Art Museum and the Fira exhibition center, near Placa Espanya, not far from Montjuic’s Olympic Ring, Joan Miro museum, Montjuic park and castle, approx. 25 minutes by foot from the heart of the city center and 15 min. by foot from the Maritime Museum and the Barcelona Boardwalk near the port). Whatever you do, be sure to see the the Magic Fountain show at Placa Espanya that currently is held every Friday and Saturday night from 7 p.m. until 9 p.m. – it is both beautiful and inspirational! (3) the buffet breakfast at the hotel (12 EUR per person) is an excellent way to start one’s day, and of the 14 mornings that we stayed there we ate the breakfast buffet 10 of those mornings. It has a very broad selection of fresh and delicious food that will suit everyone (3 types of eggs, fish, red meat, hamburger, quail legs, spaghetti, sauteed mushrooms, bacon, potatoes, watermelon, kiwi, pineapple, melon, papaya, oranges, dried prunes, raisins, walnuts, pistachios, cheeses, ham, breads, pastries, cakes, muffins, iceberg lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, juices, water, champagne, tea, coffee, etc.). (4) we liked the nightly “turndown service” at the hotel, especially since we stayed for 14 nights and liked to keep our room very organized and very clean. Also, the 3 small chocolates that each of us received every night were a true delight – we love dark chocolate! (5) also, we appreciate the fact that at our request we had a small coffee/tea machine in our junior suite with a quality selection of coffees and teas provided. (6) readily accessible, extensive, and reliable transportation system – (a) the METRO system is very convenient and extensive – to get to the hotel you can take the L3 metro line either to the Poble Sec stop or to the Placa Espanya stop. (b) the BUS system is very convenient and extensive – often we took bus 55 that dropped us off on within a block of the hotel. (c) you can buy an integrated 10-trip metro, bus, tram, and funicular card for 8.25 EUR which works out to 0.825 EUR per trip. This is substantially less than the 1.45 EUR per trip that you would otherwise pay. With this card you have 75 minutes to make transfers. (d) there are always TAXIS waiting directly outside the hotel to take guests anywhere they want to go. If you want to take a taxi to the AIRPORT (which we did this time), it will cost you between 25 and 30 EUR, depending upon the time of day or night you travel and how much large luggage you have. (e) buses (day and night) travel to and from the hotel to the BARCELONA AIRPORT. In 2009, we took the Aerobus bus to the airport, and at that time it cost 5 EUR per person. There is a night bus N17 that runs from 23:00 to 05:00 and costs 2.10 EUR per person. (7) we found a couple of new restaurants this time that we thoroughly enjoyed: (a) Market restaurant, Comte Borrell 68 – approx. 10 minute walk from hotel (b) Les Quinze Nits restaurant, Placa Reial 6 – approx. 20 minute walk from hotel (c) Ciao Roma restaurant, Mallorca 210 – approx. 20 minute walk from hotel All 3 of the above restaurants had good fixed price lunch menus for 9.95 EUR from Monday through Friday, approx 12:00 to 16:00. (d) Wok Dao, Villarroel 1 (at corner of Tamarit) – lunch buffet for 8.98 EUR We also returned to the following 4 restaurants that we liked in 2009 (see 2009 review for addresses): L'Antica Napoli , Basilico, La Bodegueta del Poble Sec, and Trobador. A couple of minor comments about our stay at the hotel: (1) internet connection - occasionally the internet connection at the 2 internet stations in the lobby and conference room area (with a total of 6 computers) did not work stably, although in 2009 there were not any problems with the internet connection. Even so, the hotel has a tech person who can address all problems. Also, there is a printer hooked up to the computers, so this is nice if you need to print something. (2) iceberg lettuce – we prefer a variety of salad greens at breakfast, rather than only iceberg lettuce. For some reason on October 13th we had a variety, but all of the other mornings we had only iceberg lettuce. (3) the junior suite has a separate living room and a separate bedroom. While there was a tv in the living room, it would have been nice to have a tv in the bedroom as well since it times it is nice to lay in bed and watch a little tv. However, of course, we did not come to Barcelona to watch tv, so this was not a major concern. We had a TRULY GREAT stay at the Fira Palace Hotel and look forward to staying there in the future when we are in Barcelona! By the way, during our stay we checked out some more hotels in Barcelona, this time in the Diagonal del Mar area (we walked from there to Villa Olympic and checked some hotels along the way). 1. Barcelona Princess Hotel - Avinguda Diagonal 1 http://www.hotelbarcelonaprincess.com/barcelonahotel/en/index_en.html 2. Marriott/AC Hotel Barcelona Forum – Passeig del Taulat 278 http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/bcnfo-ac-hotel-barcelona-forum/ 3. Hilton Diagonal Mar Barcelona - Passeig del Taulat 262-264 http://www.hiltondiagonalmarbarcelonahotel.com/ 4. Barceló Atenea Mar - Paseo Garcia Faria 37-47 www.barceloateneamar.com In our opinion, only the Marriott/AC hotel has nicer facilities (e.g., sauna, turkish bath, whirlpools, outdoor swimming pool, etc.) than Fira Palace’s facilities. However, Marriott/AC is located in a more “beach” part of Barcelona and is really a resort-type hotel. Hilton has a good-sized outdoor swimming pool, but other relaxation facilities are not as good as at Marriott/AC. Both Marriott/AC and Hilton have decent gyms (by hotel standards anyway), but not nearly as extensive as Fira Palace’s gym. However, in terms of hotel room sizes neither Marriott/AC nor Hilton is even close in size to a standard Fira Palace hotel room - both Marriott/AC and Hilton have what you could call a “standard” European-size room (Hilton’s is a bit bigger, but still considerably less that at Fira Palace). Our verdict – EVEN IF Fira Palace, Marriott/AC and Hilton were all located in the same district of Barcelona, we would still select Fira Palace because its hotel room and gym are simply unbeatable in our estimation! As far as the other two hotels go (Barcelona Princess and Barcelo Atenea Mar), there is really no point in comparing them with Fira Palace since Fira Palace beats them “hands down” in facilities and rooms. We decided to include this comparative information so that potential future guests of Fira Palace will know that with this hotel they get a REALLY good deal in the city of Barcelona (unless they want to spend 2-3 times more for an even more central location). Our Prior November 8, 2009 Review of Fira Palace Hotel: “Fira Palace Hotel is an Excellent Hotel Providing Excellent Value!” We are a middle-aged couple from Russia and the USA. We usually stay at 4-star (and occasionally 5-star) hotels and resorts. We stayed at 4-star Fira Palace Hotel in Barcelona, Spain for 11 nights (September 25 – October 6, 2009). We reserved a standard double room and paid an average daily rate of 109 Euros (room only, taxes included). We booked our room via www.hotel.info and were very pleased with its services (our many thanks to Mr. Lothar Deptner and Mr. Armin Blamberger for their help). The hotel is located two blocks from the National Art Museum and the Fira exhibition center, near Placa Espana, and not far from Montjuic’s Olympic Ring (site of 1992 Olympics), Joan Miro museum, and Montjuic park. The hotel is approx. 25 minutes by foot from the city center, and for the reasons stated below we considered this a definite advantage. All hotel employees that we encountered (reservations, reception, piano bar, cleaning, repair, fitness center, restaurant personnel) were very professional, nice, helpful, and hard-working. Our hotel room was the best and biggest room that we have ever stayed in anywhere. Ms. Ana Ciria in the hotel’s reservations department was most helpful in responding to all of our questions that we submitted by e-mail before our arrival. While Fira Palace Hotel is supposedly a 4-star hotel, compared to the other 4-star hotels and 5-star hotels that we have stayed at in Europe and elsewhere, in our estimation Fira Palace Hotel rates 5 stars! Our comments regarding our 11-night visit are as follows: HOTEL LOBBY The hotel lobby was very spacious, elegant, immaculately clean, had beautiful fresh flower arrangements, and truly “invited” hotel guests to sit there and simply enjoy the scenery and the atmosphere. HOTEL ROOM The hotel room was a “gigantic” size at 42 m2 (approx. 450 square feet). The room was “divided” openly into three large zones – bed and television zone; couch/sofa bed with long coffee table and mini-bar zone; writing desk/chair and round table/chairs zone. The room was immaculately cleaned on a daily basis and supplied with excellent Gilchrist & Soames toiletries. The large bathroom had four separate zones – shower, bathtub, toilet, and open area with two sinks/mirror. Because of the separate shower and bathtub and the two sinks, it was both nice and convenient for the two of us to be able to bathe and wash up at the same time. The ONLY thing that we truly missed in the room was a coffee/teapot so that we could make our favorite tea that we had brought from home – since we were staying for 11 nights, having a coffee/teapot in the room would have been a nice benefit. However, even without one, the piano bar personnel, especially Mr. Jose Luis Alcalde who was quite understanding, were kind enough to provide a large teapot of hot water frequently so that we could still enjoy our favorite tea. The ONLY problem we had during our stay was that 3 times during the dead of the night (when we were deep in sleep) the television would “buzz”/”ring” as if some pre-set alarm were going off. After the 1st incident, the hotel repair person came immediately the next morning, checked everything out, but could not find any problem. After the 2nd incident, the front office manager, Mr. Alquilera, had the repair person to change out the television. The 3rd incident was during the night before we were to leave the hotel that morning. To this day, we do NOT KNOW what was going on – at one point, we laughed between ourselves that perhaps there is a GHOST in the room! Regardless, even this inconvenience 3 nights out of 11 nights did NOT spoil our otherwise truly wonderful stay at the Fira Palace Hotel! However, next time we will make sure NOT to get the same room – HA! FITNESS CENTER The fitness center was professionally-run and well-equipped – it had three separate rooms. In the first room, there were exercise mats, exercise bikes, and treadmill, with television to watch. In the second room, there were weight machines primarily for legs and feet. In the third room, there were upper body weight machines, free weights, and pull/dip station. SWIMMING POOL The swimming pool was medium sized and long enough to swim short laps. The pool itself and the surrounding area were very clean. SAUNA IN MEN’S DRESSING ROOM/ SAUNA IN WOMEN’S DRESSING ROOM The sauna was nice, but since we live in Russia and are accustomed to the great “Russkaya banya” the sauna was not sufficiently hot for us. In addition, it would have been really nice to have had the opportunity to experience the sauna TOGETHER – and, in fact, one time at the end of the night right before closing we tried to accomplish this task, albeit without permission, but were unsuccessful since there was still one other woman in the women’s dressing room! TWO INTERNET STATIONS (ONE IN LOBBY AND ONE DOWNSTAIRS NEAR CONFERENCE ROOMS AND FITNESS CENTER) The two internet stations were well-equipped (even had a printer with paper for guests to print out various information) and consisted of 3 computers at each station. Many hotel guests used the internet stations. Everyone was respectful and did not stay on too long, as we did not ever experience any trouble in finding an available computer to use. Also, IF we had brought our own computer with us, the hotel gives you an internet card that allows you to use the internet in your room (as well as most likely anywhere else in the hotel) for 30 minutes every day free of charge. PIANO BAR AND RESTAURANT The piano bar and restaurant were expensive for us, but this is quite typical for many upper-scale hotels. While we did not order anything from the piano bar, we did try one time the buffet breakfast (18 EUR per person, approx. $ 26 at then exchange rate) at the restaurant. It would be nice for the hotel to consider either offering the buffet breakfast to hotel guests at a more reasonable price and/or giving a significant discount if breakfast is ordered at the time of making the room reservation, especially in instances when longer-term stays are involved (i.e., we stayed 11 nights, and IF we had eaten the buffet breakfast every morning we would have paid 396 EUR or approx. $ 572). Regardless, there are many breakfast places close by (even directly across from the hotel) - we found a place that we really liked on Avenida Paral-lel and for 5 EUR each (approx. $ 7.20) had a truly great (albeit not very dietetic) full breakfast including two eggs, pork loin, toast, coffee, and orange juice. GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION OF HOTEL As stated above, the hotel is approx. 25 minutes by foot from the city center and approx. 15 minutes by foot from the Maritime Museum and the Barcelona Boardwalk near the port. We enjoy walking, so this distance definitely was a PLUS for us. In addition, we do NOT like large crowds a lot, so for us it was nice to go to the more crowded city center but then to return “home” to a quieter, albeit still interesting, environment. We are also of the opinion that the primary reason Fira Palace Hotel is not a 5-star hotel is because of its less centralized (albeit still quite convenient) location, and this fact obviously is reflected in the hotel’s pricing policy, i.e., IF Fira Palace were in the city center we think that it would be much more expensive to stay at – thus, hotel guests receive all of the many benefits of a 5-star hotel without having to pay the substantially higher price tag that usually goes along with these benefits. Finally, there are some great restaurants in the area around the hotel that you should definitely consider eating at (see list below). TAXI STAND IMMEDIATELY OUTSIDE HOTEL There were ALWAYS taxis waiting directly outside the hotel, ready to take hotel guests anywhere they wanted to go. GOOD RESTAURANTS NEAR THE HOTEL (1) L'Antica Napoli restaurant located at C/Concordia 53 (5 min. walk from hotel) – EXCELLENT DINNER - great pizza, brezaola, entrecote – owners are Vanessa (manager) and Mario (chef) who are husband and wife. (2) Basilico restaurant located at Avenida Paral-lel 142 (5 min. walk from hotel) – GOOD DINNER - www.restaurant-basilico.com . (3) La Bodegueta del Poble Sec restaurant located at C/Blai 47 (10 min. walk from hotel) – EXCELLENT dinner, great rack of lamb and rabbit – owner takes pride in his restaurant, which is wonderful - www.labodeguetabcn.com (4) Trobador restaurant located at Rambla Catalunya 2-4 (25 min. walk from hotel) – EXCELLENT FIXED-PRICE LUNCH at 11 EUR per person (1 alcoholic or soft drink included) - www.grupcacheiro.com or www.cacheirorestaurants.com . (5) Yamamoto restaurant located at C/Arago 197 (between Aribau & Muntaner) (20 min. walk from hotel) - EXCELLENT FIXED-PRICE JAPANESE LUNCH BUFFET of high quality at 9 EUR per person (drink not included) (6) Fresc Co. restaurant located at Ronda Universitat 29 (25 min. walk from hotel) – GOOD FIXED-PRICE LUNCH AND DINNER BUFFETS with great salad bar and OK hot buffet (1 alcoholic or soft drink included, water free, tea/coffee free) - 9 EUR before 6 p.m., 10 EUR after 6 p.m. - www.fresc.com (has several locations). (7) El Raco restaurant located at Ronda Universitat 11, also one located at Rambla Catalunya 25 – OK DINNER, GOOD FIXED-PRICE LUNCH at 10 EUR per person (1 alcoholic or soft drink included) - www.elraco.com (has several locations). (8) Chinese Gran Epoca restaurant located at C/Sepulveda 94 (15 min. walk from hotel) – GOOD DINNER – www.lagranepoca.com (9) Il Golfo di Napoli restaurant at C/Lerida 38 (out of hotel take immediate right, is on right-hand side next door to hotel) - overpriced, small portions, quality OK – simply not worth the money compared to other places that we liked much better, BUT if you are really tired one night and simply want to go to a restaurant “right around the corner” you can try it! (10) For those of you who would like to venture out to the “suburbs” of Barcelona in a town called Sant Pere De Ribes (near the town of Sitges), you should definitely try Cervantes Restaurant located at Cervantes 28 and owned and managed by Mr. Andres Gonzalez, tel. 93 896 29 87, EXCELLENT FIXED-PRICE LUNCH - approx. 35 km from Barcelona (easy and inexpensive to get to by train, 2.80 EUR per ticket each way). GROCERY STORE NEAR THE HOTEL There is a reasonably-priced “Consum Basic” grocery store located at C/L Olivera 38 (5 minutes walk from hotel), as well as a grocery store located on Avenida Paral-lel. At Consum Basic, we stocked up on 6-liter jugs of water, apples, nectarines, peaches, etc. OBJECTIVE COMPARISON OF FIRA PALACE HOTEL TO OTHER BARCELONA HOTELS Since we were in Barcelona for 11 nights, we decided to check out other hotels in case we wanted to return to Barcelona but stay at a different hotel (simply for variety). Therefore, we checked out the following hotels (including the hotel rooms, the restaurants, the outdoor pools, the fitness centers, the spas, etc.): (1) Barcelona Universal Hotel located at Avenida Paral-lel 76-80 (www.hotelbarcelonauniversal.com) - nice outdoor pool area, nominal gym, nice room. (2) Barcelo Raval Hotel located at Rambla Raval 19 (www.barceloraval.com) – nominal outdoor pool, OK gym, nice room, good central location, but area may be somewhat “seedy” and not sure what it is like at night. (3) AC Diplomatic Hotel located at Pau Claris 122 (www.ac-hotels.com) – small outdoor pool, nominal gym, nice room, great central location. (4) Icaria Hotel located at Avenida Icaria 195 (www.hotelicariabarcelona.com) – nice outdoor pool, OK gym, nice room, great BEACH location not too far from city center (both Fira Palace Hotel and Icaria Hotel are about the same distance to Plaza Catalunya in the city center, but from different sides of town). (5) Miramar Hotel located at Plaza Carlos Ibanez 3 (www.hotelmiramarbarcelona.com) – great outdoor pool, good gym, nice room, romantic garden and sea view, unusual location (it is actually in Montjuic Park close to where the cable cars depart to go to San Sebastian beach). Probably either a taxi or use of the city bus or funicular (included in the metro ticket) is necessary to get there (it is a quite steep hill) since otherwise when walking one has to wind around the road going up the steep hill. In our estimation, the only one of the above hotels that we objectively thought would be better than Fira Palace was Miramar Hotel. However, Miramar is significantly more expensive than Fira Palace and is not in as good of a location as Fira Palace. Thus, when taking into consideration a desired balance between price and quality/quantity, Fira Palace still wins out with us in terms of our budget. Also, it should be noted that IF you are interested in combining a city/beach vacation, the Icaria Hotel very nicely allows you to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms in business hotel close to trade fair”
Reviews.Author: cheftrainer
Reviews.Content: This 4 star + hotel has nice large rooms. The hotel has a gym in the basement and a pool. The double bed we had in our room was enormous. The surrounding area is a bit dead. Big plus: Bus #46 goes directly from the airport terminal T2 to the hotel @ Plaza Espanya for 1,45 €!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent combination leisure+business”
Reviews.Author: hanssterkendries
Reviews.Content: This 4* hotel is located next to the Barcelona conference center Fira which makes it the perfect stay when attending one of the fairs but also Montjuïc with the Palau Nacional (now the National Art Museum) and the Magic Fountain are a stone's throw away. From Plaça de Espanya you can get to the city center in a few minutes. Walking however is hardly an option because it would take you about 35 minutes. The standard room I got was huge and was equipped with two king size beds. The bathroom had both a bathtube as a seperate (massage) shower and a seperate toilet with bidet. Plenty of room to store your stuff around the two wash basins, which is always a plus in my book. Also: enough free electric sockets, allowing you to charge batteries and so on. The room did have its shortcomings in that it is showing signs of age: a cracked tile in the bathroom, the floor to floor carpet is a little worn out, the shower heads spinkle in every direction... The view from my room wasn't the best: I was looking onto the roof of another building. But overall: excellent hotel. The breakfast buffet is great! Incredible choice, inclusing Spanish ham and salmon, and espresso machine... There are two tables that feature exactly the same so you don't have to stand in line forever...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel though relatively expensive..”
Reviews.Author: oronp
Reviews.Content: Came for a conference at FIRA (260m away...). Generally a great location (5 minutes from Plaza Espania) but in a quiet place. I got through the IPrefer the the twin bed renovated room (really beatiful), which was replaced to the double room. Both rooms are spacious, but later needs some renovation... Hotel very nice, very clean, staff very supporative and friendly. Only major con is Breakfast which can be much better..., otherwise very nice. When I stayed (end of Septeber), there were few conferences, and prices went sky high due to shortage of rooms. This one definitely does not worth 250euros a night. Half will do.... Bar and restaurant very expensive (therefore always empty...). Overall, a nice place to stay, but get a cost effective deal, not at the last moment... Definitelly will come again, but plan ahead... ;-) ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Well situated, Good Standard, Expensive Bar.”
Reviews.Author: IHorsfield
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the room we had was very large, the bathroom was dated but clean. It was situated in a good area very near the Magic Fountains, five minutes from the Underground and less to the Highly Recommended City tour bus. However it was good until we had a drink in the Hotel Bar *Mistake* Horrendous price for a round of drinks, so with the exception of the hotel Bar I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September and what an enjoyable experience. The rooms are large and very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is great. It is quiet and close to all transportation. I will not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spot”
Reviews.Author: inspaininthemembrane
Reviews.Content: I wish we had found this hotel at the beginning of our trip to Barcelona and it will definitely be where we stay when we return. The rates are reasonable for Barcelona; you can get some real dumps for a similar rate. This hotel is no dump. The staff is dignified, but not pretentious. Each person working embodied the refreshing vibe that Spain offers. The room was terrific. It was clean and classy but not overdone or trying to blow my mind. It was just very comfortable. The bathroom and showers were A+. The room was well sound-proofed from street noise and other guests. Location of the place is great as well; its not right in the middle of tourist hell, but you can get there quickly if you like, or easily avoid it. The restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel is spectacular. The menu is very creative, even for Spain, and the service was that classic classy delivery that you find often in Spain. The breakfast is reasonably priced and on the level of the Paradors' breakfast. We stayed our last night in Spain here and booked the room the day before when we were at some crummy place and we didn't want to end our vacation there, so we found this place, and it just made all the difference in the world. They get all my love, and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “First-rate Hotel at a Reasonable Cost”
Reviews.Author: CherylGrrl
Reviews.Content: This is a first-rate hotel and was a wonderful bargain for a 4-day stay. Rooms were very clean, modern, and comfortable. We joined their frequent guest program and got an upgraded room and free wifi. We went on a cruise and tried to book one additional night after the cruise, but the room rate doubled! We went to another well-rated hotel but it was a considerable step down in quality from the Fira Palace. Book early!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pjv34
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean and modern. I was impressed with the check-in centre, and the abilities of desk staff to converse in English. My room was very clean, and the cleaning staff were excellent. The food in the main restaurant was very good, but fairly overpriced relative to other nice restaurants that were within a 10 minute walk. My only real complaint was the thinness of the walls which made it easy to hear running taps, showers, flushing of toilets in adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A gem! Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: lex103
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early in the morning and were able to check-in (sleep) immediately! We were pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel was conveniently located ... Very easy to walk to Playa Espana/The Arena for breakfast, shopping and to catch the Metro. The staff at Fira Palace were excellent. The hotel is very clean. Our room was spacious... Bathroom was very nice. (Separate tub/shower ... two sinks). We would definitely stay here again. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location / Clean / Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Aido1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fira palace for three nights at the end of july. The three nights concluded our trip around europe. We booked a regular double room for the stay, but on arrival we got upgraded to a suite. The suite was fantastic, spacious, large bathroom, sofa, desk chairs- all the works it was perfect. It was aperfect hotel to finish up in. Hotel is located very close to the magic fountain, area was very safe at night, very close to the underground system and very close to the barcelona sightseeing bus stop. Only bad thing was the water in the pool was freezing :) Would i stay here again, you bet i would.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the bath room”
Reviews.Author: slashgari
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit far from center of the city but, Rooms are big, and Bath room great for a family of 3 after our stay in Paris the huge room and bath room in this hotel was impressive. The bath room had two sinks, two shower one with bath tub one without, toilet and bidet were separate so three people easily could take shower and wash without any problem and being on each other's way. If we stayed at the center of the city we would not discover the Magic Fountain which was a real great treat and within walking distantce. Staff were somehow helpful but I expected more The hotel itself is huge, with pool, receiption area and several computers. Gym area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: uzitassa
Reviews.Content: This excellent hotel is near Placa d' Espanya and within walking distance to many of the nice attractions in Barcelona. We stayed there two nights and enjoyed it very much. The rooms were very comfort. The hotel staff was very helpfull, e.g. they helped us to enjoy a flamenco show. There was a desktop computer with a printer at the lobby to access the internet. It worth its price!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: willtwink
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again this year for 5 nights, having first stayed here in 2004. I have to say it was fabulous again - the rooms are exceptionallly large with 2 queen beds and 1 headboard over them both, great for stetching out. The room also had a desk, setee, digital safe ,tv, mini bar and in the bathroom 2 sinks, power shower room, bath and toilet room. Made use of the dressing gowns and slippers provided. There was also a turn down service at night and the maid left 2*3 different chocolates each night. We booked direct with the hotel. The breakfast was excellent and cost 12 euro/person (incuding tax) - if you only booked the room at 80 euros/night (tax extra) which we did because you cannot eat a breakfast every morning after eating late. We also eat twice in the "Le Mall" restaurant which was very good and reasonably priced for the standard of cuisine. They also have a piano bar called Scruples for drinks and cocktails - but we didnt see anyone playing, perhaps they just have this at the weeken and we were staying Sunday to Friday. Hotel very handy - 150 m for underground at Plaza ESPANYA and the majic fountain and Montjuic. Nicely away from the husle and bustle of the Ramblas. Other restaurants nearby on the Av Parralel within walking distance - also quite good. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “very nice - would return”
Reviews.Author: linden123
Reviews.Content: staff were very friendly - arrived at 10am and our room was ready. Three in our room but there was plenty of space and beds comfortable . Good location - Magic Fountain only 5 minutes away and so is the Metro. Restaurant is great - dinner buffet is 20 euros per person. Also fantastic but expensive cocktails in The Piano Bar. Just a few minor points - rooms really need a make over, coffee and tea making facilities would be great and a pay per view movie channel for non-Spanish guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stockgangster
Reviews.Content: Room: We traveled to Barcelona from August 17, 2011 to September 4, 2011. We stayed in the hotel two times during the period. The first time was the first 4 days of our trip and we were upgraded from a regular room all the way to a junior suite. The suite is very nice with a huge king size bed in bedroom and a sleep sofa in living room. It also has very large bathroom with bathtub and a separate fancy showing room. We were also grated with a complimentary bottle of wine. The tips is that you need to enroll in the membership of iperfer hotel chain (http://www.iprefer.com/) and book the hotel through their link to get these perks (upgrades, wine and free wireless internet in your room!). The rate offered by their site directly is no worse than any other sites. I paid for 99 Euro/night for all these! The second time we used hotel was 8/25 when we returned from Madrid and ready to go on cruise. We were again upgraded to an executive room which has two large queen beds and received a bottle of wine. In both cases, we have plenty of bed rooms for us (two adults and two young children) to share with. This is not typical in European hotels as you know in most cases the rooms are small and beds are small. Location and transportation: The location is not central but very convenient. Location is not in the busiest tourist area (Las Ramblas street or city center) but is very close to Magic fountain shows (a must see event from Friday night to Sunday night) in National museum area (300 meters from hotel). Airport is a little far but aerobus (3.5 euro) stop is about 1 km away. There is also a bus stop (forgot bus number) right outside of hotel to take you the beginning of the Las Ramblas ( Plaça de Catalunya) which they call the city center. The bus ride is about 10 minutes and cost is litter under 1 euro if you buy T10 tickets from airport or any subway station, otherwise you pay 1.4 per ride. The bus runs to about 10:30pm in the night. You can also the metro (subway). The metro (subway) is about 5-7 minutes walking from the hotel to a large street (avinguda del Paral.lel). And if you plan to take cruise during your trip, the hotel is only about 5 km (3 miles) from the cruise terminals. So it’s fantastic for people like us for pre-cruise stay. Facilities and services: hotel has a pretty nice and big lobby area that provides a nice sitting area and 3 sets of computers for free internet access. The inside swimming pool was small and a litter old but enough for our two young draughts to have some fun after busy days walking around the city. Staff: the staffs were nice and professional. Food: I never used hotel restaurant as I think the food was over priced and menu is kind of boring. We ate two times in a restaurant (Rías de Galicia?) and we absolutely loved the snail dish it provides. Overall, I think this is the hotel that not overcharged you with it's quality rooms and services. I will also review the other two hotel stays we had in Spain (one in Madrid and another in Barcelona airport area) in case you are interested. The review link is provided by: ..... later

Reviews.Title: “OK but probably not the best”
Reviews.Author: PerthLaura
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, the location was ok as it was on the hop-on-hop-off bus route but it was not near the La Ramblas.
