Although there are 6 computers, 3 were not turned on and 1 was broken down and when the other 2 are in use by people conversing on facebook for more than 3 hours one night I asked the reception if they could put the 3 other computers on to which I was told that they would be on during the daytime, so come back tomorrow. This was a complete lie as these computers were never turned on during the 3 days I was there. Wifi in your room is for half hour only otherwise you pay for 24 hours access. Lies always add up to disappointed customers and I would not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent standing for a moderate price”
Reviews.Author: davidryam
Reviews.Content: 5 mins from plaza Espanya, metro hub that allows you to move easily everywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ZikicS
Reviews.Content: Positive: Perfect location. Nice, large room. Excellent service. Good value for money. Negative Too hard beds. Smell of mildew in the bathroom. Not a big deal but I expected bathrobe and slippers in a 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: nicola096
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona for my 40th birthday and chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews. Our party stayed in three rooms for four nights. The hotel is situated within easy reach of the airport bus (10 minute walk) and is easy to find. We arrived at 2 pm and our rooms were not ready so we decided to have a drink in the hotel bar. This was the only time we visited the bar because we were shocked at how expensive it was. We have stayed in many hotels and expect the bar prices to be high but 30 euros for four small beers and two soft drinks!! The rooms varied. I think my room was upgraded to an executive and was very pleasant. It had two double beds and a separate shower with modern decor. It had bath robes and slippers, complimentary wine, chocolates and bottled water. However, the other two rooms were much more dated. My sister-in-law had what looked like a suite, however the furniture was old and the wallpaper looked like something from the early eighties so not at all luxurious. The kids loved the pool but it wasn't anything special and a little drab. The location of the hotel was good. The area is very busy on a weekend due to the fountains, which were great. There is a shopping centre nearby (old bull ring) and you can go up to the roof and see views of Barcelona. We ate in a restaurant up there for my birthday. Breakfast at the hotel was great. You could even have champagne, which we did on the day of my birthday. Staff were pleasant and only to happy to provide us with plates and a knife to cut up my birthday cake. All-in-all we had a great time at Fira Palace and the price was pretty good for this standard of hotel. We would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: b89cao
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in wonderful Barcelona. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located about a 3 minute walk from The Magic Fountain (a must see show!!!) and 15 minute walk from The Spanish Village. The room was a fantastic size, two queen size beds, a writing desk and a sofa, flat TV and fridge. The bathroom was equipped with a shower over the bath and a walk-in shower. The room had a great view over the Tibidabo hill. The only negative aspect: there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, not much of an issue as I had read another review prior to going and took a travel kettle but I still think it should be included. I would definitely select this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: G P
Reviews.Content: Room was very large, comfortable and extremely clean. Bathroom had a walk in shower and a separate bathtub. Staff very friendly and helpful with information on getting around and what to see. Hotel close to metro and buses. Walking distance from Plaza Espanya and the Magic Fountain of Montjuïc (must see.) The pool was a little gross since it's enclosed, pretty small and lots of Europeans don't seem to know they should rinse off before getting in. Free wifi for 30 minutes a day, if not unlimited use of desktops in the lobby. Paid parking access.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: debsm33
Reviews.Content: Lovely large room with 2 double beds and sofa bed and excellent bathroom. Quiet air conditioning and helpful staff. Only minus point was beds very hard but sofa bed better. We found the location excellent near the magic fountains and Olympic areas, plenty of bus stops and metro nearby. Also breakfast expensive at 13 euros each but there are plenty of cafe bars locally.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachwill
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel with our two children. The room was massive - 2 queen sized beds, desk, sofa and table etc. Bathroom was the best I have ever seen in Europe - seperate walk in shower with different shower heads, bath, twin sinks. We felt this was great accomodation in a great location. Hotel was a 2 minutes walk from the famous fountains and only a 10 minute walk to the subway Espana. The best bit is the swimming pool and gym where you can escape the mid day heat! We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: zindalari
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Fira Palace with my 3 year old and my Mom for three nights. We liked the hotel a lot. Spacious room, great service and a wonderful location. We felt very safe there and we'll be coming back. I definitely recommend this hotel to everybody. It's not far from the Metro station and Touristic buses stops. Arena shopping center is also nearby with lots of restaurants inside and a great view on Barcelona. A little tip: don't pay 1 euro to go up to the roof in Arena on the lift, you can easily use escalators inside.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: alonso14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and our overall experience was as the title mentions. 3 star not 4 star. Good Points: Decent location to "Magic Fountain" / Plaça d'Espanya. (walking distance) Metro close by. Taxi's outside also (relatively cheap compared to the high prices here in Ireland). Bad points: As some reviewers on here have mentioned, rooms are hit/miss. Ours was okay. However, we paid for an executive room and were put into a standard room. Upon both arrival and check out I mentioned this , but was greeted with the same answer. "I was assigned an executive room". This was not the case, as I had family staying there also, and their rooms (standard) were exactly the same as ours. No attempt was made to remedy/amend bill from Executive to Standard upon check out. It was early in the morning, the receptionist had poor English and I didn't have the energy to argue. I had also mentioned that the Housekeeping service was poor. Dirty glasses left in the room, bathroom amenities not replenished properly, Turn down service (as part of our executive room package) not implemented. Again I was met with a look as if to say "so what?" Not the kind of service you would expect from a hotel claiming to be a Luxury Hotel. Would I stay here again? Possibly, but would look at alternatives before I decide.

Reviews.Title: “loved it but dated rooms and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: porsche374
Reviews.Content: loved it teh rest of the hotel is great, bar service excellant, room service needs more common sence communication, but dated rooms and bathroom all need to be updated since we have stayed here 3 years runnung. Excellant location for hotel . Hotel needs to sell itself more on internet for its location to all new toursit sopts esp the Bull ring upgrade to shopping center and Magical fountains. Excuse spellings as ma in a rush !

Reviews.Title: “Good, Calm, Clean - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jani T
Reviews.Content: We made the booking over the internet. The room was prepared and keys ready as and when we arrived. We were in our rooms within 5 mins of arriving at the reception. Rooms was cleaned regularly. Beds made every day - including the third bed for our son. Towels changed and clean ones provided. Only drawback is - we would have appreciated if we could have had a kettle in the room. Of course everything was available in room service. Could provide at least one children TV program channel. Breakfast was value for money. Coffee was fantastic - two cups every morning :-) Could do better with the restaurant for dinner time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful for our family of 6.”
Reviews.Author: DrogTF
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights in the Fira Palace Hotel. We had two family rooms and the value was outstanding. The hotel staff were very helpful and welcoming. The buffet breakfast was absolutely gorgeous. It was a special trip for a birthday and this hotel made that very special. The taxi driver was also very good. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tierworker
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for two nights. We are a family of 6 with children between 7 and 15. We absolutely loved this hotel from the moment we stepped inside. As other reviewers have said it is in a quiet spot but still close to everything. It is very clean and comfortable. Fabulous bathrooms. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and they all speak very good English. They arranged a taxi for us to and from the airport. The taxi, Toni was very reasonable- €45. He spoke excellent English too and gave us great advice about the city, unfortunately we have very little Spanish. When we arrived at the hotel the staff had noted that we had requested no smoking rooms but they said that the last occupants had smoked in the room. We had booked two family rooms and without extra charge they immediately upgraded us to a beautiful suite and extended the stay until 6pm on our day of departure. We really appreciated this, especially as we hadn't requested it. The buffet breakfast is excellent, a real treat. We absolutely loved Barcelona and this hotel and we really, really hope that we will be able to return. We highly recommend it. It was also excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Improvement needed on a few points”
Reviews.Author: JLN131262
Reviews.Content: We had a stay of five days it was a noisy hotel, the walls between rooms are thin. There was a musty smell of smoke in the hall and into our room, it turned out to be a smoking room. Everything is clean, there is much gepoetst.Het breakfast is fine but expensive and the coffee is old. Situated in a nice quiet neighborhood and the staff is very friendly and correct. The petitions are old, hard, crack and are not of this time, especially for a four star hotel. The mini bar is ridiculously expensive. We have a nice time in beautiful Barcelona, also thanks to this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: richpea11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night, following a family holiday in Colonge, just up the coast. It is a fine hotel and as previously stated, does have some large rooms. That was handy for us as we were three adults in the room. It is easy to get into the centre and it is very easy to reach the airport from this hotel. Key tip? Take a look at the Magic Fountains, just a few steps up the road. A stunning show every evening.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: ISC077
Reviews.Content: We travelled with two children and stayed in the executive suite. We found the room to be very specious in comparision to many other we have stayed and bathroom facilities to be excellent. The fact that the hotel had a pool, was particularly appeasing for the children. We found the hotel to be ideally positioned for use, not too close to hustle and bustle of the La Rambles, but in easy reach. The hotel is located next to Palau Nacional and the amazing magic fountains (please note that the fountain display runs on Thurs - Sun only). We hired a car for duration of our visit, which we picked up and dropped of at the airport. As a result we saved airport transfer costs of approx 70 euro's, and travelled around the city and costa brava with ease. Driving in Barcelona, and parking was not difficult at all, there were underground car park facilities everywhere. We managed to see and do more as a result on the having a car.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY AT FIRA PALACE”
Reviews.Author: beachlover0831
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at Fira Palace Hotel and I am pleased to say that I could'nt have chosen a better hotel. All the staff were pleasant and happy to help which I really appreciated as I was traveling alone with my young son. The room we had was enormous with 2 double beds plus a sofa bed and lovely well equipped bathroom all spotlessly clean. Yes the bed was a bit hard but we had no problems sleeping as the area around the hotel was so quiet and not disturbed by the comings & goings of other guests either. This hotel is less that 5 mins walk from the magic fountains which is one of the reasons for choosing this hotel the other reason was the swimming pool fantastic the reception for the gym and pool provide towels and a locker key. Breakfast was perfect lots of choice seperate selection of orgainic & diabetic foods and my personal favorite being a coffee adict there was a 'nespresso' type coffee machine with a full selection of different coffee blend capsules that really made my day! All in all a lovely hotel close enough to some major sites but away from the hustle and bustle. I will definately choose this hotel when I come to Barcelona again

Reviews.Title: “Very good location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dontwakemeupk
Reviews.Content: While visiting Barcelona we stayed here. We got a giant room with sofa and oversized bathroom. They let us do late check out which was a plus. The hotel and the rooms were clean and well kept. The only downside was the bizarre exchange rate when changing USD to EUR.

Reviews.Title: “love Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: suey333
Reviews.Content: fridge not working on arrival. Despite notifying the desk on two occassions still broke on leaving. Warm drinks are not inviting!!!! Possible addition of an iron and coffee/tea facilities would improve standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Murp71
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great price. Lovely big rooms and only a short walk to the city. Would definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very well run hotel with very few annoying quirks.”
Reviews.Author: slagathar
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for eight nights in July of 2011. This is a very nice urban hotel in a relatively quiet part of Barcelona, just below the slope of Montjuic. It is a short walk to several very impressive museums, a beautiful fountain, gorgeous gardens and performing venues and a 10 minute walk to Placa d'Espanya, one of the main train/metro stations. There is also a very nice shopping center on the Placa recently converted from a bull ring. The restaurants in the shopping center's "food court" are more than decent and we stopped there on our way back from sight seeing more than once. The good: The hotel is clean and modern and its hard-working, honest staff is attentive nearly to the level of ocd (I left a pair of very expensive prescription sunglasses in the lobby which were returned to me promptly). The rooms are very large by urban standards and the bathrooms are very nice indeed. The restaurant (including the breakfast buffet) is excellent, if (justifiably) expensive. The bad: The beds! Even with a "pillow top", requested on the fourth night, it was difficult to sleep. The pillows are not standard. They are basically thin bolsters. I really do not understand the bed situation, given the otherwise fine furnishings of this hotel. The only trivially annoying: WIFI is only available for 1/2 hour per day and wifi coverage for the paid wifi is spotty, even from the first floor where we were staing. However, there are three computers in the lobby with free internet access. Also, though requested on check-in, we were not given the free upgrade promised by my membership in the "I Preferr Guest Program." Parking is stunningly expensive: about $50 per day (though I think this is more a function of Barcelona in general than the fault of the hotel management). Overall, this is a very good hotel and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the noise & clean”
Reviews.Author: 155019Happytraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently spent one night in the Fira Palace before embarking on a 12 day cruise. We found the hotel staff friendly and helpful, and they all spoke English very well. We were pleasantly surprised that our room was available upon our early morning arrival which was an added bonus as we had just endured a red eye flight from Toronto, Canada. The hotel itself was very clean and quiet. The beds and pillows were not as comfy as you might expect at a four star hotel at home, but it was only one night. I found it odd but they didn't have any face cloths either. There are plenty of cafes within a short walk to grab breakfast or lunch. It was about a 20-25 minute walk to the Ramblas, and about a 10 minute walk to the Spanish village.

Reviews.Title: “Not right in the centre, but easy transport links”
Reviews.Author: Spooky.nurse
Reviews.Content: Stayed while attending a conference at the hotel. Large room with bed and sofa. Great bathroom - fancy shower with multiple jets plus a separate bath - all in good order and immaculately clean. Bed a little hard for my liking but that is personal preference. Staff very polite and helpful and breakfast was lovely. Food supplied for conference was great as well, and well organised. Not right in the tourist centre of Barcelona, but lots of nice local restaurants. Transport was not problem, either around town or catching the airport bus which stooped about 5 munites walk away. Paid for internet for your laptop but at least 6 free internet computers in the public areas available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a brilliant breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: gibraltarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre -cruise. The hotel was well located for the fountains in the evening. The reception staff pointed us in the direction of a choice of restaurants nearby, we ate well. The metro line that went right outside Casa Batllo was only a few minutes walk away and check out was not until 12 noon so there was time to do a visit. There was a pool in the basement so we had a little swim to keep us busy until it was time to go off and look for supper. I paid a basic rate but the room was enormous, I may have got an upgrade without knowing. There were lots of toiletries and slippers in the room - in these recession filled times, I thought that was a huge treat. The breakfast was almost the best I have ever had (best buffet award goes to the Hilton Metropole in London). I was sorry that I was only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay & would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: I Enjoy Holidays
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona as our grandson was competing in a Diving Competition. We decided to have an extended stay having not visited before. We stayed in the Fira Palace for 8 nights and thought the location ideal, also found the staff, room and amenities first class. We definately recommend taking the 2 day tourist open top bus trip as this gave you invaluable information on the history and sights of the city. We had our seven year old grand daughter with us so found the beaches were very accessable and enjoyable. The transport system is also very good we used the railway, metro and buses the mulitfunction travel tickets are very good value. Enjoyed our visit to Sitges and Illa Fantasia Water Park.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel,accessible to all transportation”
Reviews.Author: Mc42000
Reviews.Content: big rooms and the airconditioning is fantastic!! clean room and chocolates everyday..GREAT! Ice machine on the third floor is a big ++++:))) accessible to all transportation. just ca. 300 meters walk to the magic fountain

Reviews.Title: “strategic and safe location to start touring barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jaffa-travel
Reviews.Content: very good value for money. parking should be complimentary. for families going for a local stroll by montjuic, relax and enjoy.... the police station is around the corner from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Value For Your Money”
Reviews.Author: ukirmani
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and child in this hotel for one night as we were taking a mediterrinian cruise from Barcelona. The hotel is near Plaza Espanaya. It's the first stop of the Aerobus from the airport. Once you get off hotel is about 10 minute walk from the bus stop. The hotel is very clean, and staff is very helpful. They speak English well, It takes about 15 minutes taxi ride to get to the cruise terminal from the hotel. The cost depending on the number of luggae you are carrying with you will be between 15-20 Euro. The metro stop is also 5-8 minutes walk and the metro connects you to city centre and all the other attractions within the city. All in all I had a very good experience and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dmambler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good alternative location to La Rambla. Highly recommend. We used this hotel prior to our cruise and it was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Accomodations & Location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very clean, the room & bathroom large and accomodating. Location worked out wonderful for us - husband & I and our 17 yr old daughter. We could walk to two train stations, the Magic fountain at night, the mall at the old bull fighting arena, and to Montjuic. Bed was comfortable, minus the one long pillow they use instead of 2 std pillows. What is missing at this hotel is a concierge - the front desk staff was professional, courteous, but not very friendly and offered no information as to what was in the neighborhood area. We did not use the hotel restaurant. We did enjoy the hotel lounge in the afternoon and the barista/bartendar made great g&t's and cappucinnos. Great place to relax after sightseeing. There is a great little pizza place right outside the hotel - Napoli I think is the name. We also ate at Basilco restaurant a few blocks away. We also discovered our last day that the arena at Placa de Espanya, about 3 blocks away, free to go up to the rooftop has some great restaurants and great view. Would have been nice for the hotel to have some of this information available and offer as we didn't discover the arena rooftop restaurants until our last day -- there is also a grocery store in the arena mall to purchase snacks and water. Loved the walk to the magic fountain, subway, and Montjuic. It was also nice to have a taxis always there - and the taxi drivers were very nice and helpful. We would recommend this hotel, but go prepared with knowledge of what's in the area. Would love to do some marketing for this place as it's a great hotel, just not promoting itself well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pre/post Cruise!”
Reviews.Author: WineTraveller
Reviews.Content: Within a specific niche, I highly recommend this hotel. If you're looking for something with charm and character, keep looking! But if you're looking for a VERY clean, VERY large room with excellent service, try it out. We stayed here at the back-end of our vacation and it perfectly suited us (especially with the €94/night room rate we got from their website!!!!!). Don't know that I would want to necessarily use it as a base for an extended vacation visit, but for a business trip or a pre-/post-cruise stay in Barcelona, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better proposition! BTW, sign up for the hotel's frequent guest program. It is free, gets you a room upgrade (if available) and free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we would have stayed here longer”
Reviews.Author: bgphx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is phinominal. The room is VERY spacious and the bathroom is bigger than the room we stayed in at the previous Barcelona hotel. The location is great. Easy to get to the Palace, Plaza Espana and Paca de Catalunya (Rambla). Highly recommend and we would welcome the opportunity to stay again. We did not get an opportunity to use the exercise facility or pool but they look awesome.

Reviews.Title: “"Just what was required"”
Reviews.Author: Highlandtourist
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their own website. I was very pleasantly surprised on arrival at the quality of the hotel. Our stay was 1 night only. The staff at reception could not have been more welcoming or helpful and this was reflected in all other members of staff. The hotel, which had quite a number of different sizes of conference rooms, had a very extensive lounge area in open plan with a sizeable bright and airy reception area. The bedroom was generous in size as was the bed, with very nice en suite facilities, it, in common with all other areas of the hotel were spotlessley clean. The breakfast was a substantial buffet style with a choice of cerial, fruit juice, cold meats and cheeses and also cooked items including crispy bacon and scrambled eggs. It had a small swimming pool, which is accessed from the basement and is part of a leisure club. once in the pool area you take a lift up 2 floors to their reception area where you get towels and a locker key. The hotel is located 10-15 minutes walk from Placa Espanya (which is one of the stops on the Airport - City Centre bus route), there always seemed to be plenty taxis around here as well.) It is only 5 minutes walk from the Fira Fountains, and it is a short taxi ride to the Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. This was a very good hotel in every respect and excellent value for money and I would have to say there was nothing I disliked about my stay. I would most certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, NOT 4 star..more like 2 1/2-3 star.”
Reviews.Author: msstravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel off of a private sale site because of the price and 4 star rating. The lobby is beautiful, but the rooms are VERY dated. The Staff is SO rude and NOT the least bit helpful. Any request or question was met with a shrug. I left so disgusted and appalled by the rude staff. The breakfast buffet was excellent..4star quality. If you just need a decent place to sleep,and nothing more you will be fine here. If you expect the service of a 4 star hotel DONOT stay here..you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Hutchinson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends in June 2011. The hotel is PERFECTLY located right near a central train station. There were three of us, all staying in a triple room, which was essentially two double beds. The room itself was very large, a little old (maybe 10 years old), but very good. The gym is pretty good with a small pool, two floors of weights, and several of each; treadmill, stationary bike, stair, and rowing machines. Fundamentally, the key to this hotel is the size of the rooms and the excellent location, which is walking distance to la Rambla, but in a very quiet area. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Faith_Orpington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fira Palace for a ladies weekend and loved the hotel. The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. It's not too far from Placa Espanya metro so easy access into the centre. We chose Fira Palace based on previous reviews and we were not disappointed. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food or the restaurant. If we came back to Barcelona, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It is a good place to stay and spend a few days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: vmrl
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a good place to stay. Rooms are very spacious and clean. Breakfast was very good. It was an easy walk to Montjuic and the Fontana Magica. The subway is a 5 minute walk (Plaza Espanya). However I find the rooms a bit noisy, although we had an extra door between the hall and the room. Drinks in the bar are really overpriced, but there are some good alternatives in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ATimmsNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel.It was our first trip to Barcelona but certainly won't be the last and will definitely be returning to the Fira Palace. Conveniently placed, very comfortable, massive rooms and excellent service- couldn't fault it and would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: steveomcfc
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Fira Palace for 4 nights this week, It cost us 26 euros from the airport to the hotel in a taxi. the reception staff were very friendly and helpful on checking in, we were told we had been left a present from the management in our room, They had upgraded us to an executive room and also left us a note and a 80's music CD as a welcome gift.. The room was a very large room, with two queen size beds, beautiful soft bedding, the bed was hard but comfortable and the had a pillow menu for you to choose your pillow. The room was very clean and to a high standard...the bathroom was very private, with a toilet with a door and a walk in shower as well as a bath with a shower over that..one of the best bathrooms we have seen in a hotel. We had lovely extras toothbrush, shaving kit, shampoo etc slippers and bath robes. I emailed and requested a smoking room which was given The only item that was missing was a kettle, it is nice to have a brew soon as you wake up and i like one before bed We were on room only board and we preferred this as we didnt have to rush for breakfast, we ate in a small cafe on the parrell that did pastries and coffee. You can catch the 157 down to the beach and the main attractions for 1 euro 45...good bus route The old bull ring is worth a visit for the views from the top, there is also a great tapas bar called tapa tapa next door to the bull ring...lovely food, quick service and reasonable prices. Make sure you visit the magic fountain show if you can, worth a walk up to the fountains which are a few mins walk turning left from the hotel.. we will always stay at the fira palace when we go to barcelona in the future...hopefully we will try the other amenities and the food

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Arie_Sh
Reviews.Content: This is a bussiness style hotel, that matches its 4 star tourist rating . Rooms are BIG and well equipped and maintained. Bad is big and comftorbale. Big cabinet with large size safe. Ususlly 3 people at front desk, each one knows English in a good level. They had answers to all our questions : shoping, transport, money, restorants. They are polite, proffessional , ready to help . They are not trying to be friendly (as some mentioned earlier) , but this is not really their job !!! We got a room facing the back , so no nice view , but also no trafic noise ( although also the front is not a busy street). We did not take the breakfast . There is a good bakery across the street , and a small groccesy store down the street. Internet : Several free internet computers at lobby and -1 floors. You are allowed for a 30 min free wifi a day. Take a card at the front desk even in days when you don't use it- you can use it in another day . If you have friends with no laptop - have them take a free card also ... Signal strength at the room is not the best . Location : Near place Espana, and the magic fountains. Not near Rambla. Metro : your are 2 to 4 Metro stations from Rambla ( 5 min ride, 5 min walk to station), or a bus station just across the street ( every 15 min, 10 min ride to Place Catalunia). Notes: rooms adjusant to service rooms are not recommanded (noise). Not enough light in the room. Barcelona : be ware of thiefs , especially at the Metro. You can sometimes notice them in small groups . Stay away from crouded situations at the Metro , and don't carry valuable things in a bag . Just in pocket, special belt, or in hand.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for conferences”
Reviews.Author: hmuk09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and it was comfortable and spacious, close to the Plaza d'Espanya. I wouldn't really recommend it four tourists, as it's quite far from the centre, attractions, and the best tapas places! It also seems to lack a nice outdoor terrace (lots of other places in barca have a nice terrace and possibly a pool on the roof; here the pool is in the basement). Only 30 min of free wifi per day. Some computers available. Chech the I prefer scheme and yeego.com for deals. We also printed a free upgrade voucher off tripadvisor, which seemed to work. Lolita is a good tapas place nearby, and Tapa Tapa at the Arena shopping centre on Plaza d'Espanya is decent and fast. I wouldn't recommend Luki. (Go up to the top of the shopping centre in the evening and look at the view). Also found a nice bakery nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: OnTheMove229
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly, great location, and clean (which is huge considering many hotels have bed bug issues). I read a lot of reviews commenting on the hardness of the beds; but I must say, it did not detract from the experience at all. Would definitely stay again. By the way, the little restaurant on the corner (same side of the street as the hotel) is delightful. And it is an easy walk to Montjuic Park -- totally worth the time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: sekamina
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for 4 nights and stayed at Villa Emilia for the first 2 nights, then moved over to Fira Palace for the last two nights. We loved both hotels and they both had their own unique charm. Villa Emilia was nice and modern even though the room was pretty small. When we saw our room at Fira, it looked palatial (pun totally intended) compared to our room at Villa Emilia. The room is really large with a separate den/desk area. The bathroom was also huge: separate toilet/bidet area, double sinks, large tub & separate walk in shower. They also provided a new loofah, spa slippers and a spa robe. It was a great pampering experience! Overall, we were really satisfied with the experience at the hotel. On our last night in Barcelona, we were tired of tapas so decided to try a little Italian spot on the same block (Il Golfo di Napoli I think was the name). Great food right next door! We tried to check out the pool, but it was pretty small. The sauna is also in the individual mens/womens locker rooms, so its not like you can use it with a significant other of a different gender. I did have two complaints: 1) It was pouring rain our last day in Barcelona and the hotel does not offer any umbrellas for guests. BIG MISTAKE and definitely a plus 1 for Villa Emilia as they did offer them to their guests so I guess we were already spoiled. 2) They give you a code for internet usage that is good for only 30 minutes of free internet. The code comes on a scratch-off lottery ticket type card. When we tried to scratch it off, the code came off with it and so we just had to end up buying a full day of internet for $7 (or maybe it was 7 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay”
Reviews.Author: Kusal S
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with all amneties. Located well within the city and transport channels. Very comfortable & fully equipped rooms. Excellent food, pool, sauna etc etc. Really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoy our stay in Barcelona, we will recommend Fira Palace Hotel to our friends”
Reviews.Author: Stanislav1977
Reviews.Content: We like hotel so much, room was large and comfortable, bathroom was good. Breakfast very nice and choice was good, so you can change your menu every day. Free Wi-Fi in our room (30 min per day) was enough for us and quite useful. Personal & service on high level. Thanks to Hotel Management & Personal for our good time in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Oaklands_Visitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 adults & 3 children on a special deal with the 'I Prefer' programme - otherwise it would have been out of budget. This is mainly a business hotel focused on trade fairs. But we managed to get a great deal by joining the I Prefer programme before booking. The main purpose of our visit was to see Barcelona play and the hotel provided a great base for our holiday. The location is great and there are lots of interesting things to do in the locality. The decor and experience is what you would expect from a top quality hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location...great business venue”
Reviews.Author: RutlandUkRob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference that was also being held in the hotel. Standard room was large with a modern bathroom - good shower. 2 large double beds rather excessive - one bed with good quality linen that we've come to expect in the UK would have been better. Staff very polite and efficient and the food was excellent, particularly the buffet breakfast which had freshly squeezed orange juice and a massive variety of meats, cooked items, pastries.... Quiet location is refreshing as Spain can be noisy at night...20 min walk to the historic centre.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Ualcapsteve
Reviews.Content: Walked up May 8th with no reservation after reading trip Advisor reviews. Great Location for Cruisers or walking Montjuic. Nice room, good service, great Pastries across the street. Beds Are hard but serviceable. Easy walk from Aerobus stop at Plaza Espanya. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise! Almost perfect to me!”
Reviews.Author: HotelCooler
Reviews.Content: Add a coffee machine in the room and you will have a five star hotel. Ideally located next to the "Fira de Barcelona", if your business requires it. Walking distance to "Plaça d'Espanya", but you need metro, bus or taxi to go to "Plaça de Catalunya", las Ramblas, the sea front, etc. It's a €7-9 taxi ride to the above. Excellent service, large room, clean and comfortable. Nice and quite sleep, even when the room faces the busy street.  The unusual long single pillow for two might give you some hard time. Complete set of amenities:  dental kit, shower cap, shaving kit, vanity kit, shampoo, shower gel, conditioner, body cream, body scrubber, sleepers, shoe polish, sewing kit. If you go through the TV channels and find only spanish programs, no worries; you are in the Digital. Go to Analog and you will find the English, French etc channels. Comfortable desk to work. WiFi available everywhere. 30 minutes per day free access. Only 7€ for a 24 hours access from the time that you first login. Acceptable speed.  PCs for the public. Smoking rooms available. The windows open. Collect a copy of English newspaper next to the front desk. Laundry: expensive. Mini bar: expensive water, affordable alcohol (as usual). Bathroom with separate bath tab and shower cabin. Warning: The shower cabin may be dangerous: deep and slippery shower basin, sharp edges and cutting corners, frameless glass door! Be careful! Variety of tasty options for breakfast. Nice food. Gym, pool etc. available. Excellent conference facilities. I will be happy to return, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable...”
Reviews.Author: Polardo
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms with enormous king size beds....Very comfortable place, 5 minutes walk from the metro station...very close to placa Espanya and Font Magica...excellent room service....But not free Wi-fi Internet and breakfast....Still believe that it could be the best choice for Barcelona..!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: Malynn714
Reviews.Content: The room very nice. The receptionist Diego when we checked in was very pleasant, friendly and accomodating. The location was perfect. Quiet neighborhood but very near the metro and bus station. The hotel was also near the Royal Palace of arts and the Toro blg. at Plaza de Espana. It is also a walking distance to the Hop on hop off bus stop which you can catch every 15 minutes. If you don't want to spend a lot of Euro for taxi or airport shuttle (€25 at least)to this hotel, you can take the express airport bus to the center of Madrid. The first stop is Plaza de Espana. There is a tourist kiosk across the street, there she can direct you to the hotel. Really only few blocks. The express airport bus cost €2.50!!!! the bus has luggage racks. Just ask the tourist info how to catch the bus. There are Also signs how to get to the bus. Now to go back to the airport if you have plenty of time, you can also catch the public bus around the corner from the hotel. We found this by accident while checking out the nearby local restaurants near the hotel. This one has some stop public bus but cost €1.20 it is bus 66. Make a left from leida( front of the hotel) then another left towards main street and you will see the bus stops. Look for #66. Now back to the hotel.Overall this is a very nice hotel. Spacious. They even provides sleepers and bath robes. They have a shower spa which we enjoyed. The only thing I wished they had was free WiFi in the rooms. They give you 30 minutes free wifi card. They do have 3 computer free on the first floor

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkonke
Reviews.Content: Booked via hotel website. We were upgraded to a suite which was very nice. Good location - not far from the most interesting sightseeing locations. On the negative side - no free internet in the room

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason_chi
Reviews.Content: Don't really have anything negative to say, other than the WiFi was a little annoying. Our rate came with free WiFi (we were there 3 days). The first day we got a 24 hour pass. After that ran out, I asked for another one, but was only given a 30 minute pass. My cell phone had data, so I just ended up using that after as I didn't feel like running all the way back down to the front desk. Room was nice and clean. Bathroom was very large. Location wasn't super, but it was only a 5 minute walk to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpmdpsca
Reviews.Content: From the time I registered to the point when I checked-out, the personnel were always helpful and courteous. The hotel itself is a very pleasant space - clean and comfortable. I would stay there again and have recommended it to friends who are traveling to Barcelona in Sept.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel in every respect”
Reviews.Author: jprice5007
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff ; very clean and comfortable with excellent food in the restaurant at both breakfast and dinner

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer0052
Reviews.Content: We arrived weary from a long frip (from Canada), and were greeted with smiles and a pitcher of cool water in the lobby. pleasant staff tries hard to please. Spacious rooms, comfortable, great gym with lots of equipment and a pool. very nice bathroom with separate shower. good variety at breakfast buffet. Short stroll to plaza espanya, new large shopping centre in the former bullfight arena, and the metro/buses to everywhere. VERY quiet in the evenings - it's ok to sleep with the windows open, which is a treat in a city location. nice strolling areas and walks to MontJuic, where there are restaurants, hiking trails, lots to see. Definitely recommend this, especially if you want a quiet hotel, with all of the services you expect, a couple of blocks away from the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Not a restful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMGIndy
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the most dilapidated hotel room I've stayed in. Very old decor, mattresses that are hard as rocks. The window would not close right, which was fine because the room was sooo hot that I wanted it open anyway. The thermostat was another issue altogether. However, the bathroom was really nice...what a difference between one room to the next.

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous hotel and lovely staff, we would recommend it to friends”
Reviews.Author: ssktbooth
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a lovely stay - thank you. There were a couple of things that could be improved - which we hope will help the hotel as follows; >the matress in our room (546) was very hard - it actually hurt our hips to turn over in bed at night. We appreciate different people like different beds and we have a ';firm' mattress at home but this was exceptionally hard. >the swimming pool was very chlorinated and hurt our eyes and throats. We would have liked to have a sauna together but they were seperated in the mens and women's changing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Carlilo
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace is very well located at walking distance from a key metro station and many attractions of Barcelona. If you plan in advance your tip than you shall get also a good deal on your money value as well. Service and personell are great as well as the quality of their meals.

Reviews.Title: “Adjust your expectations with Fira Palace - 3 stars at best not 4”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaChopsticks
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we picked Fira Palace for being at a quieter location and gym. Because of our length of stay the hotel upgraded us to a suite upon check-in. Sounds glamorous but other than having more space, the sitting room was just a room with really tired furniture. Service at the front desk was courtesy but hotel lacks facility. No coffee/tea maker, clock or iron! They have a presser for pants but if you want your shirt ironed you pay for "pressing". In room Wi-Fi was super slow so 15 mins of free daily access is nothing. Mattress was hard but that might be common in Spain. Most hotels post temperatures in the lobby they didn't have that either. I was "convicted" at the restaurant for taking a napkin wrapped sandwich up to the room during breakfast buffet. Needless to say it was embarrassing. The hostess was really upset about the missing napkin. I didn't see the note up front (can't take food) but in most hotels is no big deal especially it's just 1 item. Anyways, the positives were the bedding (in Executive room) & shower. We took taxis everywhere. Metro was about 6 mins walk. This might have been a great hotel when it was built but is definitely due for renovation. Common areas are ok but rooms and gym need immediate upgrades. Pictures do not match reality. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good balance between price and quality”
Reviews.Author: fred6159
Reviews.Content: Good location, good service, this is an excellent hotel I can suggest for a vacation in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - very hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: QueenVictoriaBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with friends on March 28, 2011. This is a great hotel, lobby is beautiful. Rooms are spacious and we had a king size bed - which was very exciting for Europe. However, it was hard as a rock! Couldn't sleep all night. The room is quite large but the furniture is dated. The bathroom was very nice and spacious with separate bath and shower - which was awesome with massage jets. No coffee maker in the room which was OK since we had breakfast included (paid $179 per/nt). Breakfast was buffet style in the restaurant in the lobby and was pretty decent. Location was good, close to the fountains and the new Commercial Center (which is a huge mall that just opened a few days ago). Overall it is a very nice hotel but I hated the bed and wouldn't stay there again for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “El perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: BB-Bear
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fira Palace for three nights with my better half. The hotel was superb. We booked room only as there are plently of eating places nearby and in the centre of Barcelona, and we didn't want to be constrained by times. The location of the hotel is central enough. It is right next to Montjuic Park which is a lovely and well worth a visit. The hotel can be accessed from the airport using the 46 bus the stop for which is right outside the airport. The bus stops at Place Espanga and the hotel is a five minute walk from there. The hotel room was terrific. We had two queen sized beds in our room. The only downside was that the bed was hard and plays havoc if you suffer with backache. That however did not detract from the other super amenities of the hotel. The bathroom was great - the best I've experienced on a city break. I would not hesitate in recommending the hotel to anyone and would certainly stay again if returing to fabulous Barca!

Reviews.Title: “In a classic style, spacey”
Reviews.Author: Sherbon
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in a double room, which was spacey, large. The interior- classic and styled like a castle, kind of an Grate Britain style. I loved the radio in bathroom. What I didn't like- I could not open the window; I don't think that blue and green colors match (design of rooms and halls); Las Rambla is about 30min walking distance away!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect marathon location!”
Reviews.Author: cateale1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as my friend was running in the Barcelona marathon which starts at Plaza Espanya. Perfect location. The hotel beat expectations totally. We had a very large room with two double beds, large bathroom with bath and shower over and a separate shower room as well as two sinks: perfect for two friends travelling together! The pool and gym were great and the location at the bottom of Montjuic ideal. A total winner! Sleep quality only got a 4 because some of the other marathon runners were being very noisy at about 6am on marathon morning - not ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: juggler100
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, clean and comfortable accommodations, pleasant staff, convenient to Montjuic attractions, close to Metro -- all made for an enjoyable stay for 3 people in the room. We primarily wanted a place to get a restful night sleep that made it easy to get to all the wonderful sights of Barcelona. The Fira was a great place for these needs. It was also a good value, costing less than all the other 4 star hotels in town that we looked at. The best deal we found was on the hotel's web site. We appreciated the relatively quiet location as we could sleep well at night. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes within a few minutes walk and with the Metro nearby we were within a few stops of most attractions. Given that we visited different sites every day anyway, being closer to the hot spots in town wouldn't have mattered much if you want to get out and explore different parts of the overall city each day. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are plenty of more affordable eating establishments nearby. We did try the restaurant in the hotel for one dinner and found it reasonable, although not as enticing as some of the other places in town. The front desk staff was helpful in answering questions and the maids did a nice job in the room. The large well-appointed hotel rooms made the stay very comfortable. Everything worked and the furnishings seemed relatively new.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: DrewFlood
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Barcelona and we picked the Fira Palace because of its location and services. The bedrooms are huge and the bathrooms also massive and plently of space for three adults sharing. The location is fantastic and the staff were absolutely superb. The breakfast is great and really sets you up for the day. Would highly recommend this hotel if you are going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great site on Montjuic”
Reviews.Author: hjmclau
Reviews.Content: Some prior comments from reviewers are misplaced. The upside of the Fira Palace is that it is in Montjuic, very near to the Magic Fountain display (cheesy music but fun to watch), the great Palau Nacional with its dramatic ascending staircases and terrace overlooking the city, and the Miro Museum sited in a lovely light building on top of Montjuic. It is NOT far away from the Barri Gotic or other areas, by metro. You take a short walk through the neighborhood of Poble Sec (which has several really good restaurants and the Mercat de les Flors with its dance and music performances) to the metro, get on with your 10T pass good for 10 rides, and in a very short time you can be anywhere in the city. One person at the desk was not helpful, but everyone else was. The maids were excellent and the room was always quite clean. The piano bar is nice, with a sweet old bartender who will give you hot water in a nice ceramic pot for tea in your room -- at no charge and with old-fashioned gentility. The beds are hard, but then they are in most hotels in Europe. The only real complaint we had was with the thin walls; a couple who had no idea how to keep their child from screaming was just down the hall. But it wasn't so bad; we slept quite well at night (perhaps because of walking umpteen miles each day?) My wife, my mother-in-law, and I stayed at the Fira Palace for 7 nights in late December, 2010. Altogether, for the great price, the quiet neighborhood, the huge room, the proximity to terrific cultural sites -- we would highly recommend it, and give it a 4.5 on the scale (which we can't do). And we loved Barcelona, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be based in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SteveHunter33
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel an ideal base for our trip to Barcelona (a city we have been to many times),the staff were helpful and always attentive. Our rooms were clean and spacious,a minor problem is the poor WiFi but we were out and about in the local bars and restuarants after a day touring this wonderful place. Well Done Fira Palace

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: sacrifice
Reviews.Content: We were at the Fira Palace for several days while seeing a Conference. The front desk staff were amongst the worst I've ever experienced - unenthusiastic, inexperienced and you got the distinct impression they were in recycled suits with no training. When you enter an old hotel you expect the staff to compensate for this...just didn't happen. difficult conversations, not stop, over multiple requests. On the other hand all the drink and food staff were more mature and great????? There should be some balance here? The location of the hotel is 15 mins away from the centre of old Barcelona. So if you're a traveller for the first time in Barcelona - you don't want to be here. If you do stay here, visit the Fira Palace, the Gardens, Ethnography museum and Miro house 15 mins up the road. Worth visiting and utterly unmentioned by front desk staff. ps: for an 'international' hotel they close on Spain hours - so don't try eating breakfast before 7am with jetlag. You would think that if you claim to be international you would ACT international.. Counted 22 patrons waiting for the breakfast doors to open ...and they opened directly at 7.01am Amateur hour compared to other hotels. Such a simple way to act like an international hotel lost???

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLDG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying for one night post cruise. A deciding factor in choosing this hotel was the early bird special price on line of 84 Euros. What a great deal! We arrived very early in the morning, around 10am and found our room ready with no wait--totally unexpected but after 14 days of heavy touring we were very grateful. The hotel was very quiet. The morning desk staff was very gracious. The hotel and room were immaculate. The room was huge and very well appointed. The bathroom was also huge with a choice of shower in the tub or a shower stall with body sprays and lovely amenities. My husband found the bed a little hard, I loved it. I did expect maybe one English TV channel but no. We had spent time pre cruise touring Barcelona so were just looking for a day of rest but Metro stations were very close. The free internet was a real bonus. There were a great many small restaurants close by, however, they seemed to close late afternoon and reopen later, typical Barcelona, very difficult to eat dinner before 7:30pm. As we wanted an early evening we opted for sandwiches in the bar, Scruples. Excellent food and service. The sandwiches were on the upper scale around 13/14 euros but huge and delicious. There were several taxis at the door at 5am for a quick getaway to the airport. A wonderful stay at twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “a business hotel should have working Internet access”
Reviews.Author: maza17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The fact that I could not get a properly working Internet connection to my room was most annoying. The connection was so slow that I settled for the 30 free minutes per day and returned the 24h/ 12EUR card I had got. When complaining to the reception about the connection I was advised to call the tech help number on the Internet card (a third party, no tech help service in the hotel, or at least they did not offer it to me). The rooms are really nice, very large and comfy, and the bathroom is also very nice, but... the mornings were really noisy from the hotel (cleaning) staff being really loud on the corridors, which again is not the expected etiquette from a 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As long as there is no conference...”
Reviews.Author: DianeChayer
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference earlier this week. The rooms are large and comfortable and truly soundproof. However, the wireless access was the worst I have experienced in a hotel. The meeting rooms were nice but I suspect the wireless system is just not sufficient. In my room, the signal was not stable and I was kicked out every 5 minutes. Had I known I would have done like many people from the conference and I would have stayed at another hotel. Furthermore, the first day, the mini bar started making a very loud noise which woke me up at 5:00. I complained but nothing happened and the noise came back during the day. The food was OK but not what the quality you expect in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and good facilites”
Reviews.Author: W41
Reviews.Content: What really impressed me was the layout and size of the room. Because of their location ((just next to the Exhibition and Convention Centre) the Fira Palace obviously attracts a lot of business travellers. Lot's of work space with an extra chair and desk, (I stayed in many so called business hotels with desks so small you could hardly find space for a laptop, let alone files and papers), sofa and coffee table, double doors (so no noise from the hallway), large bathroom with shower cubicle, bath tub, double sink, and separate toilet. WiFI worked well (most of the time) in the room as well as the lobby and in meeting rooms. It's not the most centrally located hotel but the old town, the harbour front, Las Rambals and other attractions are only a few stops away - the Barcelona Metro system is excellent and inexpensive. It's only a 3-4 minute walk to the Plaza Espanya to catch the fast Airport Bus. The only negative was the breakfast buffett - the hot food was just luke warm and on the second day of my visit I went to a little bar around the corner for breakfast at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: 2cruisersb4kids
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a one night pre-cruise stay. It is within walking distance to everything we needed and there were plenty of taxi's parked outside if we needed one. We booked a basic room, but it was very large (by american standards). The hotel staff were accomodating and pleasant. It is in a quiet area which we liked since we were exhausted from traveling. The hotel was not luxurious, but was nice enough for a short stay. I felt like the price we paid was fair. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but............”
Reviews.Author: slimjady
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the hotel. Immediately we arrived we had a small problem. On check in the member of staff asked for my passport and my wifes. Because of all the bad press Barcelona has had regarding pick pockets and thieves, my wife didn't bring any cards, passport etc. At first he said he couldn't check us in without the required information!! He suggested we go to the police station and try to get some form of identification for my wife. ARE YOU SERIOUS!! After some debate he agreed to check us in but still insisted we go to get some form of ID. Not a great start. Be warned all adult members of your party must have some form of ID with them to get in. The room was great. Very clean, very big, no problems. Pillows on the bed as hard as rock. Had to ring to reception to ask for alternatives, which they supplied. So good service there. The pool and gym area was great, good internet access in the lobby. Breakfast was not to good. The so called hot section of bacon, eggs etc was not even warm. Both mornings the food in this area was cold. On the second day I plated up my "Full English" and then had to ask a member of staff to take into the kitchen and warm it up. He did this and the breakfast was very nice. No toaster. Again had to plate up some sliced bread and had to ask for it to be toasted, which they did. No problems with the staff, very helpfull, but you shouldn't need to ask for things all the time. Hotel excellently located for the "Palau Sant Jordi" where all the big concerts are held. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would go to the hotel again, but some simple improvements would make the whole experience a more pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rakoonlvr
Reviews.Content: We were allowed to check in early. The front desk staff were very helpful in guiding us to things to do for our stay in Barcelona. They also arranged for a very early taxi to take us to the airport. Everything went off like clock work. The price was extremely reasonable for the accomodations. Loved the bathroom. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Magic Fountain, Montjuic attractions. Very big rooms.”
Reviews.Author: fter
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mainly because of the large standard room size, as we have two small children. The room entirely matched the description and pictures - very large - around 42sq.m. - with 2 queen-size beds and a sofabed. It would be easily possible to sleep 3 or 4 kids in this room. The location was also fine for us, 3 minutes walk from the magic fountain and at the foot of Montjuic, although if you prefer to be near nightlife you would probably be better staying near La Rambla or the seafront. Metro station less than 10 minutes walk and same distance to bus stops which can bring you to all the main tourist locations. (I read some reviews describing this as a long distance... I disagree, it was a pleasant walk and not far). So in summary, we were very satisfied here and would definitely return next time. Summary of plusses and minuses below. For us the minuses were unimportant but I list them anyway: + Very big room, great for family + Great location for magic fountain, Montjuic attractions + bathroom has separate shower and bath, shower and toilet have own translucent glass doors - good for a little privacy with a number of people in the room + door separating bedroom area and entrance/bathroom area - good to keep out any noise from the corridor for example + very good exercise room and weights room, it seems open to public too but I didn't see it ever busy. Swimming pool is about 15m, pool is plain but kids had a lot of fun there. + Staff polite and helpful + small little things like complimentary iced water in the lobby when we arrived, complimentary coffee in the morning. + 6 internet stations, no charge - this was really good, I haven't seen this at other hotels + Good bakery across the road, open from 6am, open Sundays and holidays too. - Swimming pool not a fancy spa. A lot of kids there on the weekend and no supervision so noisy and lot of splashing which might not suit some people. - wifi only free 30 minutes per day - kids 7 years and over should pay a supplement of 21 Eur per day. Our kid is just 7 and we negotiated out of this. - Not near nightlife or seafront, if that's what you want. - Limited number of good restaurants nearby (but there are restaurants of various levels, so you won't be hungry... just that it doesn't compare with La Rambla or seafront in terms of options). - Breakfast is expense, we didn't take it - ate at the bakery across the road or cafes instead. - TV is spanish channels only. We didn't come to a hotel to watch TV, but you might. Other: * It was very quiet when we stayed. Might be much busier if there is a conference on nearby at the FIRA Barcelona centre. * Didn't eat at restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: The4pains
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in Barcelona, a little bit out of the way to get to the City Center. If Internet was included in the room price I would have rated it higher (most hotel provide free internet now!).

Reviews.Title: “A near perfect stay...”
Reviews.Author: Ayersie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fira Palace for 4 nights mid october and I can say that it was a very pleasant experience. We had a very late flight arriving in Barcelona so I wanted to check on late check ins. I emailed the hotel prior to leaving the uk and received a very prompt, curteous reply. Upon arrival the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was nice a spacious and equipped with everything we needed. It's in a great location that feels nice and safe (some more central locations have people hanging around later at night). The metro station was an easy 5-10 mins walk and only 3 or 4 stops take you to La Rambla. The only real criticism was that the bar staff were quite ignorant, however across the road is a shop that sells alcohol MUCH cheaper than the bar, and the ice machine on floor 3 was very handy! There were 6 computers with free Internet access and the pool area looked pretty good (for a bit of swimming rather than sitting around it to relax). I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “attractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: lebentheater
Reviews.Content: Another Hotel with Excellent location and price, four stops from city centre. The Breakfast was great,altough the same everday, without variations but with a great staff assistance. its also not so far from the Airport. The bed was also confortable and big. The wifi acess was a bit limited , not much english channels.

Reviews.Title: “An enormous lot of value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cees_Onderwater
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked along side a congres in the hotel, so a kind of 'forced booking'. It couldn't have been better however: a beautiful room (even more beautiful when you look at the rate), very service minded staff (very easy extending my stay because of the general strike that week, the offer of a take-away breakfast as I was leaving very early), clean, good looking, etc. Not located in the center, but the nearness of the Olympic Parc and Plaza Espana more than compensate for all of that. Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in its category,impecible staff,not central,but perfect for quiet base”
Reviews.Author: youngfamily1
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Fira.The staff were very pleasant and helpful.The pool is smaller than you would think and there are occaisionally classes on,but it was mostly empty and it is open till 10pm and there is a sauna too.Ideal base for a quiet family holiday as we were not based in the noisy tourist areas.There is a large buffet selection for breakfast, which is however, rather expensive,but if you so wish,you can help yourself to a glass of Cava,which was a lovely idea.The set lunch menu is reasonable and sounded lovely, but we were so busy,we never got back on time to try it.The evening menus seemed too expensive, but again we did not try them. Thebedrooms are very spacious although perhaps a little dimly lit and the rooms are cleaned and restocked daily. There are no ironing nor tea/coffee facilities in the rooms.The bathrooms are quite small, but have everything you need.The Fira is close to the excellent Poble Espanyol(with a brilliant art activity center for children) and is at the base of the Palace(art gallery) and Olympic Village but quite a distance from the center of Barcelona and so you will have to rely on the (very regular) metro to get to the various sights.Do beware of the very professional pickpockets at the stations during peak travel times in all areas of the city,they are extremely quick and we witnessed them work completely unnoticed. The hotel is also very much geared towards conferences and business meetings,although this did not affect our stay in any way.We would recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for a smart,well run quiet base.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Fira Palace from...”
Reviews.Author: fattsmann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fira Palace from September 25 to the 30th. The hotel is nice and offers "American-sized" accommodations - 2 double beds, sofa, large bathroom (2 sinks, separate toilet room, shower AND bathtub). If you are an American tourist that doesn't like the typical smaller European style hotel rooms, then the Fira Palace would be a great choice. The hotel is conveniently located near Plaza Espanya for easy bus and Metro commuting around Barcelona. The hotel restaurant El Mall is also pretty good, with a tasty prix fixe dinner (the gazpacho is pretty good). I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as there are a couple of cafes and bars around for bocadillos, eggs, or pastry for breakfast. The hotel is conveniently located near the Magic Fountain and Parc Montjuic for sightseeing. The only thing that bothered me was that the desk staff were a bit cold and unfriendly, with the exception of a young man that was fluent in French as well as English, Spanish, and the native Catalan. It felt really awkward asking the front desk for help and/or food recommendations for the area. Overall, however, I would recommend the Fira Palace and I would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted in everything but let down by some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: cathy_lea
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good choice and we were very comfortable there. The area around the hotel is fairly quiet but very safe. It is near several attractions like the wonderful National Museum of Art of Catalonia and the whole Monjuic area. The room was large enough to accommodate 3 beds with plenty of space, the bathroom was extremely well appointed. Everywhere was clean and well maintained. We only ate in the restaurant for breakfast which was a bit chaotic and the staff were not very efficient but there was a wide choice and it was good quality food. The pool was good and again well maintained but not a place to sit around. The only thing we were really disappointed with was the attitude of some of the staff. At best they were efficient but distracted but some on the reception were quite abrupt to the point of rudeness. We didn't ask for much but when we did we were either given the barest minimum or in one case actually the wrong information which ended up wasting some of our time. However, in spite of this annoyance we were very comfortable there and would probably stay there again. We would recommend it to a friend but would pre-warn them about the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: eyy
Reviews.Content: Fira Palace is located very near the Barcelona Olympic Park. 10 minutes walk to Metro. But be careful when taking the Metro, our friend almost got victimized by pick pocketters. Hotel is about 20 minutes taxi ride to La Rambla and Catalunya. A bit far from shopping area and other tourist spots and night life. Hotel room is big and clean and properly made up. Toilettries provided. Buffet breakfast is provided, but they don't change their menu. We stayed there a week, from Day 1 - 7 and have the same food. Free Internet at the hotel ground floor. Got good gym and spa.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, good location but no iron.”
Reviews.Author: Sar34_76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fira Palace for a long weekend with my partner. The hotel was a typical 4 star hotel with all the usual amenities e.g. gym, pool etc. The hotel rooms where big and spacious and well sound proofed too (despite being next to the road). The hotel was 5 mins from the closest metro and close to the cities attractions. The one and only draw back was there was no iron, after rushing off on a Friday with a packed bag I assumed i would be able to borrow an iron once I got to the hotel. When asking reception they said they don't offer them for health and safety reason but the hotels laundry service as available (1 short - 5 euros!!!, no thanks). Apart from that the hotel is good for a weekend away and also has corner shop for snacks as well as a nice local cafe for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel near Magic Fountain”
Reviews.Author: JamesMyerson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Fira Palace in early Sept 2010 for 5 days and were impressed. The room was very large with a high level of furnishings, and a view of Palau Nacional. The room had a large King size bed, a sofa, a table & chairs and a desk. The bathroom has a bath with a shower, a separate shower cubicle, and separate toilet room and is high spec. The bed was quite firm, but something we're used to at home so not a problem. The hotel in general seemed quite impressive. The gym was well kitted out, although the air con appeared not to be working down there so quite a sweaty workout! There are a few computers in main reception which can be used for free (don't miss the 3 more computers on the lower floor). We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we felt €11 per person was a bit steep so we go breakfast out, but had a lovely menu of the day in the restaurant with the added bonus of 10% off. A 3 course meal with a bottle of wine was €70 or so which we thought was quite reasonable, especially bearing in mind the high quality of the food - the rest of the a la carte menu was quite a bit more expensive though. The hotel is a little way out of the town centre, but it is walking distance from the Placa D'Espanya (where the Aerobus has a stop) and it was quite magical walking up the road towards the Magic Fountain surrounded by fountains and lights. The city centre will take about 30-40 minutes to walk to but we enjoyed the exercise and there are metro stops 5-10 mins walk away. If you don't mind being a little away from the city centre (probably a good thing) and would like a high quality hotel with apparently some of the biggest rooms in Barcelona this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a five star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bluechip00
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13-year old daughter and I had a wonderful seven night stay at Fira Palace in early September. We travel a great deal and this hotel was a joy. I had contacted them ahead of our arrival to confirm our request for two double beds, and spoke with Sergio who was very polite and assured us everything would be perfect. We had booked the standard room and upon arrival, were pleasantly surprised to find that we had been upgraded to a suite, complete with a lovely bottle of wine! It was at the end of a hallway and incredibly quiet, with double windows, great AC, enormous rooms, spotless, all sorts of amenities (shampoo, conditioner, bubble bath, sewing kit, shoe kit, toothbrush and paste, slippers, soaps, lotions, razor and shaving cream, and robes for our use during the visit.) We didn't use the wet bar although there was one. There was a great terrace with chairs, and lots of storage space for our clothes and luggage. The space was even better than in the hotel photos on their website and usually it's the opposite! There were two bathrooms. The first, which you could enter from both the bedroom and living room, had a double sink and large shower (also with soap in a dispenser). From there, you entered the second room, which had a toilet, a bidet and a large, deep soaking tub.... just perfect for after a day of walking around Barcelona. Both areas where quite large, very clean and the towels of good quality. There was always plenty of kleenix and TP and everything that we used was restocked daily. The hotel has two shifts of chambermaids so there is no problem having your room made up if you want to sleep late. There are double heavy curtains so the rooms can stay dark until you want to get up. There is an ice machine and cups on the third floor. We didn't use the pool or gym but the facilities looked very secure and clean. The lobby has two levels and they each have three computers and the main lobby also has a printer. The bar was great, uncrowded, and we had a terrific bartender named Pedro who couldn't have been more charming and accommodating. I wanted to try Cava and he just opened a bottle so I could taste it. Another night we tried some Spanish brandy and it was delicious. The beers were always icy cold. In the morning, if you didn't want the full breakfast, you could just have a (very delicious) coffee in the bar. We didn't eat the hotel breakfast and instead found a wonderful bakery right across the street and about three or four stores up that had coffee to go and chilled chocolate milk for our daughter. There is also an excellent Italian restaurant on the same block (go out the door and take a right) called Il Golfo di Napoli where you can eat or do take out. We ended up eating there twice and it seemed full of locals. The hotel is very conveniently located, with easy access to the Metro (Espana) a 10 minute walk away. It is also a breeze from the airport. Just take the Aerobus (#46) and Espana is the first stop, about 20 minutes. We purchased round-trip tickets and saved even more. Check in and check out were fast. Whenever I had a question someone at the front desk answered it quickly, everyone spoke English that I encountered and they were happy to print out a map with directions if you needed it. There is a nice little gift shop with quality items, competitively priced and the lady wraps them beautifully. You can easily walk to the terrific fountain/iight show at night (Thurs-Sun) at Montjuic (two blocks) as well as the museum, the Olympic area and Poble Espanyol where we saw a fabulous flaminco show at El Tablao de Carmen. The only two things I would have liked would have been clocks in the rooms (we brought our own) and somewhere on the premises to get a soda or quick snack that you could take back to your room. We ended up going to a local supermarket and picking up some things. Other than that, the Fira was a really wonderful hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel, Good Location would recommend to you too”
Reviews.Author: Go_DoBasingstoke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fira Palace at the beginning of September. The hotel bedroom was large with two king beds.. All very clean and quiet at night. Breakfast was buffet and of good quality and variety. Service on all areas was excellent, definitely 4 star UK rating. I would recommend getting the bus to and from the airport which was 10.20 euro for two people each way, much cheaper than the taxi.
