Beware on your return to the airport because the 'Easy Jet' departure lounge is in another building just aside from Terminal 2. Do use the metro, its a good choice to get around and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Short Walk to Magic Fountains and Pueblo Espanol for Nighttime Entertainment”
Reviews.Author: MargateP
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and comfortable, but I would not consider it to be a 4 star hotel; I would categorize it as a 3 star hotel. For example, there was no place to get a soda -- I was instructed to walk diagonally across the street to a small convenience store to get a drink. I thought the blocks immediately surrounding the hotel were of questionable character; however, for the following reasons, I liked the location very much -- various forms of public transportation are nearby, a taxi stand is at the hotel's doorstep, the magic fountains are a short (5 min.) walk from the hotel, and Pueblo Espanol is just a little bit further (approx. 10 min.) walk from the hotel. Pueblo Espanol, in addition to what it is known for, also has nighttime entertainment in the form of a flamenco dinner/show and a disco. Olympic sites are also a short cab ride away. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet place, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pincomallo
Reviews.Content: We were there for 2 nights, and it was good value for money: clean, quiet, good service, good location even if not particularly charming. We had booked the standard room, which was surprisingly bigger than what we expected with 2 double beds, a couch and a desk and plenty of space. The area around the hotel is quit and safe and close to the metro station.. so you can get to the city center in 20 mins or so.. and the metro runs till late.. over night when temperatures not too prohibitive you can take a nice walk to the ramblas it does not take too long.. maybe 30 mins or less. Besides, the Spanish square musical fountains are just few mins walk distance.. with thousands people going there every night between 9 and 11, so if you want to get into the crowd just need to walk few hundred meters. The indoor swimming pool was not very big but with only few people actually using it that was not a problem.. and it was indeed very nice to relax at the end of a day out sightseeing or just to start the day fresh..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, extremely spacious, very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: regobhoii
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely modern and spacious. Room was really big,two queen sized beds for 2 of us. Lovely big bathroom.Daily room cleaning. Personally thought the hotel was nearer the city centre but theres a taxi rank outside the door of the hotel which was so handy. Taxi costs 8-10 euros to the las ramblas. Safe area of town and 5 min walk to both bus stop and metro stop. Free acess to wifi in the lobby which was so handy. Asked the staff numerous questions on our stay and they were always friendly and willing to help. Always greeted with a 'hola' and smile which was nice.Loved our stay in Fira Palace and loved Barcelona. Will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: gezball
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with group of friends and booked three rooms. Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable and the rooms were air conditioned which was great. The hotel is located close to the metro and easy to get around. Good local restaurants nearby if you dont want to get ripped off by eating in Las Ramblas, poor food and overpriced. Did not eat breakfast in the hotel but the food looked great , we just preferred to eat out locally. Service was great , we had arrived early, no problem they took care of our baggage and the rooms were ready a couple of hours later.There was a slight mix up in the triple room but that was immediatley recitified without any hassle. Used the leisure facilites. good pool and sauna and gym had everything you would expect. Would gladly stay here again and was good value for money.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Gatos, CA - Northern California - Bay Area
Reviews.Title: “Great place for pre- and post-cruise!”
Reviews.Author: afgam
Reviews.Content: The hotel room had no clock. I needed more towels. Can’t find extra. We called housekeeping and 45 minutes later no towels. I called again and no one answered. Where are those towels? My husband left the hotel room in search of towels and inexpensive breakfast items. This is where the mysterious experience begins… how to get towels and breakfast. Simple, which I thought. My husband went down the hallway to find a housekeeper. Yeah! Towels! Showered, shampooed, and shined! I would just head down to the hotel restaurant and sit down for breakfast. Everything packed and we just have 1 hour and 15 minutes left before we have to check out. We walked into the almost empty “breakfast buffet” hotel restaurant. Well, I was told that they were closing. So, the head server recommended for us to go to the piano bar. Yes, they drink beer and alcohol with their breakfast. Honestly, I don’t want to eat breakfast in a piano bar. We decided to go back into the room and order room service. Around 11 a.m., I order breakfast, and literally 45 minutes later, it arrived and $20 EUROS for an omelette. So slow! Everyone seems to be on vacation except me. We also called for a bellperson to come help us with the bags. A handsome man and those shiny dress shoes showed up 30 minutes later and before room service brought up breakfast. We thought that the hotel was busy. It was not really. He was the only bellperson in the hotel. Once down in the lobby, we saw other families leaving for the ship. EXCITING! 30 minutes later, we were checked out. But where was the bellperson with our bags? Nowhere to be found! Oh! There he was walking by us several times. 15 minutes later, he showed up with our luggage and we headed outside to catch a “taxi”. Mystery?!? Where were all the taxis that were lined up outside the hotel? The bellperson did not understand it either! He informed us that the taxis are abundant. This was a first. 30 minutes later, a taxi finally shows up. The driver was very quiet and polite. We had 2 big luggages and 5 small ones. I thought that we had to take an extra taxi, but the driver managed to put it all into the “tiny” taxi. This is a great place to stay pre-post cruise. The rooms are big and the beds are bigger, which you can easily fit 4 people. However, confirm with the hotel first. They will need your passport when you check in. They scan it in their system for security reasons. I wonder why we don't do it here in the USA. There's also a restaurant called Il Golfo Di Napoli as you walk out of the hotel lobby and to the right on the same side of the hotel. It's great!

Reviews.Title: “A great base from which to visit the city”
Reviews.Author: SarahWeybridge
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the Fira Palace. Nice spacious rooms for us and our teenage children. Good facilities and pleasant staff. Convenient location, avoid the Ramblas, it's like staying in Piccadilly Circus too noisy and too much bustle you get the feeling you will be pick pocketed. The Fira Palace is in a calm safe feeling location but central enough to reach all the key sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cathie29
Reviews.Content: My and my family, two adults and two children stayed here upon arriving in Barcelona. We were able to check in early which was great as we were quite jet lgged from our trip. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and large. As in most places in Spain the beds are firm to say the least but we were comfortble. I would definitelt stay again. Close to lots of sights and close to las Ramblas. Parking is available but if you can avoid driving please do so. The hotel is very close to train, bus and walking. Poble Espanoyle is great it you have kids....take in the Flamenco show if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - this hotel was just perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: lucybinns
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - very clean, spacious rooms and bathrooms. Excellent sized beds for a family of 4 - with 2 Queen beds in the room. Lovely, friendly staff. Huge reception, lobby area. Lovely buffet dinner - perfect for our children who loved it. The most amazing and delicious breakfast - so much choice. The location near to the Montjuic Fountains was excellent and the Fountains are definitely worth a visit to see from 9pm-11pm on a Thurs, Fri, Sat, Sun. We chose the location to be near to Sants railway station so it was perfect for us and not far from the city centre too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for very acceptable price”
Reviews.Author: DimDim1212
Reviews.Content: Еxcellent and very comfortable hotel, very spacious rooms, excellent breakfast. Few smeared the impression the prohibition to take away even any candy from the breakfast and a couple of times audible noise from the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: valleemike
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel for several reasons. The location is great, 10 minutes walk from the metro, 5 minutes from the Majic Fountain. The rooms were clean and spacious with extra large beds and huge bathrooms. The staff very friendly and helpful and the buffet lunch/dinner great value. We didn't have breakfast as thought this too expensive but just over the road was a small cafe/bar where we had great coffee and a croissant for 1.80 euros! We would definately stay here again when returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value. Big comfortable rooms and a very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: rmo213
Reviews.Content: The rooms were much bigger and more comfortable than normal European hotels. Big beds, loveseat, table and chairs made this feel like a suite rather than a double room. A/c worked great and meant a nice quiet sleep in a cool, comfy, big, quiet room. We arrived at 11am (well before normal check-in time) and the staff still got us a room right away. Free internet on the computers in the lobby, but a charge of around 10E if you want wifi (they offer 30 mins of wifi for free though). Excellent breakfast (extra price, but very reasonable at 11 Euro) had plenty to offer. Parking underground costs an extra 16 euro. A very short walk to Placa de Espana and the metro. This was an excellent hotel and an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Large spacious, clean rooms. OK location”
Reviews.Author: Euro1999
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the very large rooms in this city hotel. We found the hotel to be very modern and clean. Pool is OK. Breakfast is very good although a bit expensive. Recommend using the metro to get to and from attractions although the hotel is quite close to the Font Magica de Montjuic, which is worth a visit in the evening. Metro is a good 10 minute walk. Overall, a good impression.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philip222_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the middle of august. We had read the reviews here and were sure that this was a good hotel. I'm warning everyone to stay away from this hotel. -Bad service: the guy at the reception was arrogant and woudn't let me finish my sentences. I asked for help for our luggage, but he forget all about it. At one instance he coudn't excahnge a 100 euro bill to smaller. Imagine that. He told me to try again tomorrow. -THe room that we got had a bad stinking suwer smell from the toilet. It was so bad that you coudn't stay in your room. We complain and got a better room but the smell was not all gone. This is realy bad for a 4 star hotel. They should kontrol the room to see if everything is ok before giving it to a traveler. -The water in the shower was either too cold or too warm. -The location of the hotel is far a way from city and metro. You must walk a long way or take a cab. -The breakfast is the worst I have ever had in a 4*hotel. The bread was hard and old. Not a lot of thing to select from. For 17 Euro, it was a rip off. You can get a clean and good breakfast in the city fot 15 euro. ex at fargie. The conclusion is that this hotel is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in in europe. Don't be fooled by the nice pictures. I guess too bee sure of a good service and hotel you must select a 5* hotel in Spain. Philip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: NorthLondonNoMore
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and offers great value. Very big rooms, very clean. Nice bathroom suite. Air-conditioning. Very good breakfast with lots on offer. Good safe location close to town and transport. Rooms smelt clean and fresh. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place @ a great price.”
Reviews.Author: climber201
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a little over a week ago. We arrived & they had upgraded us to a suite without any additional charge. Very nice & affordable with a very modern look. Would definetly stay there again if ever in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: julianne24
Reviews.Content: We were amazed at the value for money we received at this hotel. Our room had 2 double beds and a sofa bed, and a huge bathroom with tub and separate shower. The room had a small lobby with an inner door, which helped to keep the room quiet. We didn't have any trouble sleeping - comfy beds and quiet at night. There are 2 metro stations within 10 minutes walk, and even though the hotel is not in a touristy neighborhood, we liked it because it was a real Barcelona neighborhood. Lots of small cafes nearby to have a cheap breakfast, if you don't want to pay for the expensive breakfast offered by the hotel. There are a few nice restaurants for dinner too. Probably not much in the way of night life nearby, but the center of Barcelona is only 3 stops away on the metro. We went to a great Italian restaurant recommended by the Rough Guide. One night we ate in the hotel bar where they have a small, but good and filling selection of sandwiches. There are two bars, one smoking, one non smoking. We didn't use the pool or fitness room but they looked fine. If we were to return to Barcelona, I would certainly consider staying at this hotel again. , b

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, terrible reception staff”
Reviews.Author: paulbolger1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic rooms, lovely swimming pool, unfortunately the staff at reception on arrival were so unfriendly, this was a bit disappointing especially as its a 4star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Siobhany25
Reviews.Content: Impressive first impression, very shiny and staff who helpfully speak english. Rooms were tidy and neat, beds were slightly hard though! Free computers with internet to use, however there are only 6 and you have to be quick at snapping one up. Breakfast is plentiful and tasty, eat in a lovely restraunt. As areas go its not bad, however its not really central and a taxi to the main centre costs around 7euro. There are a few little shops and restaurants nearby however. If travelling back to Barcelona i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was quite spacious and comfortable... would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: monaco42
Reviews.Content: Our executive room for 3 was very large. It had a mini-fridge, plenty of closet space including shelving to store clothes, desk and large round table and chairs. The marble bathroom was great with 2 sinks and separate shower, bath & toilet area. Great accomodations for our 5 nite stay for my husband, teenage daughter and me. The Gift Shop was very nice. After shopping for souvenirs all over, we bought lots of things at the hotel gift shop - prices competitive, plus Carmen who works there is super and she wrapped each item for travel and it looked great too - no need to re-wrap. Just sorry we wasted time elsewhere. Restaurant at hotel too pricey. Go to Felicia's across the street for coffee, croissant.. Although my husband ( with a bad back) liked the hard bed, my daughter and I prefer pillow-top mattresses - which our room did not have. The bedding is very nice, just the bed was very firm. No coffee or tea maker in room was inconvenient. Also, the Front Desk staff are not the warmest. The woman who checked us in just couldn't smile. Frank at the Front Desk was very helpful and nice. The Front Desk staff double as Concierge, which seemed odd to us for a hotel this size and type.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Triton_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel and I have no hesitation in recommending it. Our room was spacious, well equipped and clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly with an excellent command of English. Personally, the location was great, so much quieter than more central hotels. There is the added attraction of the magic fountain displays at night. Plus the hotel is just a 5-7 min walk from where the airport bus drops you. The gym was fine though the pool was a bit small for proper swimming. It was full of kids in the evening but empty early morning. (Barcelona appears to have lots of decent public pools so not a real problem for me; one of the best is a few mins away, the open-air Olympic pool).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but lacking in many respects”
Reviews.Author: seattletraveler75
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel and, once we finally got our suite (after waiting about 4 hours for the room to be ready) we were reasonably satisfied. We decided to try the pool, but found it was in a dimly-lit basement room and overrun with screaming kids. I never did find the gym, which was featured in a photo on a little card in our bathroom. I looked in every door near the "gym" sign, but finally decided it wasn't worth the struggle. The beds were very firm, which I'm sure some people would like. The reading light is good, which I appreciate. I was disappointed that there was no coffee or hot water facilities in our room - all my recent travels have led me to believe that this was standard. Warning: there is a bottle of mineral water which housekeeping places in your room the second day. It looks like it's complimentary, but it's NOT! We drank it, thinking we'd get one each day, but no second bottle ever showed up, and the first one showed up on our bill at checkout. The staff is friendly and helpful, and speaks very good English. The restaurant is pretty good, but not good enough to make up for the definite lack of restaurants in the area. If you want to stay in a non-touristy spot, this is a good place. It's close to many museums, and the Montjuic park, so you can get quite a walking workout (I really didn't miss the gym). Another disappointment was the stingy policy of 30 minutes per day of wi-fi in the room. Geez, when you're paying upwards of $200 a night for a suite, you'd think they'd throw in more than that. Plus, even the 30 minutes required a daily trip to the front desk to acquire the code for your 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, modern and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: FayetteBolton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fira Palace for a long weekend this July. The hotel is reasonably located near (5-10 minutes walk) the Plaza Espagne-Espagne Metro and near the Magic fountain attraction. Although initially a little diffiult to find the welcome when we did arrive was very warm. Our room on floor 5 was right next to the lift. We need not have worried as we heard very little noise in the evenings. The room was exceptionally clean and spacious. Aside from the sleeping area there was a seating area with a sofa and a writing table plus another coffee table. The bathroom was spacious too with a double sink, shower, separate bath and toilet. Robes and slippers were provided as were reasonable quality toiletries, the rooms really couldn't be faulted. I agree with the previous comments on the website that the beds were a little harder than you would expect, although this was no reat problem for the length of the stay. Upon check out we were able to store our bags in a locked room adjacent to the reception. We wanted to use the computers in the lobby but they seemed to be almost constantly busy although this is no surprise. The staff at the reception seemed friendly enough but not overly helpful. We did not experience the breakfast facilities, especially as previous Trip Advisor members had reported that the buffet was expensive. It is easy enough to obtain a cheaper breakfast in a cafe in the streets neat to the hotel. if we were ever to revisit Barcelona, we would not hesitate to stay in this hotel. It was clean, modern and good value, even if it did lack a little atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat my awesome deal”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_D_10
Reviews.Content: I found Fira Palace online and decided to look at its rates. I don't know how this was possible but I got a room for 80 Euros a night. My girlfriend and I were doing some traveling and typically stay at hostels with our friends, but for just a little bit more this far exceeded the amount of comfort we are normally accustomed to. Air conditioning worked very well, which is a must in July. It also had a pull out bed in a couch so a friend crashed there for a night as well before traveling on to another city. We stayed 3 nights and I was fully satisfied with my stay. It is close to the "Magic Fountain," which everyone in Barcelona should see and the olympic village. Only down side was a lack of many food options nearby. We may have got such a good deal because it was slow, but at that rate I would DEFINITELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Savvytravelertoo
Reviews.Content: Intially had a hard time findg a hotel to accommodate 3 of us, but the room was very spaceous and clean. The bathroom was wonderful w/lots of amenities. Got a great rate by contactg hotel's website. Staff was very helpful. Located on a quiet street two blocks fr: the Palace & Fountains and HoHo (Hop On/Hop Off) bus stop, which is a great way to see the city, but stops running @ 9:00. A short taxi ride can take you to Las Ramblas @ nite for dinner (Los Caracoles was charming!), bakery across the street has killer pasteries & coffee. There are nearby Supermarkets where you can affordably stock up on water, snacks & wine.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3-star than a 4.”
Reviews.Author: lil-m-moses
Reviews.Content: For a four-star hotel, it was lacking in a lot of areas. The staff was nice and many spoke good English. The rooms were spacious and clean, and quiet with the inner door closed (lots of nextdoor bathroom and hall noise otherwise). There was no iron or means for hot drinking water in the room. The air conditioning struggled in the July heat - things were marginally cooler than outside, but the humidity remained high. The "high speed" internet was free for 30 minutes a day with a card from the front desk each day, but it was slower than my mom's dial-up (I got 6-7 KB/s uploads even with 54 Mbps connection). The lobby computers were nice to have beyond the 30 minutes, but not much faster, and often not working. The beds were hard, but that seems to be the trend in this town. The breakfast spread was excellent. There were no vending machines, and very little nearby in terms of good restaurants - all were a few blocks away, and the area isn't all that tourist-friendly. The hotel catering for our conference was good, and the staff excellently trained. They have a laundry service, but for the price of one washed T-shirt you can walk a few blocks to the laundromat near Poble Sec station and wash and dry a whole load. The pool was OK - coldish and inconvenient to go up two floors to get a towel, then back down to shower and pool. The gym looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, the location, and the amenities”
Reviews.Author: griff90
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great - stayed here with a friend to experience Barcelona - nice quiet location but still very easily accessible to Las Ramblas, the beach, the metro, etc. Service was excellent - the front desk staff was great in helping us get places we needed to go, very helpful with tips and information, always friendly. Only complaint was the pool - it's indoors and not as nice as it looks on the website. Would definitely stay here again next time in Barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “Impressive accomodations”
Reviews.Author: odcsalinas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our room and the front desk staff and valet were great. The breakfast buffet was very good. The only thing we found issue with was the price of the bar drinks. They were very expensive. 15,00 euros for a Jack Daniels, you do the math, and that didn't include the coke.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with extraordinary service”
Reviews.Author: Marcia04
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for a family vacation with our children and grandchildren. We stayed at Fira Palace for 2 nights. The hotel is very clean and modern and had two queen beds in the rooms - unheard of in most European hotels. This was great for our children who had their children with them. The front desk was very helpful with all of our questions re restaurants, taxis, ATM's - you name it they were nice and professional. Because of a plane malfunction, one group in our party was unable to get to Barcelona until the next day and the hotel did not charge us for the night they missed. Our grandaughter left her favorite stuffed animal in the hotel room. We called the hotel and they located the animal and mailed it to them in South Carolina. My son paid for the postage but the whole family appreciated the return of Cha Cha! The location is good and the nightly fountain light show at Montjuic was a treat. WE would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Post-Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: honest0reviews
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay with Fira Palace even though it was a bit pricey. We were post cruisers and our ship disembarked at 7:30am..so I wanted to make sure that our Hotel allow early check in. I have reviewed many hotels in Barcelona and none of them would garantee early check in except for Fira Palace. And that is one of the biggest reason why we were willing to pay that price (200USD/night). The Hotel is very nice with super big rooms. Our room had 2 king size beds and a hughe bathroom..which really impressed us! The location of the hotel is great, it is close to the metro and it only takes 5 min to get to the central of Barcelona. The only thing I wish they could provide is free internet access + their staffs can be friendlier(they don't smile alot). 24hrs internet access cost 13euro.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! You can't ask for better! This place is great.”
Reviews.Author: cscasrp
Reviews.Content: This should be a five star hotel. It is new, spacious, beautiful, clean, and in a great location. We had 4 rooms, and they were all terrific. There is a city bus that goes from the airport to the hotel (with stops in between), for about $1.50/person (US $). Very easy, cheap, convenient. Wonderful location as you can step out and walk to interesting places. We were absolutely dazzled by the fountains in front of the old palace, which is a 5 minute walk away. The fountains "do a show" about every half hour in the evening. Watching that (which was free) was one of our favorite things of the whole trip, and the show is not the same each time. We did not eat the breakfast at the hotel, because we were getting on a cruise ship, but I bet it was sensational. It looked marvelous If you are going to the cruise port, take a taxi. Waiting for the bus that goes from the port to the cruise port took hours. I think we could have crawled there on our hands and knees faster then that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Option”
Reviews.Author: Deenk1
Reviews.Content: We selected the Fira Palace based upon on-line reviews and price. The hotel was very accommodating and their pre-stay communication by email was great. Their rate for a "Family Room" that could sleep 2 adults and 2 kids was very competitive, and the room was indeed spacious. We stayed on the 5th floor which was very quiet. The full European bathroom was great and the multi-nozzle shower was refreshing. The workout facility after a long flight was complete with both a cardio room and a strength room below. Their pool is basic but a welcome amenity for a tired family. The proximity to the Magic Fountain is unbeatable. The taxi ride from El Prat airport was just under 25 Euros including all tariffs: more economical than the Aero bus for a family of 4. The taxi ride to Moll A'dossat Cruise Terminal was only 14 Euros for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, decent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: suprvelm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. We arrived at the hotel at 9:00 am and assumed that we would not be able to get in our room. Fortunately, the woman at the front desk was very friendly, got us into our room immediately and helped us get our bearings as to where we were located in proximity to all the things we wanted to see. The room we had was a double room (two twin beds.) It was very spacious. The bathroom was huge with a tub and stand alone shower. The beds were oversized twins, but were very firm. We did use the workout facility, which was decent, and used one of the many computers, offering free internet access, that were both in the lower and main levels of the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but did have decent wine, fruit and cheeses delivered to the room upon arrival. The hotel was about a 5-10 minute walk from the subway station, which we took full advantage of. Also, the hotel is located within a few blocks of the Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya (MNAC). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: pitthein
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days in the Hotel for a city trip to Barcelona and liked it very much. Rooms are really big and very comfortable. The only negative point in our view is the spa operated by a third company and which does not deserve a four star rating. If somebody does not care for this point we can only fully recommend the hotel. Access to the city is very easy as Plaza Espanya with many connection is 5 minutes away. The breakfast is very rich and expensive. A smaller version like continental breakfat should be offert.

Reviews.Title: “great location, huge rooms, lovely place but thin walls and noisy”
Reviews.Author: tompel
Reviews.Content: As with many of the other reviewers we were astounded at the spaciousness of the rooms, 2 large doubles, with lots of space in the room. The hotel is in a great location - to be able to wander to the sound and lights show at the Magic Fountain every night was a real treat. There are several restaurants about 10 mins walk from the hotel, and there are various small shops / a bakery accross the road so you can buy a breakfast (and a coffee) there to avoid the v expensive breakfasts in the hotel. Staff were generally lovely. The only downside was the noise in the room - from the neighbouring room. It seemed as it we were staying next door to a family of wild beasts - however having read the reviews from other travellers we all carried ear plugs with us and were able to ignore this at nights. Overall we had a great stay and I would definttely return.

Reviews.Title: “The manager should be allowed manage every hotel in the world:)”
Reviews.Author: zogabong
Reviews.Content: Firstly, just to address another reviewer's comment regarding breakfast: it is expensive yes, but it is by no means a continental breakfast, it is a feast. Lots of cheeses, hot and cold meats, eggs, fish, breads, yogurts, cereals, fruits, nuts, dried fruits, truly amazing dessert/cakes, tea, coffee,(filtered), herbal teas - fabulous! So I would say if you can manage to feast yourself at that hour, it is well worth it. They serve up to 10.30, so really that will keep you going for all the sightseeing and shopping you will have to look forward to. The restaurant La Mall I think it's called, was outstanding on our first night, and excellent value €28 for three courses and coffee. My husband is coeliac and that was no problem , they even had special bread. They made one small error which was quickly fixed and two glasses of Cava were rpodued immediately with an apologetic flourish. Very good. The second time however not so good. The veg incinerated, the dessert cold in spots, hot in other spots (!!) and there was some confusion over the bill. However, when we addressed this with the manager next day, the cost of this meal was waived. Very good again. There was a problem with odour of sewage in our bathroom the first night and when we complained about it they said they would send up a technician immediately. And when she arrived, in her pretty maids apron , with her bottle of bleach, I knew we were in trouble.. We complained again the next day and were swiftly upgrading to a suite which was fabulous.(room 450) . 6 people would easily sleep in that bed, two wardrobes, balcony, separate bathroom and shower room, ,living room - great. And very very peaceful with a wonderful view.The beds in both rooms were divinely comfortable - which for me is firm , no middle sags and no spring noises. The metro is very close, and as others have said other restaurants are nearby and the wonderful fountain exhibit which appears to be nightly is two mins walk away - in fact we could just about see it from our first room. There is free broadband in the foyer, the bar is pleasant and there is a cordoned off indoor smoking area. The pool is appalling, the photos are most deceptive. There were two miniature saunas in the ladies changing room , both out of order. The pool is tiny, no natural light and has a public pool from the 70's feel (and sound) to it. However I believe the hotel is upgrading so perhaps they'll deal with that. It's an eye/ear sore. So while we had little problems, the manner in which they were dealt with by the manager was swift and professional. And this is what impressed me the most.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: bcfcfan
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Fira Palace. A sleek modern clean hotel ,super spacious rooms with big bathrooms. Hotel quite quiet during our stay of 4 nights but as it appears to target business clients could be more crowded if they were hosting a convention etc. Ten minute walk to the metro so easy to get around. Also some nice walks from the hotel to the park, museum and magic fountains. Location is quiet but felt safe. Surrounding area a little short on restaurants but there are some quite nice ones if you seek them out.. Just don't expect to find a McDonalds or BK - you will need to go to La Ramblas for that. We didn't eat in the hotel as too expensive i.e continental breakfast €17 each. A handy patisserie across the road for croissants, juice etc for only a few euros solved that problem. Overall we found this hotel suited our needs completely. Although not in the main tourist area it is nice to come back to it's relative tranquility after a day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RayDL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the beginning of February and had a very nice stay. The rooms were very spacious and offered great comfort. Particulary the bathroom with separate shower, toilet and bathtube was impressing. The beds were not quite so impressing. I think this is the hardest bed I have ever slept in. I'm a heavy person and need a hard mattress, but this one was directly uncomfortable. However, when we asked at the front desk, they were wery helpful, and gave us some extra soft mattresses on top, and after that the bed was OK. The swimming pool and especially the fitness senter was exellent. We particulary liked the piano bar with a very nice bartender who served one of the best Irish coffees we've ever tasted. (and we are very hard to please when it comes to Irish Coffee) We often took a foredrink in the bar before we went for dinner in the town. We did not eat at the hotel, but was recommended the Port Olympic area for their excellent seafood restaurants. We did not regret that. The first evening we went to "La Taberna Gallega de Marcos" What an experience - and speak of value for money! Excellent - nothing more to say! But beware: Barcelona restaurants are quite agressive in their efforts to entice you into their place. We liked "La Taberna Gallega de Marcos" so much that we decided to go back some evenings later, but we were almost "forced" into an adjacent restaurant . It looked almost the same, but the menus was not as good, and it was also far more expensive. So be shure you choose the right one - no matter the pressure and temptation from others. But back to the Hotel. The location was great for us. We prefer a spacious and comfortable hotel, and are prepared to sacrifice a little on location to achieve this. But this hotel was only a few minutes walk from Placa de Espagna with metro and loads of busses for all over Barcelona, so it was no sacrifice. Tha taxi was typical 7-8 euros from La Ramblas or Port Olympic. We can absolutely recommend this hotel, and will probably stay here for our next Barcelona visit

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, however...”
Reviews.Author: TRVLNMAN078
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and in above average condition. We were impressed at check-in. The room was very clean and spacious. Front desk staff was a bit inconsistent as far as service and personality. At check-in, the person on duty was very courteous and helpful and gave us an overview of the city, along with a Metro map and suggested good sites to see for first-timers. Then, the next day, we asked a question of the person on duty and got attitude and unhelpful directions to an ATM. I guess it just depended on who was working. Then, on check-out, I was informed we had a charge for breakfast (to the tune of 34 euros). Only thing is, we never had breakfast there. It's very expensive (like $25 for eggs and toast). I said I never had breakfast at the restaurant, and kudos to the person checking me out, because upon not finding a signed bill by me, she removed the charge. So double check your charges at checkout! We stayed for 4 days (we slept in late on the first day due to jet lag). Our shower the first morning had NO hot water. Not a good start! However, the next day when we woke early, we had hot water. I guess, early birds get the hot water here. Location is nice in that it is away from La Rambla and very quiet at night. The downside is that the walls are thin and you can hear your neighbors if they are loud, if you know what I mean. The other downside is that you have to take the Metro or a Taxi to get to most of the best attractions in Barcelona. A cab ride was typically 5-6 Euros to get from the Hotel to La Rambla, which is a good starting point to see a lot of great sites. If you are into walking, it can be done but it's time consuming if you have time constraints or want to see as much as possible while there. I would prefer to stay closer to the attractions next time I travel to Barcelona, even if it means dealing with noise. Overall I gave it 3 stars because there are equal pros and cons to staying at this hotel. Barcelona is awesome by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCAADL
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a short walk to the Plaza Espana Metro Station. Rooms are quite large, similar in size to those in the U.S. Low and reasonable cost for use of hotel Wi-Fi service. Would stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , good service”
Reviews.Author: sambaistanbul
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my family for 5 days . Overall we were satisfied with the Hotel . Executive rooms were ok but I have not seen a big difference with the standard rooms where my kids stayed. Reception was always very friendly and tried to help us . Breakfast was amazing ,included everything you can wish in the menu . Fitness center was very good. Indoor pool size was ok to swim , however the surrounding area of the pool did not look very clean . We had a car and used the underground parking of the hotel which was very convenient , however cost € 16 / day. Free internet was only for half an hour but there were 4 computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “well,”
Reviews.Author: UKIPdunne
Reviews.Content: it was, exempt from fault, it had all the neccesity's, i admit i spent little time in the hotel but what time i did spend, was spent well, a most durable place, good food, decent staff, with exempt linquistical skills.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay....”
Reviews.Author: lana094
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with our stay at Fira Palace. We liked everything: location - quiet street, very close to Magic Fountain, 5 min walk to metro, a lot of small caffes to get something to eat, or 5-10 min. walk to main street with more expensive but modern places. Walk to La Rambles will take about half an hour. Service was high class quality: We booked through "I preffer" and got free upgrade to the suite, free internet 24 hour internet access and bottle of red wine. Fitness center was very nice, but pool was smaller then it appeared on pictures from hotel website. Rooms- clean, modern, flat screen TV, NICE BATHROOM with separate toilet/bathtub and shower. All toilet accesories were included even shaving and dental kits. The best hotel experience in Europe that we had so far.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: AshVirginia
Reviews.Content: My wife, I and my son stayed in the Fira Palace for six days. We mainly selected the hotel because it was rated family friendly in the Fodor's Guide. We foud it to be very spacious. The room was large and had two queen size beds. The bathroom had a separate shower and an enclosed toilet both with individual doors and a soaking tub. The shower was good once we figured out how to adjust the water temperature. The hotel had several computers in the mail lobby and the conference center in the basement. These were free. There is a restaurant across from the reception area and two bars. Unlike hotels in US the restaurant does not allow you to carry food (coffe etc) to your room. They have to deliver it. One can buy coffee and pastry at the bar and carry to the room but you get cups and saucers and carry a tray. No disposables. The food was very expensive. It cost us close to 15 euros for three cups of coffee and thrree danishes. This is much cheaper outside but in our case we needed to have that first cup in the morning before stepping out. We ate at the restauarant once and found the service very good. The food was acceptable not great. We reached the hotel at 8 AM and were told that the room will be available at noon even though the normal check in is at 3 PM. We spent about three hours walking in the neighborhood that had a Museum and the 1992 Olympics structures. We got our room at 11.30 AM. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle. If you like quiete this is the palce. It is only five minutes walk from the Espanol metro and a train station. We had no problem visiting many sites around the city. Ther are several maps (restaurants, shopping, etc) available free in the lobby. The servers and other staff in the hotel were impeccably dressed. Few spoke English. We took taxi from the Airport since we did not want to drag our suit cases. It only cost us around 23 euros. We took taxies several times on an average paying under ten euros for the trip. We took all precautions to safeguard our money. I had a windbreaker with an inside zipper pocket. But we did not feel threatened or come across any situations. We had a great time. The tapas and the paeas are great. You should visit Bercada ( I may not have the spelling right) off the La Rambals. It is the fruit and vegetable market. very colorfull with several tapas palaces where you have to stand and wait for yout turn for a seat. Many need cash. I was glad I carried a copy of my passport all the time. Many establishments, including the train station, wanted to see it to accept my credit card. The restaurant in the twon open very late, around 9 PM for dinner. One has to make that adjustment. Overall the Fira Place is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Purplelally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fira Palace for a conference. I took and Executive Room which was large and spacious. The view from the window was partial blocked by a wall which was a bit depressing. The "I Prefer" Members scheme didn't deliver the promised benefit of a bottle of wine although I did get free wifi. Sadly the wifi signal is so weak the only place it works is in the lobby. The room service menu as mentioned in other posts is very very very limited and not good value for the price. The breakfast was limited with not much fresh fruit on offer. The scrambled eggs were often cold. The coffee was v.good though. I was here working so had limited opportunity to explore the area but the park and art gallery are very good. Its well connected by the metro network so you can get around easily. As a business hotel it is acceptable but if you are coming to visit for pleasure I think you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: travel1Nashville
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fira Palace recently for 4 days. Our room was large, comfortable and clean. There were two double beds and a sofa-bed. The bathroom was really nice and we liked their shower gels and shampoos very much ( they were actually made in USA!). We loved the breakfast buffet with a great choice of fruit, baked goods, yoghurts, juices, cereals, as well as wonderful cooked selections including cod. The swimming pool was clean and nice. The location is very convenient if you are going to a conference at the Fira. Just up the hill, there are great museums and parks. You can walk to Las Ramblas in about 20 minutes and along the way you get to see non-touristy sections of the city. Overall, we were very with Fira Palace. One tip is to join iprefer network, which is free. If you join, you get free wi-fi in your room. www.iprefer.com You also get early check in and late check out privileges. Otherwise you can get free internet for 30 mins at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the price”
Reviews.Author: YukiNoSaru
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on a work conference. Location was excellent, just a few minutes from Plaza Espana. There were free buses to take us to the conference centre, which was very convenient. It's right by the magic fountains and Monjuic park. The hotel itself was unfortunately mediocre. Rooms were a good size and the bathroom appeared nice. However, the shower failed to drain properly and the toilet seemed to back up sometimes and smelt funny. Room service was horrendously expensive (although food in Barcelona is generally expensive) and only fair quality. Breakfast was middling too, with a fairly limited choice and far from satisfying. There was 30 mins of free wifi per day (or i think €10 for a 24hr pass), however it never worked, so I was without internet access, which was a little frustrating. The staff were not unfriendly, but I didn't feel like they were very attentive or caring.

Reviews.Title: “Fira Palace”
Reviews.Author: ErinC2
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a great location for us as we were attending a tradeshow across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, though a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: IvyArbor
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace is a really wonderful hotel in Barcelona. The rooms are pretty large, more like what you'd see in the United States as opposed to Europe. The hotel is very well maintained, clean with nice facilities. The concierge was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, and were generally very accommodating. There are computers with free internet available as well as a nice gym that I did use and was pleased with. The only caveat I'd add is that the hotel is a little out of the way. You can walk to the metro easily enough, but it takes about 20 minutes or so to get to town, unless you take a cab, which are usually parked outside, or the front desk will call for you. I was vacationing with my mother and aunt, so nightlife wasn't high on my agenda and the location worked out just fine for us. But if I were with friends, or relatives my age, I'd probably opt for something a little closer to the center of the city. It's very quiet at night, and I always felt safe in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Xenophonie
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel to stay in Barcelona. The amenities are excellent. The lobby is recently remodeled, but the rooms are slightly outdated. When booking your stay make sure to register with the iperfer network which is a free hotel affiliation program. With this membership number you are given a free room upgrade and free in room wireless internet. The front desk staff is absolutely amazing and if you have any questions about the area or need restaurant reservations ask for Sandra, we never received a bad recommendation from her. Overall, great place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy 1st impression.”
Reviews.Author: Caterpiller
Reviews.Content: Having been to Barcelona a couple of times my husband and I thought we would choose a different hotel and different area to stay in. We chose the Fira Palace as it was closer to some attractions that we hadn't yet visited. After arriving at the airport we knew we could get the airport bus to around the corner from the hotel which we did and after a short walk we entered the hotel. The area around the hotel didn't have a very nice feel and was a bit run down. We went to reception and was met with a unfriendly male receptionist who after booking us in turned away and went about his business and didn't offer for our bags to be taken up - no maps or brochures of the area as we'd been offered in other hotels. Anyway we checked in the room and it was quite large and had two double beds in and seemed fine. No tea/coffee facilities and bathroom was large with usual complimentory shampoos/shower gels etc but had a funny smell as though it hadn't been cleaned properly. The first nights sleep was awful as the beds were like rocks with springs in them and I ended up sleeping on the floor as they were so bad!! My husband had an aching back the next day and we went into breakfast. The breakfast was ok - if you like lukewarm eggs. Now I know this sounds as though I am being ultra fussy but we travel quite a bit and have not really had complaints about anywhere we have stayed but was not happy with this hotel at all seeing as it is a five star hotel. We decide too stay one more night and then the next day went to reception and checked out. We were going to be staying for one week but I just didn't want to stay any longer. The receptionist didn't ask why we were checking out and we just left and took a taxi to Hotel Pullman Skipper which is situated around the corner from the beach. We have stayed here before and it's a lovely hotel, The difference in the service was fantastic - offer of bags to be taken to room and brochures and maps given and the lady on reception remembered us from when we were there in June. The room we were given was on 6th floor with a view of the sea and a lovely balcony with a table and 2 chairs. We had a great stay and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Fenstrex
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. The rooms were comfortable and spacious, especially the bathroom which was marble tiled and had tremendous water pressure. The free internet in the lobby was a big plus, since we used it extensively to plan what to do in the city. You can get a card from the concierge everyday which gives you access to 30 min of free wireless in your hotel room, but remember to bring your european power adapter so that you can actually charge your laptop! The location was great for our purposes. It was a 5-10 minute walk to Placa Espanya, where you can catch several city trains as well as the train to Montserrat (where we took a day trip). Placa Espanya also has an Information kiosk where you can find helpful advice during the day. There are also a number of buses within walking distance, including buses that take you directly to the beach or to the Ramblas. The hotel is located at the foot of Montjuic and convenient to all the museums and attractions in the park (e.g., MNAC, Fundacio Joan Miro). The Magic Fountain is less than a 5 minute walk straight down the street from the hotel and should not be missed! We never took a taxi the entire time (6 nights) we were in Barcelona. There are plenty of small cafes, bakeries and tapas restaurants near the hotel, and the Hostafrancs Marketplace is a 15min walk (or one train stop) from the hotel, where you can find all your grocery items, as well as cheap wine. Hostafrancs is a smaller version of the main Boqueria at Las Ramblas, but you'll find things like Iberian Jamon for half the price. La Fruiteria is catty-corner from the hotel, where you can find reasonably priced local art and very well priced wine from the Rioja and Basque wine regions. Perhaps, the one drawback is that the hotel is in a quieter area, so if you're interested in being directly on the beach or off the Ramblas/Passeig de Gracia, or having a ton of chic restaurants and bars on your doorstop, it is not ideal. But on the flip side, that means the area is not overly flooded with other tourists, which is something we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsofDelaware
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice, clean, quiet, and plenty of ammenties. Staff was very helpful in ensuring we went to the correct Flamenco show. Close to the Magic Fountain and other magnificent architecture. Was advised the breakfast was complimentary. Instead it was extremely expensive. The hotel room itself was reasonably priced. Unfortunately, they did not answer my email about storing my luggage for a while on the day of checkout. As it cost me $40 to call them a couple times.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms lovely beds”
Reviews.Author: essie2109
Reviews.Content: Two queen size beds ,quiet bedrooms,large room,setee and desk in room,very clean.Building itself concrete block but inside very pleasant.Downside parking only available from the hotel at 17 euros a day.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, expensive and very bad customer satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: josepJapan
Reviews.Content: I was there with my familly for 4 nigths. The staf in the hotel was arrogant, far away from any touristic spot, excep Montjuic mountain. I bougth a paint that they were selling in the reception, they did not give me any bill or receipt. After several days complaining I stoped ( wasting time to talk with a stone) Room was quite dirty, some empty coke cans were remaining below the bed from prvious customer. Man makes mistakes, so I wish I did not chose that option, but we cannot change the past.

Reviews.Title: “Fira Palace Hotel --- a hidden gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: OPGatoRx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fira Palace with our 14 year-old son a day before and 4 days after a Mediterranean cruise based on recommendations we read on TripAdvisor as well as pretty extensive research. We were able to get a fantastic rate by booking through the iPrefer website (make sure you sign up to become a member and get early check-in, late check-out, as well as other deals). Great location --- easy to get around town using the Metro or the taxis that were always outside the hotel. The rooms were very large and comfortable (2 queen-sized beds, a work area with a desk and sofa, very large bathroom with 2 sinks, separate shower, toilet with bidet, and bathtub). After spending a week aboard a cruise ship this was heaven! We didn't get to eat at their restaurant or use their pool and gym, but there is free internet and you can also print for free (just make sure the printers have paper before you use the computer!). If you don't have much luggage, you can simply take the Aerobus right outside the Barcelona airport to the city (a kiosk by its bus stop takes euros, ATM cards and credit cards, the driver only takes cash). The Plaza d'Espanya stop is closest to the hotel: instead of heading down Ave Ma Cristina and left on Ave Rius i Taulet, we found it easier to go down Ave de Paral-lel and take a right at Lleida. The hotel is at the corner of Lleida and Rius i Taulet. There are several small restaurants in the area, all catering to the locals. Have some churros con chocolate for breakfast at this little restaurant diagonally across from the gas station on Paral-lel and Lleida. For lunch or a quick snack order a "bikini" at any of the sandwich shops. Have assorted tapas and paella for dinner at the Xop d'Or on Paral-lel. If you want Thai food walk 20 mins from the hotel to Thai Thai (Carrer de la Diputacio near Viladomat). To explore Barcelona we found it cheaper to buy the T-10 Metro passes since there was just 3 of us. Because people had warned us about pickpockets we didn't bring much stuff around except for bottled water and a camera, just taking small amounts of cash, an ATM &/or credit card and a drivers license. Be sure to walk around and enjoy all that Barcelona has to offer: good food and wine, and beautiful architecture. Some extra tips: 1. Use your ATM card instead of bringing a large amount of dollars or travelers checks. You can get a better rate even with the conversion fees and ATM charges. There is an ATM at the airport lobby just before you exit the airport, and there are ATMs all over the city. Select the UK flag to read the directions in English. Unlike US ATMs, those in Europe will not give you a receipt unless requested. 2. Make sure to know your credit card PIN and bring your drivers license. As a security feature many places will request a PIN to complete a CC transaction (e.g. using the Metro's ticket kiosk) or will require photo ID. 3. Buy large bottles of water (1 to 3-liter) from corner stores or El Corte Ingles (there's a huge branch at Plaza Catalunya) and fill your smaller bottles from them. 4. Be prepared to walk. Some famous sites are far from the Metro stations (ex. Parc Guell is actually nearer to the Vallcarca station but it is a very steep climb, even with the occasional escalator).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ytinerec
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay at this hotel prior to our recent family cruise vacation. It was absolutely great. First of all, location: The hotel is located within walking distance of the Spanish Village, Museum Catalonia, and the Musical Fountain. It is also very close to a major hub of the Barcelona Metro subway system (Espanya station). This makes it really easy to get to popular places like Sagrada Familia, Las Ramblas, etc. We felt this was really important to us and thats why we originally picked this hotel. Second, the service and amenities: The service here was incredible. From the helpful greeters to the friendly front desk, we never had an issue. The front desk was very helpful in recommending some places to eat, and directions to the Metro / sightseeing places on the first day we arrived. The amenities were very good. There is a medium sized pool that we used, and a buffet breakfast is available at an extra coast. The lobby was very spacious and professional looking. The amenities were tailored more towards a business traveller. Lastly the room: Our room was their "Standard Room". The room is VERY spacious by European standards. Their website touts their rooms as the biggest in the city, and after staying in one, I'd believe it! The size is comparable or even bigger than a standard North American room. Ours had 2 queen size beds, a sofa, a business desk. The bathroom was very large as well. The window soundproofing was very good. We did not feel like the noise from the street bothered us at all. Overall a very spacious and high quality room by even North American standards that is close to tourist attractions and transportation hubs. The only downside i could think of was that the price was a little high, but compared to the place we stayed at post-cruise, my mom said it best: "I'd rather pay a bit extra and stay at Fira"

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel right in the city”
Reviews.Author: Angela0402
Reviews.Content: We are a family of two adults and a 10 year old. We recently stayed at the Fira Palace Hotel for one night while in Barcelona. We initially rented an apartment in Barcelona for four days, then travelled up the coast and into France, then came back down to Barcelona for one night before flying home. We found the Fira Palace thru Hotels.ca. What a great hotel! Super clean and the rooms were HUGE by Barcelona standards. There was an indoor pool (which my son used for about an hour) and fitness facility and we walked to La Ramblas in about 20 minutes. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and offered free internet access. Our room was super clean. We had two double beds and one pull out single bed with more than enough room to spare. Barcelona is a fantastic city. Everyone should travel there at least once. We felt very safe and often wandered around until about 11pm without incident. I would recommend a two day pass for the Turistic Bus which was great! The Gothic Quarter is amazing and a stop at 4Cats Tavern/Restaurant is in order. If we return to Barcelona I would definitely stay once again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DougR
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor.Com is again deserving of my gratitude. I found the Fira Palace Barcelona listed and recommended by travelers on this website... We needed a place to stay while we toured the city for a few days after a cruise. The staff and accommodations were just as we expected from the reviews and the hotel website. The location can't be beat! It is a short walk to the hop-on hop-off tour bus stop. !!! Make sure you sign up for a free membership at iprefer.com, since this hotel provided a free room upgrade for our stay plus an early morning check-in with this iprefer card !!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for travelling to major sites in Barcelona, very clean and staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: butler_del
Reviews.Content: The hotel Fira was in an excellent location for travelling to key tourist sites. We used the metro and it was quite easy to navigate to the different sites. Make sure to be there on days thursday to sunday so that you can get to see the dancing fountain, it only happens on those nights. Hotel Fira is a fine hotel and the rooms are quite large, we upgraded to executive room for couple of euro more and it was worth it. We did not eat in the hotel as we had read reviews that suggested it was over priced. While the staff were polite and friendly we noticed that during our stay we visited the bar each night for a drink. Each night the bar man was on a mobile phone and did not end the conversation on the phone while he served us and other customers. The person in charge of the luggage room the evening we were leaving was also on a mobile phone and was a bit dismissive of us. This would not turn us off staying there but maybe if this is read by the hotel staff it might be make them think.

Reviews.Title: “Big is not always better - think twice!”
Reviews.Author: keciaanne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we wanted a quiet, spacious room, but we didn't expect it to be so run down, dark, and dirty. This hotel is in serious need of an upgrade! I'll admit the room was big, and fairly quiet, but it was dark (poor lighting), outdated, and the bed was extremely hard (even after we requested a thicker mattress pad). Front desk staff was inconsistent, some downright unhelpful (one person couldn't even provide estimated phone charges unless we made a call first (?)). Rooms and interior hallways were stuffy and AC did not appear to work. The hotel offers 30 minutes free Internet daily. I say "Why Bother?" as the connection is very slow, and you have to request a new passcard each day - ridiculous, this should be free unlimited! Location is near the Fountain Magique, great for one-night's entertainment, but seriously lacking in restaurant choices and night life, certainly too far away from the City center.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Time4UToFly
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, either a king w/sofa bed or two queens w/sofa bed. You could accomodate 5 in a room but I believe that hotel would limit you to 4. Other reviews say this hotel may not be great for families but we would disagree...3 teens in our family and it was great, close to the Metro (Plaza Espanya), hotel also sells reduced rate bus turistic tickets. You can ride the Aerobus to/from the airport. It stops at Plaza Espanya, hotel is only a 5-7 walk from bus stop. Were willing to work with us on early check in after all night flight from USA. The bellman can check your bags if rooms are not ready yet. Italian restaurant (Gulfo di Napoli) around corner/ in same building as hotel is very good and reasonable. Hotel has six computers in lobby w/free internet or 30 min wireless free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Diocles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet location but within walking distance to the city centre. The reception staff were very polite and helpful. The room was spacious and the bathroom amazing with a separate toliet, shower and bath/shower as well as two vanities and great accessories which were replenished daily. There was also free interent in the lobby with six stations. Nice swimming pool and gym facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pickyatltraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really disgusting. It smells like sewage. Not a good experience. It was dirty and everything about it was unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Thrillrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fira Palace on Saturday, June 27th and really enjoyed the hotel. We were arriving by car and the hotel was easy to find with convenient parking underground. The rooms were very large for European standards, clean and quiet. For us, the location could not be beat as the Magic Fountains are literally right around the corner and a metro stop is just a short, pleasant walk away from the hotel. If staying here, be sure to sign up for the free 'I Prefer' program on the hotel's website for complimentary upgrades, late check-out, etc. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful - I really can't find anything to fault at this hotel except that the breakfast was a bit expensive (we did not eat there).

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - clean and amazing staff. very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nki65
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. Its beautiful and very clean. The staff is extremely helpful. Its right next to the waterfalls so at night you can hear the music from the waterfalls. Good location. You can walk down the major streets and be in all the fun and exciting neighborhoods. The amenities in the hotel are great. There's a gym, sauna and a pool there. A great place to go before late dinners and after walking around all day. I stayed at the hotel with 2 other friends and the rooms were great. Two full size beds and one pull-out couch bed. Very comfortable for 3 people. The bathrooms are HUGE and separate so all three of us could use the bathroom, the shower and the sink at the same time and never be in each other's way. I loved this hotel and would recommend it for everyone. There are 6 computers to use for internet services usually available at all times. The only thing missing in the hotel is a vending machines for soda on the floors and ice machines. But that was it. If you go, have dinner @ L'Alformma restaurant about a block down the street. AMAZING Catalian food. And there's another restaurant down the street on the right hand side that I can not remember its name but they have amazing meat dishes.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for conferences”
Reviews.Author: kvw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fira Palace on two occasions in May 2009, and both visits were excellent. The hotel staff at the front desk were courteous and helpful. Our room was spotless. We had upgraded to a suite, and the room was spectacular! The bathroom had wonderful features. The hotel is right beside the Palace and park so great for walking. The breakfast is excellent, very elaborate, the food was fresh and tasty. We are staying here again for a conference next year, and we are very excite to visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great service! Would go there a million times!”
Reviews.Author: Egyptiantravellers
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Barcelona. The first trip was 2 years ago when we stayed in a hotel on the Ramblas, which had very small rooms with no locks on them (quite unsafe). Staying on the Ramblas, although amidst all activities in the city, is quite unsafe and some friends were actually robbed while sleeping in their rooms. Staying at Fira palace, although not in the centre, is not far from it. it is a huge modern hotel, with extremely big, clean rooms enough to hold a whole family of 4 (in a double room) with everyone feeling comfortable. more important with locks on doors, which made me sleep deeply. the bathroom is very huge, with separate, bath, shower and toilet. the toilet has a bidet, which we usually missed in European hotels. Breakfast was plenty and with wide variations. the staff was really helpful and spoke English which was quite strange as most Catalunians fail to speak other languages besides Catalan/Spanish, although they get so many tourists daily. The elevators are very fast and you dont have to wait for ages for any elevator to come. There are six computers in the lobby where you can log on the net for free and print whatever you want for free. health club is interesting to visit. on the whole we had a marvellous stay at the Fira palace and will surely go there a thousand time. The hotel is very close to the Poble Sec and the Place d'Espagna metro stations which would take you to the centre in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: stuart3368
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early May. Its a good location in town and easy to hop on the metro and travel all over town. Beware the bed is hard, but room is spacious and the bathroom was nice. We ate breakfast there once, it was good and a lot to choose from, but was over priced. Instead we went around the corner and found a little restaurant that served sandwiches and cafe con leche, but beware it seemed like a locals place, where people stopped in on their way to work...lots of smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Huge Rooms: Great for family”
Reviews.Author: newtonmatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise and found the hotel to be an excellent value. We had six in our party (2 adults and 4 Children), so we needed 2 rooms. The rooms are huge for European standards, with the room having 2 double beds and pull-out sofa. In addition, there is a separate foyer with a door that you can close, blocking out the hall noise. There are also double windows that block out the street noise. The bathroom also had a separate walk in shower (with 4 shower heads) and tub and was quite big. One great feature is a rather large (and warm) indoor pool in the basement. Our kids enjoyed it after a day of walking around the city. The full buffet breakfast is also rather good, better than most European hotels. The location couldn't be better. Although it was not near Las Ramblas, you can walk in about 20 minutes, but Barcelona has an excellent subway system. The hotel, however, is a block from the National Museum of Art, font magica (magic fountain with great water show every night), and quite near the Poble Espanyol which is worth a visit. You can reach the Sagarda Familia by subway in about 15 minutes (1 station change and about 5 stops). The staff was excellent. even though we arrived at 10AM they let us go to our rooms. The desk staff spoke english and was quite helpful. There is wifi (30 minutes fee/day), but also about a half dozen free computers to use in the lobby. For the money the Fira Palace can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: newfrog
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace Hotel had many good parts to it, but a few things that kept it from being on my top hotel lists. For a European hotel, the rooms are enormous. The bathrooms were really impressive, with separate shower, bath, and toilet with bidet. The toilet and shower have separate doors as well. The bathroom amenities were good quality, with everything you need. The bed was large, but I found it quite hard and didn't sleep as well as I would've liked. There was a large TV, but the remote control did not work for it. Or actually it worked but in a completely random fashion. When I pushed any button it would randomly switch channels, change the volume, turn itself off, etc. So while the bedroom looked nice the two things I wanted to use the most (the bed and TV) were both not very good. There were about 6 computers with internet available in the lobby for general use, as well as wireless internet throughout the hotel (for an additional fee). There is a pool, dry sauna, and weight/exercise room available for guests to use. The breakfast was one of the best breakfast buffets I have ever had. I highly recommend it, as there is a huge selection: cooked food, cereals, pastries, yogurts, fruit, etc. There is also a selection of juices and even champagne. The hotel is located outside the main tourist part of Barcelona. It is not well located for Las Ramblas or the old town, but is right next to Mont Juic and the Olympic park. It is convenient to the convention centers too. Tthere is a metro station about 5 minutes walk away which will take you into the center of town pretty quickly (Espanya). Walking downtown would probably take about 30 minutes minimum. The staff at the hotel were friendly and courteous with pretty good English. There was one major incident when I was at the hotel, where the ceiling in the lobby got completely flooded by some pipes bursting. They had to shut off the lifts for most of the day. I was not that impressed, but it didn't really affect my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Cudrefin
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Fira Palace hotel with my family in April 2009. We picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews, hotel price and availability. We would normally have looked for something a bit closer to the city centre but we got a good deal with the room rate and the close proximity of the metro meant that the main centre was only 10-15 minutes from the hotel (including a 5 minute walk to the metro station at Placa Espanya). Hotel Location: The hotel is situated approximately 5 minutes walk from Placa Espanya and the National Palace and only 3 minutes from the Magic Fountain. The area surrounding the hotel is a mixture of residential and commercial (theatres and museums being the main thing) but not very much in the way of shops. There are small bars (anyone for Tapas) all over Barcelona and the area surrounding the hotel is no different. There is a good restaurant next door to the hotel on Carrer de Lleida. The reservation: We booked the room directly through the hotel website as I prefer to deal directly with hotels rather than through third-party booking agencies. Making the reservation was easy and we quickly received email confirmation of our booking. Although check-in is from 3:00 pm our room was ready when we arrived at midday. Check-in: No problems with check-in. Our room was ready and within a few minutes we were unpacking. The room: We opted for a suite as our daughter is only 5 years of age and we expected to be spending quite a lot of time in the room, particularly in the evening. The suite was split into a large lounge/office/dining area, a separate bedroom and a large bathroom. The decor was fine although the room didn't get very much daylight. The room had a balcony overlooking the side street with a table and a couple of chairs but didn't get any sunshine as it was recessed into the main building. There was a big flat screen television although the English-speaking channels seemed to be limited to news only. The room had a safe (always a good thing to have) but no coffee or tea making facilities that I could find. There was a minibar although we never used it. Overall we were very pleased with the room. Hotel services: The hotel had a health club with a gym and swimming pool. We used the swimming pool a couple of times and it was generally quiet. The pool and changing rooms were functional and clean so no complaints there. The only other service we used was the hotel restaurant. Our daughter opted for bread and a fruit salad as there was nothing else on the menu that she wanted. My meal of baby lamb chops was disappointing both in quality and quantity. My wife opted for the mushroom lasagna which was really more starter size than a main course although she did enjoy it. Throw in a portion of tiramisu, a portion of profiteroles (2 Euros per profiterole!!!!), a couple of coffees, a couple of bottles of beer and a glass of coke and the final bill of over 80 Euros looked very steep for a fairly average meal. We would have probably used room service for some snacks but the eye-watering prices left us heading for local shops. Not only can you expect to pay 15 Euros or more for an omelette and only a couple of Euros less for some cheese sandwiches but the hotel also adds on a delivery charge of 3 Euros. Housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room clean and tidy during our stay with chocolates left on the bed every evening. High points: This was our first visit to Barcelona and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Easter may not have been the best time of year to visit as it seemed really busy (too busy for me) around the main attractions and with a young child we weren't prepared to queue for a significant length of time. The metro system was really easy to use and we simply bought a 10 journey ticket each which lasted us for the entire stay. There are plenty of sights to see and loads of places to eat and drink. Low points: In some areas of the city, particularly around La Ramblas and some of the narrow alleys down towards Port Vell, I didn't feel completely safe. We didn't run into any trouble but a woman sat at a table near us in one outside bar went to pay the bill only to find that her bag had been stolen. Conclusion: The Fira Palace hotel is a good place to stay if you want somewhere slightly out of the main tourist areas but within easy reach of the centre of the city. If I return to Barcelona I will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A big room is not everything...........”
Reviews.Author: deborahFrance
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for its position - 5 mins. from the Magic Fountain (and it was magic) and because the rooms were large. However soon realised a big room was not everything.
