Terrible view of apt. block (they said they had no other twin bedded Executive room available) , dirty carpet, and the bathroom, which at first glance looked okay was barely functional - cd not use the bath as the thermastat was jammed on 30* which was far too hot, the shower heads were also partly blocked up and I got cold water only from one jet not nice when you need a hot soak! Also the marble worktops were stained and tiles cracked, not at all what we expected. Could not receive a good enough WiFi connection to use my laptop, and the parking we had been promised turned out to be a public car park, albeit under the hotel. On the other hand dinner in the restaurant was great and the lad who served us certainly knew his stuff. Would NOT go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, big clean rooms, great bathroom, near Metro”
Reviews.Author: jut87
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace is a great, modern hotel. The rooms are large, and the shower in the bathroom is the best I've ever had at a hotel. They have 6 computers in the lobby with free internet access, which is a great benefit. The location of the hotel is not in the heart of Barcelona. It is located west of the downtown (Ramblas) area, near the Montjuic area. The hotel is about 3 blocks away from the nearest Metro stop, and it's all of the action is about 3 stops away on the Metro. The staff was courteous, the rooms very clean, the area is very quiet as well. The only negative at all, is that you can't walk to the busier parts of town. Other than that, there is no reason at all not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chico_malo45
Reviews.Content: Fira Palace has a great location in Montjuic, right next door to MNAC (Museo Nacional de Arte Catalana) with its massive splendor and magic fountains. The hotel itself is on a quiet street yet close enough to Plaza España and Av. Para.lel where one can catch the metro or the Airbus to El Prat Airport. Room was clean and efficient with a sparklingly clean and spacious marble shower. The staff was unbelievable helpful and the bar staff absolutely charming. Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Coeury
Reviews.Content: Booked via expedia for the terrific price of 99€! staid 2 nights. 1st night regulat dble rrom : large room, nice view but beds too big and hard! second night: we decided to upgrade to an executive for 19€ and was a good choice to make (by the way executive rooms only on 4th and 5th floor). indoor swimming pool nice but small. Note that you'll have to enter the gym club on -1st. Easy to park around if you have a car. Close to Monjuic but I am not sure I'll consider to stay there without a car...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, bargain rates to be had”
Reviews.Author: hkist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights Sat-Tue in July 2008. It is very handily located for the airport bus, Montjuic park and the metro which will take you anywhere. It is clearly intended to cater for the Exhibition attandants which gives it a business hotel feel (clean, good service) but with nice enough leisure facilities. Pro: -very good sized room and beds - wifi available (but not free) Con: - pool hours severely restricted at weekends I did not have breakfast in the hotel (expensive) , chosing instead to have a roll and drink at local bakery. Plenty of shops around. i booked directly with the hotel which had a special on at weekends. I got 4 nights for 400 euros!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: K8TF
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before leaving on a 12-night cruise. After looking at the website, we learned it was part of the Select Hotels Group, and they gave special rates and amenities for members of its iPrefer club. It's free to join iPrefer and the hotel has a link to the iPrefer site. The hotel is clean, classy and all the staff were personable. As a result of being iPrefer members, we were upgraded to a suite. It was huge - living room, bedroom and a large bathroom with a separate shower, plus a free bottle of wine. The hotel itself is in a great location. I'm glad we didn't book a hotel near Las Ramblas because it's busy and congested. Fira Palace is near Montjuic and is a 5-minute walk to the nearest Barcelona Bus Turistic stop which is a hop-on/hop-off double decker bus. It's a great way to see all parts of the city and then you can decide on where to spend more time later. The hotel's restaurants are very good. We had the breakfast buffet. It was 16 euros and well worth the price. It had hot and cold cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, tortilla espanola (Spanish potato and onion omelet/fritatta), fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. It was enough that we didn't feel the need to eat lunch. The El Mall restaurant is open for dinner, but a little pricey. There are loads of other restaurants in the area that are good and well-priced. We will definitely book a room here the next time we're in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: CarolineF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fira Palace for 3 nights. Arrived from airport at 12 noon and room was ready for us. Check in was fast and efficient dealt with by friendly staff. Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the local school and with views towards the Tibadado mountain and castle. Room was very large and very clean with a well stocked bathroom with his & her sinks, separate shower and separate toilet areas. Large wide screen television, but still the only English channels were BBC World News, CNN and sport channel. The bed was a super king size, but although we slept very well (partly due to the excellent black-out curtains and lack of street noise) the mattress was quite hard. Didn't have breakfast which was 16 Euros per person. We took a travel kettle with us and bought juice and croissants locally. Used the hotel pool which was good, but didn't have time to use the gym. The Espanya Metro stop was an easy and pleasant walk from the hotel, being alongside the Magic Fountains (these are not in use from the end of September so we didn't get to see them). Barcelona is a large and busy city, but the Metro is a quick and fairly easy way of getting around. We bought T10 tickets which cost E7.50 and give you 10 journeys per ticket and can also be used on the bus (the No 46 takes you directly to the airport from Pl Espanya). Would recommend a visit to Park Guell (which is free) and also the Olympic complex which is within walking distance of the hotel. We didn't have time to see everything, but managed to see the main places of interest. Having signed up for the 'I Prefer' scheme we were given a free late check-out till 6pm which was greatly appreciated as our flight was not until late and it gave us the whole of the day to look around the city. Would definitely stay at the Fira Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: catmon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very grateful to the kind and most informative staff. The desk clerks were extremely helpful with a map, directions and things to discover in thier city. Our room was clean and stocked full of amenities. The bathroom was luxurious. The view was beautiful. They let us check in early and we enjoyed breakfast the next day in the restaurant. We would reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: gloria27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis of clam after a busy day sightseeing. The rooms are large and the upper floors have good views across to Tibidabo mountain. It is very convenient for Montjuic and all its museums. It is a short walk (5-10mins) to either poble sec or plaza espanya metro stations and we felt safe walking around the neighbourhood. Also useful that there were always taxis waiting outside the hotel for the whole of our 5 day stay. It cost about 6 euros to travel across town by taxi. Thanks to previous reviews we made use of the patisserie across the road for breakfast and found it to be cheap and tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: SpursLS6
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel with a swimming pool in a quiet area. This is exactly what we got. Walking around other parts of the city, I am glad that we chose this one because the noise must have been a problem with many other hotels in parts of Barcelona with busy nightlife. Everything was perfect - the bed, the size of the room, the bathroom with amazing shower,the pool, the service and the location. We were able to walk to the main tourist areas (Las Ramblas, the Gothic area and Montjuic) and could see the top of the muscial fountains from the window. However, if you are looking for a hotel with character - which I normally am - this is probably not for you as once inside, you could be in any city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CJ1920
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four night business stay at the Fira Palace in Barcelona and had an excellent stay. The check in was easy and staff welcoming. The rooms are a great size and the bathrooms very impressive, with large massage shower and separate bath and toilet. The breakfast is quite expensive at 16 euro each but does have a good selection of hot and cold food. I particularly liked the location, near to the Olympic Stadium and about a 25 minute walk to Las Ramblas, so away from the crowds. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: BYJP
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the hotel for one week, and our stay was perfect. Our friends said their beds were too hard but ours was just perfect. The rooms were quiet (the double doors helped) and the rooms and the bathrooms were quite spacious and clean. The reception staff was really helpful with restaurant suggestions and maps. The metro station is 2 blocks from the hotel and 1 block away from an amazing water fountain show at night. Booking directly with the hotel gives you a discount after the third night. Tips: There is a great little patisserie directly across the street where a lady with a very good English sells juices, coffee, croissants, and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but take care when booking”
Reviews.Author: john_d_Uk
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Fira Palace on two occasions and thoroughly enjoyed our stays. The rooms are very large and in good condition. The hotel is in a good location at the side of the Montjuic park ... quite peaceful after a hectic day in the town ....yet easy to reach the centre by Metro. There are however a few things to look out for: - Firstly, the buffet breakfast comes a little expensive at 15 euros a head and there is no simple coffee and pastry option until after 10am. Secondly, they sometimes launch reduced rates on their web site. So you can find yourself staying in a room for 131euros with your neighbor paying only 97 euros. Thirdly, when I booked this year we asked for a superior room. On arrival we were placed in what turned out to be a standard room. Now having been there before we knew that it was a standard room so I contacted reception. I checked on the room rate first and they confirmed that I was paying the superior room price. Only after challenging them further did they finally admit that we had been given a standard room. So, it looks like yet another case of 'buyer beware'.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antonis2
Reviews.Content: Just PERFECT....Great location(5' walking from metro station Espanya-Placa Espanya),very clean hotel and room,room very comfortable,2' walking from the Museum of Art. It was the best choice for our holidays in Barcelona. In the beginning we were thinking of reserving a hotel near to LAS RAMBLAS area but hopefully the last minute we made the perfect choice....Ramblas is perfect area to visit but not staying because it was so crowded and noisy....Staying in FIRA PALACE you are just 10' by metro away from metro station Catalunya(beginning of RAMBLAS)....trust this hotel!!The next time of visiting Barca for sure we'll be staying at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: parsleysmum
Reviews.Content: Booked Fira Palace for a short break with my two teenage daughters to escape the rain in England! Got a good deal price wise and was very impressed with the reception we got when we arrived. Our room was huge with 2 double beds and a great bathroom, seperate loo and shower, everything we needed. We had forgotten our adaptor but the reception guys were quick to help and lend us one, vital for the girls and their array of hair straighteners, mobiles etc etc!! The air con was a godsend and worked well, and we were able to keep up with the olympics on the wide screen TV. On the second morning we awoke to the sound of drilling and hammering underneath our room....they were renovating the restaurant!! I asked if we could move rooms and this happened straight away with no problem. A slightly smaller room but still big, and on the 6th floor so away from any noise! We liked the pool and the bar, and the lobby area is really nice to sit and cool down. It is a good 20 minute walk into town which we did couple of times but we also used the bus and the metro which was easy. Mount Juiec is beautiful to explore and you are couple of minutes walk from the magic fountain, which is amazing! We also used taxis a lot as they are very cheap, and it was nice to be able to get away from the chaos that is central Barcelona!! All in all a great find, we didn't use the breakfast faciities and a kettle in the room would have been good, but coffee in the bar was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NorthernIrelandJojo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for a long weekend. The room was excellent-seperate living area to the bedroom with sofa, flat screen T.V, desk and a small table and 2 chairs. Bedroom was spacious with a very comfortable bed and again a flat screen T.V. Bathroom was also spacious with walk in shower and the room was cleaned every day and bed sheets changed. Complimentary soft drinks and apples are available in the reception area for most of the day. Swimming pool was good for a bit of relaxation after a day in the sun but never used the gym so cant comment on that. The hotel is a five minute walk to the metro (subway) which only takes a few minutes into the centre of barcelona. The magic fountain is just up from the hotel and we watched a lovely water display from it on the saturday night-lots of tourists and local turned up to watch this. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty, we also had dinner in the restaurant one of the nights and found the food excellent. This is a brilliant hotel and i would recommend it to anyone. Although it is not in the centre of barcelona and we found the surrounding area quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: mr_beng
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, and would recommend this to anyone. The rooms have great standard, and are spacious and clean. Staff always helpful and friendly. Location close to the Magic Fountain, and about 5 min walk to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect...”
Reviews.Author: maisvenus
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace has got a wonderful lobby. The standard rooms are quite like what you see on its actual webpage so all in all, pretty pleasant. Again, location was excellent and I enjoyed the breakfast buffet which has an excellent spread. Rooms are spacious and well stocked with toiletries and towels (the massage shower in my room did not work very well though but still it was alright). However, a few things happened that have coloured my perception of this place. So much so that I'm writing this in my room in the hotel! Firstly, when I checked in, I noticed that the dates shown on the check-in card did not match the dates I had on my travel coupon (booked via a travel agent). When queried, the staff insisted that their dates were correct and because my travel agent amended the booking, my agent must have gotten the new set of dates wrong (2 nights less). The part that ticked me off was that they did not offer to try to resolve the situation for me. They simply told me to contact either my agent or the company handling their website reservations and that was it. However I did not believe that such a big mistake could have been made by my agent and only upon being very firm, did they go through all the hoops one would expect of a supposedly 4* hotel service to try to check what went wrong. Turns out they did not update their logs hence put the wrong information into their system!! But I did not get any apology, just a, "no, no you are right" in what I perceived as a semi-grudging way. Coming up to the room, there was a particular fried dough smell in the bathroom and only by opening the door to the room did it kind of fade away but every time you closed the door you could smell it. I presume it's from the restaurant downstairs (I was on the mezzanine level)? On other levels, you can smell it along the corridor. They clearly need to work on their air filtration system! The Wi-Fi internet service is not free but the price is reasonable (10,50Euros for 24 hours). However, the connection speed is variable (at one point being very, very slow) and the connection itself is very unstable. Once, the connection just died and I was unable to re-connect to the wi-fi spot despite multiple tries (my time was still ticking here). So again, I rang up reception who was slightly more helpful and claimed that the network was fine. However, the end result was the same as when I checked-in - that I had to ring the company providing the internet! Surely they would be able to check on my behalf given that it was a pretty simple problem. At the end of it, there also was no offer to extend my usage time to compensate for the time wasted. I rang the company myself and although the staff I spoke to claims the number is free, I will be very, very unimpressed if I get billed for it! Also, if they charge me for two "extra" nights from the check-in fiasco, I will be well ticked off. Overall, I have no qualms about the physical aspects of this hotel (e.g. location, decor, rooms etc) but its service leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaiser01
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 4 days with family room very clean and comfortable two large beds and a seating area, bathroom was clean marbled through out and well equipped with separate shower with body jets and a separate w/c and bidet. Hotel very well located as only 5 minutes from the Magic Fountains which are a must see but dont leave before they play "Barcelona by Freddie Merqury" as this is the finale, also very close to the Plaza Espanya where you can catch the metro (which is very easy to use) to anywhere in the city. did not need to use the hotel staff apart from the check in and check out we arrived at 11.00 and was allowed to check in even though the check in was officially 15.00. Pool and gym very good we used the pool everyday and had it to ourselves. you can also request any type of pillow you like to make your stay more comfortable if need be. Hotel is also used for a lot of business confrences and also used by flight cabin crew who stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Noisy Business Hotel With Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: GalvestonJT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights and hated each night. My biggest problem is the hotel is noisy. One can hear conversations and TV sounds in the next rooms and all conversations in the hall. My wife awoke to violent screams in the hall on our first night. If this is not enough, the staff service alternates between disorganized, surly and bored. (By the way, we are Spanish/English bi-lingual so it was not the language barrier.) I filled out a "how are we doing" hotel form and turned it into the desk clerk after night two. I requested a new room, but of course I never heard a word. I am guessing it went into the trash. Their restaurant El Mall was a puzzle. We had a wonderful lunch, then a distressingly bad dinner. Really bad - as in "TV dinner bad". The breakfast buffet was just fair and very pricey. I could not find a scenario where I would return or recommend this place. The hotel does have large rooms and is somewhat new, but there must be a better hotel in Barcelona for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ralpha
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace matched the expectations that we had from reading other reviews. The location was a good balance. Far enough out to be quiet but within a walkable distance of Las Ramblas. The room was large and well furnished and the bathroom was also large and well equipped but it's starting to look a bit dated. We didn't eat in the hotel at any time. Next time we go to Barcelona, we will certainly consider going tothe FIra Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet nice place”
Reviews.Author: flash76
Reviews.Content: I spent two nite in biz trip in this hotel. Well located near mont juic Worm welcome from the staff better that the other hotel I used in barcelona. Large various breakfast. Fast WIFI connection

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time at the Fira Palace”
Reviews.Author: stez867
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights in Barcelona at the Fira Palace-what a lovely hotel! it's near the plaza de espana, not in the center of the city, but perfect for us because i liked to sleep in peace & quiet. We signed up for the i prefer program before booking our hotel (through their website) and got free wi-fi in the room and a room upgrade just for signing up for hte program. definitely recommend signing up for the program & providing your account number when you book your room. They gave us a corner suite with a balcony, and we only booked a standard room. it was fantastic. the shower had 2 body sprays, and a separate tub was nice. All the bathroom products you could ever need, along with a safe that was large enough for our laptop & other belongings. Would defintely recommend the Fira Palace to anyone wishing to stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: rugg
Reviews.Content: Room was quite a suite with king size bed, sofa, table and armchair. Huge LCD tv. Bathroom very large as well. Just some doubt on the celaness of mouquette but it is something common around, so.... The position is not central but big trade off quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nickyormonde
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for a couple of nights when we visited Barcelona. We went to Barcelona mainly to go to the Camp Nou stadium. The hotel is well situated for the metro and therefore great access to the many sights of the city. It is close to Placa Espana and the magic fountains. The best advise I received from reading reviews of this hotel is to get the bus from the airport to Placa Espana on arrival. It is the first stop and will save you a fortune than getting a taxi. The hotel rooms are very good in size with both a bath and a fantastic separate power shower. The hotel has a good leisure centre with a swimming pool, sauna and sym. Overall a great value hotel. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Frampsta
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a hotel that caters for business travellers - the room was a decent size, well furnished and well maintained. The bathroom was large with a well-powered multi-head power shower - the tinted glass door that separates the WC from the rest of the bathroom is certainly a unique touch! The hotel's location 200m from the Magic Fountain is quite handy and the hotel is a short (EUR 6/7) cab ride into Las Ramblas / harbour - alternatively there is a Metro station not too far away that will do the journey in 10 mins door-to-door. Room service was good but over-priced - but whatever you do, on no account go to the little italian restaurant that is located on the rear side of the building (and to which we were directed by the concierge). Grubby, sweaty, rude waiters throw equally grubby and mediocre food onto the tables of unsuspecting visitors - we witnessed one altercation between a diner and a waiter, and had we not left after the starters would have no doubt witnessed more. In summary - hotel v. good, concierge recommendations v. bad!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Services”
Reviews.Author: IonutBucharest
Reviews.Content: We've been for New Year's Eve 2007-2008 and we felt excellent! Services and personell are ok! Breakfast not included for 145 Euro/Room. Accesss to swimming pool, sauna & gym granted in the same price. Roomy, excellent bath (shower cabine, toillete & bath - separated in the same bath by glass windows), flat LCD 32'' Sony TV included, wireless web access, etc. Location is excellent - direct access from the airport Prat - about 20 min by bus - take line 46 (Plazza Espana). - night busses N13 direct to city center - Subway, L1 and L3, etc. Remember !!!! You will save ~100 Euro if you choose Fira instead of a Rambla Hotel. You will be more satified in a much much cleaner location! Mariana & Ionut Bucharest, Romania

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable... but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Indi1983
Reviews.Content: Having booked the hotel only a couple of weeks before heading out to Barcelona, i thought i'd done pretty well to get a room at this place for 4 nights. It is in a good location; not too far from the centre of Barcelona (i.e. Ramblas) which was only a 10 minute metro ride away. Metro station (Espanya) only 5 minutes walk through a safe and well lit neighbourhood with the huge Fira exhibition centre, beautiful art museum and magic fountain nearby (which was not working by the way!). The rooms were big and very clean. Yes, the beds were a little hard but not uncomfortable. I had no problems sleeping! The bathroom was great which a nice shower with side jets. This was great after so much siteseeing/walking over 4-5 days. The only bad points about the hotel were certain amenities. Firstly, there is no kettle for making tea or coffee in any of the rooms and the hotel cannot supply them on request. I thought this a bit odd as i have stayed in my fair share of hotels and everyone from the very expensive to low budget have supplied these. It's a small thing but in the morning or after a day of sightseeing, to be able to make your own hot drink would be nice instead of having to go to cafes or the hotel bar all the time. The second issue i had was that without realising i had booked a rate without breakfast. Eating breakfast at the hotel is a crazy 15 euros per person! For business travellers this would be ok, but for leisure, no chance! Therefore another inconvenience of having to find somewhere to have breakfast each day. Luckily there are lots of nice cafes nearby the Espanya Metro station whwere you can get tea and croissant for less that 10 euros for 3 people! Sorry to ramble on. All in all the stay at the hotel was very nice. It just would have been better with the above not being issues.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stay - The very best!”
Reviews.Author: YorkieAl
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a 4-day (three nights) short break to Barcelona, we booked the Fira Palace online , got a rate of £210 and were delighted with the results. I'm not the best at writing these reviews so I'll share my experience in sections instead: LOCATION The F.Palace is away from the hustle of the main tourist attractions but ideal for a relaxing stay. Taxi's wait outside the hotel ALL DAY and the main metro staion Espanya is a five minute walk, from there you can reach any part of the City in under 15 minutes. Personally I wouldnt like to stay on La Ramblas is it's a little crazy on a night. HOTEL The building itself is lush! Huge, marble floors, three elevators and the interior just screams class! We didnt use the leisure facilites or the bar but both looked very nice (altough I'm told its very expensive) . ROOMS As a 24-year old I've not had the luxury of experiencing such high standards before, this blew my socks off! The room's are HUGE, two kingsize beds, big screen LCD flat TV, minibar ( expensive but not as bad as I'd expect ) and plenty of wardrobe space. The Bathrooms are a class above too; twin sinks, shaving mirror, seperate bath, beday, and the shower is one of those 'hydroshowers' which has jets comeing from the sides as well as from the shower head above! Barcelona as a place is amazing! We're both football fans and took in the Barcelona Vs Almeria game on the Sunday night, even if youre not into football - get yourself there! It's an overwhelming experience! FIRA PALACE - we shall be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bathroom and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: IndoPolska
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that is well worth the bang for your buck (We paid 99 Euros for 1 night). The shower area has multiple shower heads which made this stay worth it. The location is a bit isolated, especially with all the construction going on around the building but I would think this will clear up soon. A very comfortable room and a bit of a American feel, in terms of service and style.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but so-so restaurants”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fira Palace for nearly a week. This hotel is extremely convenient to the convention center (the Fira), and close to a subway station. The rooms were very well appointed and large by European standards. The lobby and public spaces were large and elegant. Most of the staff spoke English, which was a plus for us. The biggest disappointment by far were the restaurants and bar. Breakfast featured a complete buffet which was OK. However the food at dinner in the restaurant was adequate at best. It featured local dishes, but the preparations were unexciting. In Barcelona, with its wonderful local cuisine, this was a big disappointment. On the other hand, the restaurant had a large selection of inexpensive but excellent Spanish wines. The bar off of the lobby was high priced and the staff was indifferent to the point of rudeness. Stay here for the rooms and location and skip the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Stay at the Fira”
Reviews.Author: TripReady
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Fira Palace. Fifteen minutes from the airport. Not in the center of Barcelona but a ten minute bus ride, with the bus stop right across the street from the hotel. If not up to a easy bus ride, taxis are always parked outside of the hotel. The staff were friendly and accomodating. Provided exact directions and gave great resturant recommendations. One of Barcelona magnificent attractions is down the street from the hotel, Museu Nacional D'Art of Catalunya. At night the gorgeous water fountaions light up, a spectacular display. The rooms were spacious, clean but the bed too hard. Bathroom shower needed a shower curtain but no big deal because another bathroom shower stall had a glass door. Every morning found myself at the three floor gym to get a great workout or taking a drip in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fira Palace met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Stanislov
Reviews.Content: Spent four days/nights at the Fira Palace with a friend from Chicago who was in Barcelona for a medical conference. It turned out that the location of the conference was quite a distance away, but since I wasn't attending (and he was there for only one day), I didn't mind. I had been a little concerned about the hotel's location being away from the "action", and while it's true, you're not in the center of the City near the star attractions, I liked that it wasn't in the thick of things. Barcelona's metro system is fantastic, and we took it everywhere. It took about 10 min to get to Placa de Catalunya. And you're about 150 m away from the Magic Fountain and Montjuic and all that it offers. Coming from one night at the Barceo Sants, I can say the Fira Palace is infinately better: the rooms are quite large for Barcelona standards, the washrooms are huge. The staff at reception were very helpful in suggesting restaurants to us, which was no easy feat due to La Merce Festival that week (restaurants were either booked solid or closed for the holiday). The elevators did break down a couple of times while we were there (and the staff seemed lost in what to do), but other than that no complaints. Since I wasn't paying for the room there, I can't honestly comment on value. I do highly recommend a nearby restaurant - "Elche" at Vila i Vila 71 - excellent tapas and paella!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: Niamh12345
Reviews.Content: My partner, 12 year old son & I stayed here for three nights (after staying in Gerona for a couple of nights). The hotes is very near the Sants train station, which was handy, but complicated traffic systems meant that what would be a short walk was a much longer drive. the hotel is situated in a fairly working-class residential area close to the Parallel street. Evening walking in the area felt slightly scary. The entrance lobby to the hotel is huge, with a real 5 star appearance. There is a tiny gift shop which is actually not too bad for last minute trinkets etc, though the very nice sales assistant took absolutely ages rummaging around for gift wrap to wrap each individual gift; nice touch but too too slow. The check in/out was slow, with very impersonal & uninterested staff. Lifts up to the room were a little slow, & the room we had (supposedly a slight upgrade from standard) was at the end of very long corridors. The room was very spacious, as advertised. The room had 2 queen size beds, which posed a bit of a problem. When I mentioned this to reception they seemed unwilling to do anything for us, though I did not push the issue. A queen size bed (about 4 foot wide I think) isn't big enough for my partner & I to sleep in comfortably, being used to standard double at least (4 foot 6 inches) or our own king size (5 foot wide). The other bed was for my son. So over the three nights we experimented with the format. Overall, though the beds were individually very comfortable, this was not satisfactory. The Bathroom, and indeed the hotel overall, looked like it had been built/designed in the 70's as a 5* luxury hotel, but now although not too shabby it does feel a little dated. The shower was merely satisfactory. The toiletries were ok. The minibar was full of the usual highly priced items which I refuse to purchase. There was a bottle of water (bizarrely, from Norway) on the bedside locker, looked more like a bottle of aftershave. This had a price sticker on it of 2.80 Euro. The chambermaids were a little too enthusiastic about arriving early, and knocked several times before we had gone out of the room for the day. Also, during our three days there we had two separate incidents of staff walking in unannounced while we were in the room. Despite the mini hallway entry to the room with a second door, the carpeted coridor seemed to produce a lot of noisy people & staff banging doors etc. We tried out the pool on one occasion. Tthis is in the hotel but is part of a separate gym which is open to the public members. The pool looked like any municipal pool, but was fine; no-one but us in it at the time. We didn't eat in the hotel at all, but there was a nice enough restaurant about 20 yards from the hotel front door. I can't remember the name of it, but beside it was a fairly expensive fish restaurant that looked great but was full when we tried to eat there. Checking out was painfully slow, but we were able to leave our bags in the storage facility while we did some more sightseeing, we collected our luggage later (had to queue again) & asked the porter to get us a taxi. This involved him standing out in the street trying to see if he could hail one, which took a good 5 minutes & we could have probably done this ourselves. Overall it was comfortable but not fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: benbLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my wife and two children and can highly recommend it. Kids under 12 stay free in parents' room and the bedrooms are vast. Great bathroom, too, marble everywhere, and superb separate shower with powerful body jets. Staff are friendly; on site car park that charges 16 euros per day. Hotel rates a bargain for this sort of hotel - it's officially four stars but could easily pass for five. Breakfast extra, 15 euros for adults, half price for kids. But lovely little bakery across the road which has fresh croissants, pastries etc every morning if you want to save some euros. Bus 55 stops outside the hotel and takes you to La Ramblas in around seven minutes. Hotel quite close to the Nou Camp - Barcelona FC's famous ground - and a tour is a must. Around 55 euros for two adults and two kids. Only tiny drawback of hotel is it's modern design - it was constructed in 1992 - so doesn't have classic Spanish look, with balconies, wrought iron etc. Ask for room high up on the car park entrance side of the hotel, much better views. Lots of internet cafes nearby, cheapest we found was 50 cents for 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harryt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days with 2 children and loved it.Rooms were huge and spotlessly clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Pool was nt huge but great to get in and relax after hours walking around Barcelona. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Don't bother looking anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: kmdinparis
Reviews.Content: We have been lucky enough to take several vacations in Europe this summer. The Fira Palace in Barcelona is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. The room was very large, with two full/queen beds, sofa, desk, flat screen, etc, etc. The room and amenities were just as nice as the five star hotel we looked into, but the beds were bigger, and more comfortable, ( and if you've read the other reviews, yes the sheets are REALLY nice!). The bathroom was superb, with body sprays in the shower, and a full set of toiletries on the marble vanity. The executive rooms have bathrobes, and extra amenities as well. The front desk and service personelle were helpful, and friendly, and all spoke English. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Oh, let me not forget the price. We paid two star prices for what we considered a five star experience! It was in a lovely area, with a fabulous bakery across the street. Thus we did not choose their breakfast. We also did not have time to use the pool or gym. Some complain of the location, but a taxi stand is in front of the door, the bus stops a few meters away, and the metro station is about two blocks. What we would pay in taxi, bus/ metro fare, we saved in the super price of the hotel! We brought a car, and the car park opens into the lower level of the hotel. Super safe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel All Round”
Reviews.Author: jimbo2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August 2007. The hotel is situated in a quiet suburb of Barcelona and is within easy reach of a couple of Metro stations and bus routes. The rooms are very spacious and air conditioned. The pool is adequate and the gym facilities are good. It is an easy walk into the Rambla area of the city from the hotel or you could use the Metro (3 stops to La Rambla area). There is a fantastic restaurant just down the road from the hotel called 'La Canota' which offers extremely good value fr money and friedndly staff. The range of food at La Canota is good and the Seafood Paella is a must! On the Av. Paral.lel there are various pizza bars, tapas bars so there is no need to go right into the city to eat. The Parc Montjuic is approx 100m away from the hotel and on Thur, Fri, Sat nights you can walk there to watch the Magic Fountain, with lights and music. There is a pastry shop just opposite the hotel which is also excellent and good value for money. The only down side that we found to the hotel was that there is no kettle and tea/coffee in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel....not centrally located.---at all!”
Reviews.Author: ntm4
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Very quiet section of the city. 3 adults stayed in one room. The rooms were large and clean. The bathroom was huge also. The only downside is that this hotel is NOT centrally located. We live in NYC and walk everywhere and felt the hotel was NOT near any of the attractions. Be prepared to take the metro and or a taxi EVERYWHERE! The fountains (at night) are near the hotel and this is one attraction that is within a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Rossy Boy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fira Palace was all that you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms were spacious, well equipped and cleaned daily. Heard no noise from outdoors or neighbouring rooms and good air conditioning. Friendly English speaking staff with excellent service within the bar and reception areas. Indoor pool and gym facilities of a high standard. Good location for the fountains (2 minute walk), Montjuic (behind the hotel) and Harbour, Ramblas etc (5 minutes by taxi costing 6-7 euros). One thing that was advertised at the time of booking - was complimentary coffee in reception. This was not the case as they only provided this for Delta airline staff! Overall though we were very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, good location - gym & pool of poor standards”
Reviews.Author: mijansso
Reviews.Content: Fira Palace is excellently located very near Avenida Paral.lel, close to all major central Barcelona areas (plus a subway station is just few hundred meters away from hotel). This hotel has some of the finest, best rooms I have seen in any hotel in Spain in its price range - rooms are large & spacious, well-lit, and marble bathrooms offer separate enclosures for toilet, bath and shower for added privacy. All the hotel's amenities were very good - the only thing that stops me from giving this hotel full 5 stars is the gym/swimming pool - these facilities are NOT AT ALL on the same level of standards as the rest of the hotel!!! Swimming pool was dirty and delapitated, and gym was also like from early 70's. Fully & highly recommend the hotel for those who do not care about the gym & pool (well, at least these facilities exists...).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tottie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fira Palace for 2 nights last week with my 18 year old neice. When we checked in - a room with 2 beds wasnt available, however, the receptionist phoned housekeeping and after 15 minutes a room was available. Room was large - 2 queen beds, table and 2 chairs, flat screen TV, 2 seater sofa. bathroom a reasonable size - 2 showers, 2 sinks, seperate toilet with BDay. Fairly good location - used the metro. Swimming pool on ground floor - have to wear swimming caps but hotel provided those and towels. In the lobby there is complementary water and coffee and biscuits at various times through the day. Top of the reception desk sweets and fruit. Breakfast wasnt included in the price - 15 euros each but did include champagne, smoked salmon, various cooked items as well as continental fare. Overall felt it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: haasenpher
Reviews.Content: The perfect Thanksgiving break. The hotel has everything you could dream of. Within walking distance (5 min) to the locals shopping district and the city bus tour. Cab fares were relatively cheap for after hours clubbing. The hotel is a true 5* hotel (American standards). I was there for 4 days with 3 friends in 1 room. The room had 2 queen size beds and a sofabed. The bathroom was equipped with a shower and tub. And the all inportant double sink and large mirror for 4 females. The only thing that we would have liked was to have the pool open later than 10pm. Not a great location if planning to really enjoy the club scene since you are a bit away from downtown Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace is a nice hotel located directly next to the fair (which can be good and bad - especially when you are there 5 days before the int'l car show). It's in town, but we spent quite some money on taxis to go to various locations. Rooms are really large, bed is hard (which I like), bathroom could be better organized (large but shower is small). The breakfast is quite OK, the food (conference) was too - but not very diverse. The bar could improve (only basic cocktails and some cheap crackers). The staff was cool and spoke pretty good english for Spain. Overall I really liked the hotel, but it wasn't cheap (160E/night one month in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeClarkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in the Fira Hotel in BArcelona. Rooms were exceptionally large with a beautiful bathroom. Breakfast was excellent with an extensive choice of dishes. Location was perfect in the centre of barcelona, beside the Plaza Espanya. Parking for guests is 16 euro per day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Fira”
Reviews.Author: Fizzy-MoonPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May as part of a conference. Very spacious rooms & as mentioned previously spacious bathrooms with separate shower & bath & toilet/bidet. What everyone has failed to mention, however, is that if you actually want to take a shower in the bath (as a shower head is provided) you end up wetting the entire floor as no shower curtain/screen has been provided. In addition, if everyone is using the shower at the same time (or just your neighbouring room) your shower pressure cuts down significantly to a trickle - barely enough to wash the shampoo from your hair! One last gripe, the bed itself is the hardest I have encountered on my travels, a point that a 4 star hotel should really address. After all, if you can't have a comfortable bed & good shower, what else is there to a hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jlvetock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two year old daughter last week. Got a great deal going through the hotel's website--much better than any search/travel site. The rooms are HUGE and the bathrooms are immaculate. Easy walk to the Metro which takes you anywhere in the city. A little away from the main attractions but for us it was great as it was quieter than being near the nightlife. Staff very friendly. Separate bath and shower areas.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Recommended for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Wingwing
Reviews.Content: I stayed there because I have to attend a conference at this hotel. It is spacious, clean, staff is helpful and the room is equipped with wireless internet access. Breakfast is okay, the piano bar is nice too. It is some distance from the main shopping area, I needed to take 5-6 Euros taxi to get to De Glacia Street. Though it is quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: BartDM
Reviews.Content: A good hotel, located close to some major Barcelona attractions. Very good sized rooms and a hell of a bathroom (with bath and separate shower), they also offer a good and decent priced wireless access. Some remarks however are that the restaurant's choice is a bit limited, and the breakfast could be better and a bit more offerings. The staff are very helpful and friendly- even if your spanish is limited or non-existing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CatherineB
Reviews.Content: The Fira Palace is not bang in the centre of Barcelona but is a few minutes away by taxi or underground so it is in a peaceful area of the city but close enough to enjoy all the action. The staff were very friendly and helpful from the reception to the lovely bar tenders (very large measures served too). The room was enormous too and the bed very comfortable. I would recommend the Bus Turistic sightseeing bus which has a hop on hop off system and covers every part of the city. The underground is also easy to use and efficient. I would also recommend the Taxidermista restaurant in the Placa Reial which served the best steak my husband has ever tasted!

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended”
Reviews.Author: Gerlad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Fira Palace for two nights at the end of March/start of April and have to say I was pleased overall. The hotel was only a short stroll to Plaza Espanya which is well connected to the rest of the city by metro and is also serviced by the tourist bus. We were well treated and on arrival the hotel were very helpful as we had to dart to a FC Barcelona game due to our delayed flight. The receptionist checked us in quickly and offered to take our bags direct to our room and order us a taxi to the ground. This was a great help. The pool in the morning was fine but I was a bit perturbed about the cleaner using pool water to clean the walkways around the pool by dipping her bucket into the water and then mopping around. Something didn't seem right about this!! Rooms were massive and bathrrom was excellent with bidets, power shower and separate room for toilet and for shower. However beds were very hard and I had a bad night's sleep due to this and some of the paper thin walls letting in noise. I didn't use the local restaurant as I felt 15euro per head for the buffet breakfast was a bit excessive. However the options outside of the hotel aren't great with basically one or two small (and expensive!) tapas bars available.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: upper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in March, 2007, including attending a conference. The property is fairly well situated, as described in previous posts. It is possible to walk into the Barri Gothic, though you've got to want to walk - 40 minutes and not much to see. The room was huge, by European standards, and well appointed. Internet access (extra fee) was fine and the overall amenities were great. I considered sleeping on the floor, however, thinking it might be a little softer than the bed. Either I was too fatigued or got used to it - the last night I slept fine. Meeting arrangements were very good. Overall, an Ok place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “win some lose some”
Reviews.Author: strawbear
Reviews.Content: win some lose some is the best way to sum this hotel up rooms first class very spacious and superb bathroom the only problem was the lack of tea and coffee in the room a minor point for some people but for me important food only averege breakfast choice dissapointing for hot food choice restaraunt food again nicely presented and served but not very inspiring lesuire club just about ok but lift broken down so had to go up and down from reception to book in not happy about being asked to leave room key as deposit for the cap and towel lobby very clean and tidy piano bar nice but no piano player overall good spot to explore the city superb rooms but food coulld be a lot better suggest guests book bed and breakfast only

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my business stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovvers
Reviews.Content: I came here for a conference. Last time I stayed in Barcelona, I was in cheapo accommodation, so it was nice to be in a half decent hotel. The rooms were very spacious (2 king size beds), telly, minibar, very nice bathoom with jet sprays in shower, bidet, the works. View from the room was not exciting, but did enjoy it as a business hotel. The walls of the rooms are paper thin though. I thought people were in my room, when it was simply the cleaner next door or a neighbour guest in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gyngefungo
Reviews.Content: I am writing this using the wireless internet available in the entire hotel. This hotel was really a pleasant sureprise, it was quite cheap, and the rooms are very spacious, and I am in standard room. Unlike some reviewers I have not had any problems with the staff not speaking english, as a matter of fact I am yet to talk to anybody here that did not speak english. One drawback that other reviewers also have mentioned is the fact that the gym doesn't open before 9am and closes already at 10pm at weekdays - opening hours are even more limited on weekends. That said the gym has all the equipent you could imagine, I think the gym is actually open to locals also and it is probably not even run by the hotel which explains why it is so well equiped as it has to compete with other local gyms. The hotel is located 500 meters from Plaze Espanya which is not too close to La Rambla, but it works for me, the metro can take you there directly in no time. The view in my room is nothing special, so try to get a room facing towards the mountain. All in all except for the limiting opening hours of the gym, I am very happy with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “In Barcelona stay at the Fira Palace”
Reviews.Author: TerryGranade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fira Palace Hotel 18-20 Oct 2006. The property was very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Needed a reservation at the 4Gats and the hotel staff secured it. Wine buckets, ice, and extra pillows (you know these hotels with flat pancake pillows) were no problem. The restaraunt even made ice tea for me at breakfast. Fira Palace has a buffett. Try the donut shop across the street. The owner speaks perfect English and very friendly. Close to the Metro and the HopOn-HopOff Tourist bus at Placa Espanya. The hotel is close to the Convention Center and Placa Espanya.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed Business Traveler...”
Reviews.Author: globalbiztrav
Reviews.Content: I'm an executive and frequent business traveler for a Fortune 50 company based in NYC and have stayed in a wide variety of hotels across the globe, ranging from business to luxury class. The Fira Palace Hotel was recommended to our team for a Barcelona meeting, as we're a rather large group, and the reviews posted thus far on TripAdvisor didn't seem so bad. (The worst I saw was a comment about the rock-hard beds - quite accurate but manageable). However, those reviews fail to capture some real problems here, particularly for the business traveler. First, the gymnasium opens at 9 am, precisely the time that your meetings will have begun, so don't bother packing the sneakers and shorts. Second, room service (other than light fare) is available on a very limited "restaurant style" schedule - open only for several hours in late afternooon and late evening, and is closed all other times. Besides that, the menu offerings are incredibly limited, and unacceptable for a city business hotel. Third, English is not spoken by a large percentage of the staff, which is fine for meetings of local travelers but doesn't work well for an international gathering. I could go on and on, but will spare you the details. What's more, the staff and management were entirely unapologetic for these shortcomings, and seemed to suggest that the issues cited were perfectly reasonable, at least for the Spanish business traveler. (My condolences to the Spanish!) Be that as it may, I will recommend that my organization do no further business with this establishment, and I would caution international business travelers to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fira...nice but a bad taste”
Reviews.Author: JenMoody
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Rooms were quite nice...very big, the bathrooms were huge and magnificent (tub, seperate room for toilet and seperate huge shower with jets!). Yes the beds were too hard for my liking, but my spouse didn't mind. The location is fine...it is really only a 5 min walk to one of two metro stations (one the green line, which leads right to las ramblas, and gets you there in less than ten mins) Regarding previous reviews about the location and the metro being hard to navigate, well, they must not metro much. It was very straigtforward and the 2 and 3 days passes are very reasonably priced. We did not eat here....breakfast was not in our rate and the room card said the continental breakfast was 14.95 euros...ridiculous...not a chance. The hotel itself was very nice...what bugged me was the service. We booked early and got a rate of 129 Eur, no breakfast. Two days before we left the listed rates had dropped to 99 Euros including breakfast. I emailed the hotel and requested the new rate. They did not answer my email. When we arrived I discussed this with the front desk, and was told tough luck, too bad, 72 hour cancellation if you don't like it you will be charged half of your three nights at the original rate. So walking out wasn't really an option. With regard to other requests, the front desk staff were not very knowledgeable. The gondola at the waterfront is closed for a while for renovations....after reading something that alluded to this, but hearing the front desk recommend it to another patron we asked. This guy said he didn't know and because it was a holiday, there was no way to find out (from any other staff or any other means). Ok? The last morning the girl on the front desk kindly circled where to catch the airport bus (5 min walk)...too bad it was the wrong place....we spotted the bus stopped around the corner from where she directed us. Oi. To top it all off, arriving home there was an email message from the hotel hoping that we had enjoyed our stay and welcoming and comments or questions. So they will email uselessness in the name of providing "the best service", but they won't answer your email if you are asking them to honor the best rate available two days before arrival. My advice, don't book far ahead, or if you do, recheck the rate 73 hours before and if it's much better, cancel and rebook. That would have saved us 90 euros! The hotel rating would have been a 5, the service disappointment dropped it to a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there with small kids”
Reviews.Author: stcdub
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 5 day break in Barcelona, staying at the Fira Palace Hotel with husband and 2 young children (6 and 2). Chose the hotel based on reviews here, but found it difficult to find advise from other familes travelling with small children. We were happy with our chose as we fit comfortably into 1 standard room, including a cot. Beds were very comfortable (some people actually have a preference for hard beds) and bathroom was enormous (separate bath and shower and double sink). We could not hear other guests, so assume no-one was disturbed by our 2 screaming and jumping on the beds! Minibar fridge, though large, was not cold, so difficult to store milk, snacks etc. and there was no kettle for heating bottle (we did request this, but it was not available). Front desk staff were not overly friendly but were efficient and dealt with all requests expediently (extra towels, pillows etc.) We found the location convenient and used the metro throughout our stay (it was a little walk away, but if you don't like walking you should choose another city). Metro was not very buggy-friendly but we had got a new light-weight one and got great exercise carrying it and baby up and down several flights of stairs in and out of the stations. Also availed of the Bus Touristic and would advise doing this over 2 days. A visit to the zoo is also essential, though bring a picnic as the foods' not great.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterUKJimmy_H
Reviews.Content: We booked into the hotel and decided to have a rest before exploring Barcelona. Three hours later we had to book out of the hotel because we just could not sleep on the rock hard beds ( Room 405 ) and the manager refused to move us to a different room saying that all the beds were the same. I have read all the positive reviews and have decided that these must in fact be posted by the hotel. I do not believe that anyone would be able to sleep on these beds................. Apart from this the hotel seemed to be very pleasant if a little further from the centre of Barcelona that we expected

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 wonderful days in Barcelona, including our stay at the Hotel Fira Palace. The hotel was one of the most quiet I have ever stayed in--we heard virtually no noise while in the room. The staff were courteous and accomodating, and given it was out first trip to Europe we had lots of silly questions (How do we work the shower? The lights?). I had heard from a family member that many European hotels have poor air conditioning, but the Fira Palace was comfortable in all areas. It is off the beaten path but situated next to the beautiful National Palace and Magic Fountains. We enjoyed walking past them on our way to and from the Metro station each day. There is a convenience store down the street (and on the right hand side) directly in front of the hotel. Just before the grocery store is an internet cafe which costs only 30 euros for 30 minutes of use. The hotel restaurant had a limited menu for lunch and dinner, but what we had was very good. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Watch out for pickpockets while on the metro, including teenaged girls.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a weekend break. Although at first we thought it was a little far away from the main sights, it turned out to be a perfect location. You can walk from here up to the Miro museum and through a lovely park, and there are several metro stations within 5-10 mins walk. The hotel was extremely clean and spacious, there is a gym and pool downstairs, and even spinning classes, although we didn't get time to do any of this. We did plenty of walking instead as it's the best way to see Barcelona! We had breakfast in the hotel one morning, and it was superb, lots of choice and all very fresh. The bathroom was extremely spacious with a separate walk in shower which was extremely welcome after a day sightseeing. We mainly ate down at the Olympic Port area, as the fish there was superb. I'd definitely recommend taking a bus tour, where you can hop on and off throughout the day, some of the sights are far away from the centre so it's a nice way to see the city whilst getting to the sights. We'd read alot about pickpockets in Barcelona, but we felt safe, just use the normal precautions you would in any big city and you'll have a fabulous time. We'll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: RodWebb
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay in Stiges, we returned to Barcelona for one night before travelling to Paris. The Fira Palace was excellent - the location is within easy walking distance (if you're relatively fit) of many of the tourist attractions, including La Ramblas. It's very close to the Spanish Village, which is worth a visit. The room was spacious and had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in - though judging by the previous reviewer's comments, not to everyone's taste. It was also quiet - I'd recommend asking for a room at the back - not pretty but very quiet. Staff were pleasant and accommodating and by booking in advance we got a great rate. On the downside, the restaurant food was only average, and the hotel isn't the prettiest ever on the outside. Nevertheless I'd definitely stay here again when returning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location”
Reviews.Author: ekatzen
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona on holiday for 4 nights. As soon as we arrived at the Fira Palace we began to suspect that we had made a mistake in choosing this hotel. It is a business hotel located next to the Fira Barcelona which is a huge facility that hosts trade fairs. There is nothing appealing within walking distance, and navigating to the subway (a 10 minute walk at least) was difficult. Cab fare to La Rambla was 7 Euros which means you have 14 Euros in transportation expense every time you venture out unless you like to walk in which case it takes 30-40 minutes each way. In addition to the unfortunate location, the bed was as hard as a slab of granite which made any activity other than actually sleeping impossible and sleeping itself was difficult. The hotel staff were indifferent and there was no doorman to help with luggage. After one night we moved to Hotel 1898 for a few Euros more and were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, but Price Must be Reasonable First”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights (a romantic trip). The rooms are certainly clean and spacious, but getting a little dated. I felt that I got the best price by booking directly through the Fira Palace website (& not in my case by using the hotel booking internet sites). The restaurant was too quiet for our liking and the drinks in the bar quite expensive. However, the room price was much better value than other 4 star hotels that I had enquired about. The Taxi fare to main tourists spots a very reasonable 6 Euro approx. and to the airport 18.50 euro. Not the place to stay if you want to walk out directly onto the shopping streets (as it is located in a business area, along a quiet side street), but if you want peace and quiet in your hotel room, I was not disturbed once either night or morning which was a godsend to us! Easy to find from the Plaza Espana (a 5 min. walk) and the bus costs 3.75 each to Plaza Espana from the main airport (another bonus).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane-line-dancer
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. It was clean, spacious, comfortable huge beds, large bathroom, quiet, even blackout curtains so the light didn't wake you. Breakfast was included in our deal and was amazing. Fresh pineapple, 2 types of melon, papaya, kiwi, orange. Freshly sqeezed orange juice, peach juice, tea, coffee, breads, cereals, cakes, cheese, parma ham, smoked salmon and all the cooked stuff too. You're free to take what you want. Swimming pool we didn't use and its not always available due to lessons but it looked good, also lots of fitness machines. It's a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro stop and they are so frequent you're in Ramblas in about 10 minutes door to door. Its nice to get away from the crowds in the evening and have a quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brasco88
Reviews.Content: I am a little confused as to why the reviewer below gave this hotel 5 stars as they didn't seem to like it at all! Myself and my husband however, loved this hotel. From when you walk in the entrance, the reception is beautiful.We stayed here 3 weeks ago in a superior room and didnt once smell sewers. The bathroom was big, with separate bath and shower cubicle, which was lovely. The staff we spoke to/met incuding the manager were all well spoken in English and very friendly and helpful. The food was very nice too. Would definately stay here again. Nice big bed!

Reviews.Title: “Less than mediocre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fira Palace in Barcelona for 6 nights in March 2006 and we would definitely not stay there again. We were there for business and so we were able to compare our experience with others staying there at the same time. The pros: The rooms were spacious, and the windows to the outside were very sound-proofed while still being able to open for fresh air, close to Montjuic. The cons: The bathrooms smelled so bad we had to keep the door closed to our room (they smelled like sewer gas and everyone we knew staying there said the same of their rooms), the shower would not keep a constant water temperature no matter what time of day it was (fluctuated between icy cold and scalding hot water), the staff was not helpful and made almost no attempt to try and speak English (which was very strange for a business hotel), the cleaning staff was extremely loud in the hallways at all hours, the room service is very expensive (11 euros for a cheese sandwich), there were no irons in the rooms (again, strange for a business hotel) and when we called to get one, they insisted taking it back each day, not close to anything except Monjuic. Overall, the hotel was less than mediocre. We would not stay there again even if the hotel was paid for. We may have also been a little jaded because we had just come from Amsterdam and had stayed in a great hotel there (the Ambassade), but we are not the types that demands perfection from a hotel...but this did not even come close to decent.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: Piqua41
Reviews.Content: Great location near a Metro stop, Montjuic, and the Catalan Art Museum. Convenient parking beneath the hotel. Luxurious, four-star hotel with helpful front desk staff. Huge rooms, especially for Europe. Within walking distance of much in this beautiful, hilly city. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicmerson
Reviews.Content: As I used this service as a basis for choosing this hotel, I only thought it fair to leave some feedback. I was not disappointed. Stayed there for four nights and could only grumble at two things - the smell of the drains (which seems to be part of Barcelona) and the fact that the room was not attended to on one day. On the plus side, the rooms are large and airy with excellent blackout curtains for a good nights sleep, the air-con worked a treat in 30 degree C temperatures, the swimming pool is very nice and the staff are most attentive. It is situated close to Placa de Espanya which is 3 stops on the excellent Metro system to La Rambla and served by the direct Airbus to El Prat Airport (a 15-20 minute ride costs 3.60 Euros) yet it is far enough away from the centre to escape the noise and pollution. It is also a short walk from Parc Montjuic, the Olympic Stadium and the Magic Fountains. It is a quality hotel - don't be afraid to book there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable stay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staying for 4 nights in late May, my girlfriend and I found the Fira to be an excellent hotel to complement our visit to Barcelona, for a moderate price. Rather than rant on, I'll list the most important points you'll no doubt want to read! * Location - Adequate. Certainly not central, but it is in a safe area and within easy reach of everywhere you want to go in Barcelona. It is right next to the Fountains at Montjuic, which was breathtaking at night, especially having explored the city by day. I would say the only reason for staying closer would be if you *hate* any kind of walking or if you are elderly or have a disability. Public transport is so close, you can get anywhere you like within 20 minutes. The beach is around 25 minutes' walk away. The airport is a 20 minute taxi ride. * Staff - Reasonable. While they will not exactly fall over themselves to help you (and some seem to take their time), they still meet expected standards. Always a pleasant 'hello' to greet you, which was a nice touch. * Cleanliness - Excellent. Always clean, tidy and well presented, although the legendary 'Spanish drain' smell was there. Ah, you get used to it...after all, you're in Barcelona! * Price - Exceptional. Great value for money, especially when booked through the hotel's website. Will always upgrade when they can (which happened to us and 4 other couples we knew on the weekend)! * Rooms - Definitely some of the biggest I have stayed in. While they have the usual 4-Star feel (you know what I'm talking about), there just seems to be more of it. Bigger beds, more comfortable sofas, more furniture; the room was definitely not without. The 5th floor view over Barcelona was good; I'd advise you to ask for this. * Breakfast - Good. I really enjoyed the variety, having stayed at many far worse 4-Star hotels. Worth investing if you like eating, they usually serve until 10:30! ***Overall: an excellent, clean hotel with a friendly relaxed atmosphere, you cannot help but feel that the Fira is slightly set apart from its other 4-Star peers. Recommended - 8/10.
